loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is a 36 years old, married and has three children. She opened a sari-sari or convenience store to earn a living, and sells a variety of goods to people her neighborhood. Her goal is to increase her income so that she can give her family a good life. She decided to request a loan to buy more items to sell so that she can increase her income. Vivian's goal for the future is to save enough money to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 38 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a candle-making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan from NWTF to buy wax, coloring, wood, and other supplies for candle making. Aida has been in this business for seven years and would like to save enough money to provide a secure future to her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make candles

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en: Virgincita is 61 years old, married and lives in Baybay, Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She earns a living by selling fish in a stall that she owns in a local public market. Her husband is a government employee. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 77 years old, a widow, and a resident of  Palayan, Aloran-Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She has retired from her farming business and is living with one of her children.

Her children live comfortably but she doesn't want to add burdens to their living conditions. Through her pension that she receives, she was able to support her needs, especially her medications.

Before she retired from her farming activities, she was already a member of Paglaum MPC and continuously availed herself of its programs and services. 

Recently, she applied for another loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase maintenance medicines. Through the years, Anecita has maintained her good record with no defaults in payments.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.en:
Maria Paz is 40 years old and married with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maria Paz has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed from NWTF eight times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 39 years old and married, and she lives in Mamanga Gamay, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She owns a fruit stall, which she has been operating for more than 10 years.

Rosalie is the breadwinner of her family. Through this business she is able to support the needs of her family and the studies of her children.

Rosalie is a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC and has repaid previous loans without records of default. Currently, she is availing herself of a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy fresh fruits, like banana, mango, watermelon, avocado and others, in volume.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits, like banana, mango, watermelon, avocado and others, in volume

loans.name: Ekih

texts.en:
Ekih is 47 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

Ekih has been in this business for 10 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 51 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josephine has been farming coconut for eight years and also earns income from buying and selling dried coconut meat. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Las Fantasticas Group

texts.es:
Las fantásticas se llama este grupo, es de la ciudad de villa Elisa, es un grupo nuevo, integrado por 16 mujeres, todas ellas mujeres unidas y luchadoras que quieren salir adelante para poder ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Perla es la Tesorera del grupo ella se desempeña como artesana y también tiene una pequeña despensa ella se describe como una mujer luchadora y capaz para poder salir adelante y necesita el préstamo para poder comprar hilos para sus bordados artesanales y como así productos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, panificados, y otros.
Todas ellas están contentas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, ya que con esto podrán mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Fantásticas”, and it is located in the city of Villa Elisa. It’s a new group that comprises sixteen women who are all united and have fighting spirits.  They want to get ahead so that they can help their families.

Señora Perla is the group’s treasurer. She makes handicrafts, and she also has a small grocery store. She is described as a woman with a fighting spirit, intelligent, and able to get ahead. She needs the loan to purchase thread for her embroidery handicrafts, as well as products for her small grocery store, such as beverages, baked goods, and other things.

All of the women are happy for the opportunity that they are receiving, because with it, they will be able to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

loans.use: to purchase thread for handicrafts, as well as beverages, baked goods, and other products to stock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité se lleva por nombre Kuña Guapa es un grupo unido con 20 integrantes, todas son de una zona rural, donde la totalidad de las integrantes se dedican a actividades rurales de cría y venta de animales de corral.
Una de las integrantes que se caracteriza por ser  muy emprendedora es la Sra. Lourdes quien se dedica a la cría de animales, y  vende sus productos como queso, mandioca, verduras y otros.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar animales para la cría, como cerdos y gallinas, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Ella es una persona muy luchadora que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The committee named Kuña Guapa is a united group of 20 members. All of them live in a rural area and work in rural activities like raising and selling farm animals.
  
One of the members who is described as being very enterprising is Lourdes, who raises animals and sells products such as cheese, manioc, vegetables and more. 

She is asking for this loan to buy animals to raise, such as pigs and chickens. This way, she can continue with her work as she has been doing. She is a fighter who puts all of herself into being able to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Mujeres Unidas, este grupo se encuentra en el primer ciclo con 17 integrantes, todas mujeres emprendedoras y con metas propuestas, la de mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del trabajo cooperativo y solidario.
Entre ellas se destaca a la Sra. Maria, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora, que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y mejorar cada día. Ella se dedica a las confecciones y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The committee called Mujeres Unidas ["United Women"] is in first round financing with 17 members. All are women entrepreneurs with proposed goals for improving their living conditions through cooperative and supportive work.

Among them stands out Mrs. Maria, who is the president of this group. She is a very selfless woman and a fighter, who strives to be able to succeed and to improve each day. She makes a living in apparel and through her work she has the means to be able to help her loved ones.

She requests this loan in order to be able to purchase fabric, thread, elastics, buttons, and other supplies, in order to be able to continue sewing. She is grateful for the opportunity to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, elastics, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La Señora Ana tiene 19 años de edad vive actualmente en domicilio alquilado no tiene hijos que depende de ella misma, tiene su esposo el cual trabaja como ayudante de distribuidor de gas, vive en el departamento de Chuquisaca municipio de Monteagudo y trabaja en la misma ciudad. Su principal actividad de la señora es la venta de comida, trabaja arduamente en su actividad de lunes a domingo para cubrir los gastos de alimentación, ropa, servicios básicos, alquiler y otros gastos que incurren en su hogar. La señora Ana necesita acceder a un préstamo mismo que será destinado para la compra de una heladera y compra de utensilios para ampliar su negocio, con la compra de la misma, la señora se siente muy entusiasmada para lograr el préstamo porque aumentará su actividad de venta de comida por lo tanto podrá aumentar de manera eficiente y obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida en su hogar con su esposo.
texts.en:
Ana is 19 years old.  She currently lives in a rented house.  She has no children that depend on her.  She lives with her husband who works as an assistant in gas distribution.  She lives and works in the region of Chuquisaca in the town of Monteagudo. 

She makes her living through the sale of food.  She works diligently at her job from Monday to Sunday, in order to cover the costs of food, clothing, basic services, rent and other expenses incurred in her home.  Ana needs to obtain a loan for the purchase of a refrigerator and utensils to expand her business.  She is very excited to obtain the loan because it will expand her food sales business.  It will allow her to expand in an efficient manner, increase her sales and better her standard of living at home with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and utensils to expand her business and increase her food sales, in order to better her standard of living at home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to increase her production to obtain more orders and in this way improve her quality of living.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of lottery tickets.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erlinda is 55 years old, and three of her children are still in school.

Erlinda has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Erlinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor, un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo, rodeado de gente trabajadora, el mismo cuenta varios sitios de descanso que son muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, como tradición tienen las fiestas del Cantón en las cuales se realizan bailes populares y la famosa quema del castillo la gente en este Cantón es muy amable y tranquila con todos sus visitantes.
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio de venta de pitzas el señor Carlos un joven luchador de  20 años soltero no tiene cargas familiares, aprendió esta actividad por su hermano ya que él también se dedicaba a esta actividad pero decidió independizarse y ahora tiene su propia clientela, a este negocio le dedica todos los fines de semana ya que esos días hay más afluencia de gente, los otros días de la semana trabaja como ayudante de albañilería, Carlos viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos, parte de su vida a trabajado para ayudar a sus padres. 
Solicita el crédito para fortalecer su negocio de pitzas arreglando y ampliando el mismo, con esta nueva inversión incrementara sus ventas y podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Carlos agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad que le están brindando para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young, 20-year-old fighter who is single and doesn't have any dependents.He lives in the canton of San Miguel de los Bancos where he also works in his pizza selling business. The canton of San Miguel de los Bancos, known as the Cantón del Amor [Canton of Love], has a warm, humid climate. It is made up of hardworking people and has many recreational sites that are frequently visited by domestic and foreign tourists. As part of tradition, the canton festivals are celebrated during which popular dances are performed as well as the famous burning of the castle of fireworks. The people of this canton are very friendly and relaxed with all of their visitors.

Carlos learned the pizza selling business from his brother who also works in this business but decided to become independent and now has his own clientele. Carlos works in his business every weekend since it is during these days that people have more cash flow. The other days of the week he works as a bricklayer’s helper. Carlos comes from a low-income family and, for part of his life, he has worked to help his parents. He is asking for a loan to strengthen his pizza business, improving and expanding it. With this new investment, he will increase his sales and will be able to improve his income. Carlos thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and for the opportunity that they are giving him in order to be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to expand his pizza business and increase his clientele and in this way, be able to help his parents with the household expenses.

loans.name: Metria

texts.en:
Metria is 55 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, shampoo, etc.

Metria has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 47 years old, married and from Matco, Panalsalan, Plaridel, Mismais Occidental. She owns and operates an eatery that primarily sell barbecue. She is known for her mouth-watering flavored barbecue. Marilou ventured into this business to support the needs of her family, especially her eldest son to get into college. 

Marilou believes that through her business, together with the financial support of Paglaum MPC, she can make her business successful and at the same time be able to send all her children to school. 

Recently, she took a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional ingredients like meat, soy sauce, oil, and vinegar for her barbecue selling business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, soy sauce, oil and vinegar for her barbecue selling business

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio is 62 years old, married, has two children and lives in Matco, Panalsalan, Misamis Occidental. He is a retired college instructor. He had devoted his prime years in working for the good of his family. 

Now that he has retired, he wishes to live comfortably in his house and has applied for a loan from Paglaum MPC. The amount of PHP 50,000 will be used to purchase bags of cement, plywood, nails, and ceramic tiles, and to pay labor costs for the kitchen repair.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, plywood, nails and ceramic tiles, and to pay labor costs for the kitchen repair

loans.name: Dionisita

texts.en:
Dionisita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dionisita is 64 years old now.

Dionisita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Dionisita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Dionisita has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Dionisita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en: Rodelyn is 28 years old, married, and from Polo, Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is involved in fishing activities and owns a fishing boat. She is supported by her husband, as one of her fishermen. She is in this business so that she can support the needs of her growing family. This type of business gives her a monthly income of 10,000 PHP. Through the programs and services of Paglaum, Rodelyn was able to add one fishing boat. Currently, she uses a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase new fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 63 years old, married and from Mansanbay Bajo, Lopez Jaena-Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has a load (mobile phone credits) retailing business at her place. 

Through this business, she was able to support her farmer husband with the needs of her family. 

Recently, she availed herself of a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase another cellphone for her load retailing business.

loans.use: to purchase another cellphone for her load (mobile phone credits) retailing business

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 40 years old, married, and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena-Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a canteen at the nearby school. She earns a daily income of 1,200 PHP. She also owns poultry and a piggery that contributes to her monthly income. 

Julieta recalls that everything was made possible because of the financial aid from Paglaum MPC. 

This time, she is taking a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase inventory like candies, chocolates, and food ingredients for her canteen business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory like candies, chocolates and food ingredients for her canteen business

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es: María de 42 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad a lado de su grupo familiar conformado por su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que siempre lucha por sacar adelante a su familia gracias a su trabajo el cual consiste en la crianza y venta de pollos es un negocio que realiza desde hace varios años  por lo que cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes. Es de esta manera como ella se gana la vida y junto a su compañero de vida logra solventar los gastos del hogar. María con el deseo de incrementar las ventas de su negocio ha tomado la decisión de invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de pollos, vitaminas y concentrado para la crianza pero debido a que no cuenta con la capacidad económica solicita este crédito a FUSAI para poder así incrementar las ventas de su granja de pollo.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and lives in her own house next to her family group that is made up of her life partner and four children. She is an entrepreneurial woman who always fights to bring her family ahead thanks to her job. Maria works raising and selling chickens, a business she has had for some years now, and has a good number of clients. It is in this way that she makes a living and, together with her life partner, is able to afford the household expenses.

With the hope of increasing the sales of her business, Maria has decided to invest in the purchase of a larger quantity of chickens, vitamins and chicken feed. Because she does not have the economic capacity to do so, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI in order to be able to make this investment and increase the sales of her chicken farm.

loans.use: to buy chickens, vitamins, and chicken feed for the growth of her business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 53 years old, single and lives in Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has been a hog raiser for more that 20 years. Through this business, she was able to build her own house and support her needs. 

Through Paglaum MPC, she uses various loan products that support her business activities. Recently, she took a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional piglets and bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and bags of animal feed

loans.name: Eunice Mae

texts.en:
Eunice Mae is 35 years old, is married and has four children, two of whom are in school.

Eunice Mae is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Eunice Mae requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise livestock.

Eunice Mae has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Eunice Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise livestock

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 36 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Annabelle works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buying and selling of plasticware business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional plasticware to sell.

Annabelle has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional plasticware to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 41 years old and has five children. Ma. Luisa is married, and two of her children are in school.

Ma. Luisa is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ma. Luisa has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda has cultivated a one hectare rice field for 32 years. She is happily married and blessed with two children. Besides farming, she has also engaged herself in the tailoring and dressmaking business for an additional source of income. Minda finished her vocational course in dressmaking and tailoring.

Minda and her husband work together to earn their living. She would like to improve the growth of her rice crops, which is why she is borrowing additional capital of 15,000 PHP. She will use her requested loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay for labor costs in transplanting her farmland. She hopes that with this loan she can generate a better income and yield this next crop season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay for labor costs in transplanting her farmland

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es: Rosalba de 72 años, es una enérgica mujer que se ha dedicado por muchos años al negocio de  la droguería y el laboratorio clínico; para muchos su avanzada edad habría sido un impedimento para alcanzar el éxito, sin embargo con sus ahorros inició esta actividad hace nueve años en Montería un municipio en el Departamento de Córdoba y tiempo después se trasladó a Barranquilla en la zona Norte del Departamento del Atlántico, donde actualmente funciona su negocio en un local que tomó en alquiler.  Su desarrollo ha sido tan sorprendente y muy evolutivo, que formó una sociedad con su hijo, para así poder ofrecer los servicios de laboratorio clínico y una vez se tenga el diagnóstico del paciente, se remiten a su médico para que les formule el tratamiento y Rosalba tenga la oportunidad de comercializarle medicinas a  precios de oportunidad.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de una vitrina para exhibir medicamentos, así mismo surtirá con drogas de alta rotación.  Su meta a futuro es continuar en su negocio trabajando muy comprometida y dinámica para así seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosalba is 72 years old and is an energetic woman who has worked for many years in a drugstore and clinical laboratory.  For many, her advanced age would have been an impediment to achieving success but nonetheless, with her savings, she started her business 9 years ago in Montería, a municipality of the Córdoba province. Some time later, she moved to Barranquilla in the northern part of the Atlántico province, which is where she currently has her business in a storefront, which she rents.

Her growth has been very evolutionary and so surprising that she created a partnership with her son to be able to offer clinical laboratory services and, once a patient’s diagnosis is made, it is forwarded to their doctor so that they can formulate the treatment and Rosalba has the opportunity to sell them medicines at a good price. 

Currently she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will invest in the purchase of a display case to display medicines and similarly stock up on drugs that have a high turnover. Her goal for the future is to continue working in her business, working committed and dynamically in order to continue supporting her children.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a display case to display medicines and similarly stock up with drugs that have a high turnover.

loans.name: Madres Unidas Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Madres unidas” y está conformado por 07 socios comprometidos y responsables. Eulalia de 55 años de edad es separada con 5 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de salchipapa (comida típica del Perú) hace más de 3 años. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio y le va bien se siente feliz porque gracias al préstamo mejora cada día más su calidad de vida. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de papas lechugas y salchichas. El grupo “madres unidas” agradece a las personas de kiva por hacer posible éste crédito. Eulalia se encuentra de pie es la primera del lado derecho y viste chaleco color marrón y gorro rojo.
texts.en:
This is the “Madres Unidas” group, and it is made up of seven dedicated and responsible members.  Eulalia, age 55, is separated, with five children.  She has worked selling salchipapa (a typical food of Peru) for more than three years.  With much effort, she has been able to improve her business, and it’s going well for her.  She feels happy because, thanks to the loan, she improves her quality of life every day.  She will use this latest loan to buy potatoes, lettuce, and sausages.

The “Madres Unidas” group is grateful to the members of Kiva for making this loan possible.  Eulalia is standing, and she is the first on the left, wearing a brown jacket and a red cap.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, lettuce, and sausages.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 33 years old and married. She has five children (four children are in school). Estrella is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Estrella has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to sustain her business.

Estrella requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es:
Más de 13 años tiene Edgar de dedicarse a la agricultura y al ordeño de vacas, negocio que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y ofrecerles oportunidades de crecimiento a sus hijos. Él se siente muy agradecido porque gracias a los financiamientos de MiCrédito pudo mejorar el cercado de sus tierras de siembra y logró comprar una ternera. 
Sin embargo, solicita otro crédito para comprar semillas, abono, fertilizantes, y también, comprará dos terneros para venderlos y así aumentar sus ganancias. Este financiamiento le será de ayuda porque aún no cuenta con el capital necesario para invertir en su negocio. Edgar planea continuar trabajando con MiCrédito.
texts.en:
Edgar decided to start working in agriculture and milking cows more than 13 years ago. This business has allowed him to bring his family forward and offer opportunities for his children to grow. He is very grateful because thanks to his loans from MiCrédito, he was able to improve the fencing around his farmlands and purchase a calf.

Nonetheless, he is seeking another loan to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers and also, to buy two claves to sell and increase his profits. This loan will help him because he does not have the necessary capital to invest in his business. Edgar plans to continue working with MiCrédito.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers and also, to buy two calves.

loans.name: Mea Jiezel

texts.en:
Mea Jiezyl is 29 years old and has two children. She has a live-in partner and both of her children are in school.

Mea Jiezyl is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Mea Jiezyl requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mea Jiezyl has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Mea Jiezyl would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 48 years old, married and comes from Dimalco, Bonifacio-Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a rice field and at the same time has a hog-raising business. She has been into these types of businesses for 20 years and they give her enough income to support her family's needs. Nancy signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC and enjoys various programs and services of the cooperative. Recently, she availed a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Rosa Edit

texts.es:
Rosa Edit tiene 50 años de edad, conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, domicilio en el sector Nueva Esperanza, que pertenece al distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, Costa norte de Perú.La cual es una zona rural, en la que su población se dedica mayormente al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Rosa Edit se dedica a la preparacion y venta de champu con cachangas , hace 15 años, con muy buenas referencias laborales y personales; negocio se encuentra ubicado en un mercado de Oyotún, solicita prestamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, dado que piensa trasladar su negocio a su domicilio, con este crédito podrá dar mejor apariencia de su negocio, generar mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Edit is 50 years old, has a partner and no children in her care, and lives in her own home in the sector of Nueva Esperanza, which pertains to the district of Oyotún in the province of Chiclayo in the northern coast of Peru. This is a rural area where most of the population works in commerce, agriculture or raising livestock.

Rosa Edit works preparing and selling champús (a typical, warm, Peruvian fruit-based dessert) and cachangas (large, Peruvian flat bread). She has been doing this work for 15 years and has many good professional and personal references. Her business is situated in the Oyotún market. She is seeking a loan to purchase construction materials to improve the infrastructure of her home as she is thinking of moving her business to her home. With this loan, she would be able to improve the appearance of her business, increase her profits and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve the appearance of her business.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Ma. Teresa's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: María es una mujer amable y solidaria de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos el mayor de 20 años de edad y los otros cuatro de 17, 15, 11 y 1 años de edad. María sabe que al ser su familia muy numerosa los gastos del hogar son muchos, por lo que buscando estar pendiente de sus hijos y apoyar con la economía de su hogar se gana la vida desde hace 12 años con la venta de petates y la crianza de ganado. María desea mejorar su calidad de vida, y para ello ha decidido invertir en otra ternera y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos, además ha pensado en cambiar algunas láminas de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI el cual le permita invertir en una ternera para la crianza de ganando  y darle una mejor calidad de vida  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a friendly and caring woman, age 39, who lives with her husband and 5 children, the oldest of whom is 20, while the other four are 17, 15, 11, and one.  María knows that, since her family is large, she has many household expenses.  Therefore, seeking to look after her children and support the household economy, she has earned a living for the last 12 years by selling bed mats and raising cattle.  

María wants to improve her quality of life, and therefore, she has decided to invest in another heifer. In this way, she will improve her economic income.  She has also planned to change some metal sheeting on her house.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, which will allow her to invest in another heifer to raise, and will give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in a heifer to raise and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.name: Etanislado

texts.es:
Etanislado es un hombre emprendedor y responsable, se dedica a la producción agropecuaria, y a la vez es comerciante pues tiene una pulpería en la cual ofrece los servicios de molino de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas. Él se siente agradecido con los planes de financiamiento que MiCrédito ofrece porque gracias a estos pudo reparar unas cercas de sus potreros, así como pagarle a unos ayudantes para limpiarlo. 
Sin embargo, solicita un nuevo crédito que lo utilizará para comprar alambre y  grapas, pagarle a unos ayudantes y comprar granos básicos. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá reabastecer su pulpería y  ayudará a que crezca más zacate para alimentar las reses.
texts.en: Estanislado is an enterprising and responsible man. He works in farming and is also a merchant, he has a general store where he has a corn mill which is used to make tortillas. He is grateful with the loan plans that MiCrédito offers because thanks to these loans he was able to repair some fences in his pasture and he was able to pay some assistants to clean it. He is requesting a new loan which he will use to buy wire and staples, to pay some assistants and to buy basic grains. This will be helpful to him because he will be able to restock his store and it will help in growing more grass to feed the cattle.

loans.use: to buy wire and staples, to pay assistants, and to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to set up a sewing business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Nenita was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making a good income these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to purchase buttons, zippers, and textiles and to pay for sewing machine maintenance. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase buttons, zippers, and textiles and to pay for sewing machine maintenance.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. Evans makes a living doing livestock and crop farming. After selling his farm’s produce at a local market, he uses the income to run his business and meet his family’s basic needs.

The challenge common to rural smallholder farmers that Evans is facing is the expensive cost of transporting goods to the market. Most farmers resort to dealing with brokers at the cost of being exploited.

Evans is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle all kinds of terrain. With this asset, Evans will be able to transport his produce to formal markets where he will get a better price for his produce.

Your loan investing into Evans' business will elevate his family’s livelihood and generate more income for them to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ada Sarai

texts.es: Ada de 29 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su familia la cual está compuesta por su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ada es una mujer emprendedora que día a día lucha por sacar a su familia por medio de su negocio de crianza y venta de pollos los cuales distribuye con sus vecinos y de forma ambulante en el mercado más cercano a su comunidad, es de esta manera como ella por medio de esta actividad obtiene los ingresos que le permiten llevar hasta su hogar el pan de cada día. Ada con el propósito de  superarse y obtener mejores ganancias por sus ventas a tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir en la compra de: pollos, vitaminas y concentrado con el motivo de aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Ada is 29 years old and lives in her own home together with her family, made up of her husband and three children. Ada is an entrepreneurial woman who, day by day, fights to bring her family forward through her business of raising and selling chickens, which she distributes to her neighbors and in the street market that is closest to her community. It is in this way that she obtains an income, which allows her to bring her household their daily bread.

With her goal to overcome and have greater profits for her sales, Ada has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI to be able to invest in the purchase of chickens, vitamins, and chicken feed with the purpose of increasing her production.

loans.use: to invest in chickens, vitamins and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy staple grains, drinks, sweets, sweet bread, dairy products, and other staple goods.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 47-year-old mother with a beautiful family. They all live in a remote town called Kapsowar, a place that doesn't offer the best opportunities, but this Mum has learned to deal with that. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kapsowar, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her main source of income has been milk, growing maize, vegetables and tomatoes. She also has a side hustle business (a shop). Jane has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of her produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family," she said. Jane mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance institution that helps aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Jane is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Jane is going to achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Jane feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Jane will never suffer losses due to a delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping with the farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and ensure her children of a secure future.

Help Jane make her dream come true; this loan can change her life.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn is 34 years old and married with six children. With five of her children in school, Carolyn works very hard to provide for them.

Carolyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Carolyn has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Carolyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Deborah is 47 years old and two of her children are in school.

Deborah has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Deborah has been in this business for six years. In the future, Deborah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old entrepreneur from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He lives with his family in a small humble house also he is the only breadwinner for the family, and they depend on him for support. Ahmad has a barbershop in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but It lacks many tools.

Ahmad  took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new tools and expand  his shop.  He hopes that this new grooming tools will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: buy new tools and expand his barber shop

loans.name: Raksmey

texts.en:
Raksmey is 21 years old, single and lives in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. Currently, he is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in English literature in his third year at a university and he also teaches English, earning USD 8.40 each day. 

Raksmey does not have sufficient finances to cover his third-year university fees, therefore he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to go through his third year at the university successfully and improve his knowledge. In the future, he dreams of being a good lecturer.

loans.use: to cover his third-year university fees in English Literature

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is aged 44 years, married to Thomas and she supports 3 children. She has been a farmer in the market for the last 4 years and the business earns her KES 4,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops for a better harvest so as to meet client and family needs.  

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk supply to clients daily and meet both client and family needs.  

Her hope is to expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops for a better harvest

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es: Marta de 49 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica desde hace 16 años a la crianza de pollos, además elabora artesanías, lo que le permite sostener a su familia y estar al pendiente de ellos. Marta y su compañero de vida lograron hace 27 años comprar una pequeña propiedad en la que construyeron su vivienda, y en ella viven junto a sus hijo de 17 años de edad. La vivienda de Marta es muy humilde y está hecha de bajareque, pero lo que más le preocupa es el techo de la misma, el cual se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Marta is 49 years old and is a hardworking woman. She has been raising chickens for 16 years and she also makes crafts which allow her to support and look after her family. Marta and her life partner were able to buy a small property 27 years ago where they built their home. They live in this home with their 17-year-old son. Marta's home is humble and is made of straw and mud but what most worries her is the roof which is deteriorated. This is why she is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in galvanized steel, wood, nails and wire to change her home's roof and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized steel, wood, nails and wire.

loans.name: Urunana Cb  Sub Group A

texts.en:
Adeline is a group leader; aged 30 years.She is married with 4 children aged 2 and 8 years. The group is called URUNANA means “UNITE” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She has a shop and has been running in a business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Ever Eliseo

texts.es:
Ever, de 25 años de edad, es un joven trabajador, está acompañado, estudio hasta sexto grado, tiene un hijo de tres años de edad.

Ever, se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente siembra maíz y frijol, todo lo ha realizado desde hace más de diez años, trabaja todos los días ya que sus cultivos los tiene bastante retirados de su casa de habitación.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes para sus cultivos, con lo cual pretende tener una mejor cosecha y así obtener mayores ingresos para él y su familia.

Sus sueños son, ampliar su casa, porque es un poco pequeña y también palea tener otro hijo y seguir trabajando fuertemente.
texts.en:
Ever is 25 years old and is a hard working young man. He is in a relationship, he went to school until the sixth grade and he has a three-year-old son. 

Ever works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans. He has been doing this for more than 10 years. He works every day because his crops are far from his home. 

Ever needs this loan to buy fertilizers for his crops which he hopes will give him a better harvest and thus he'll be able to have more income for himself and his family. 

His dreams are to expand his house because it is a bit small and to strive to have another child and keep working hard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Diana Rose

texts.en:
Diana Rose is 28 years old and married with two children. With one of her children in school, Diana Rose works very hard to provide for them.

Diana Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Diana Rose has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Diana Rose would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nay Yaung Kar Village D

texts.en:
Naw (pictured second from the right), the featured borrower, is 40 years old and married with six children.  She and her husband work on their three acre crop farm and plant seasonal fruits. The family also raises ducks and sell their eggs for additional income. 

Proximity's loan will help Naw during the harvesting period, and it will also help for her to invest and prepare for the next crop season. Naw aims to open a grocery store by the end of the year. She also hopes to send all her children to school till graduation. 

Pictured above are the members from Nay Yaung Kar Village Group D, named Naw, Du, Naw K, Saw and Tin. These members are overseen by a CBO (Community Based Leader). The fund will help each member to purchase fertilizer and hire labor who can help with the farming. 

Nay Yaung Kar Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar, which includes 700 households. Most of the families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and hire labor who can help with the farming.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 43 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Judith works very hard to provide for them.
She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, rice, home product care, and other groceries.

Judith has been in this business for 10 years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, rice, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 28 years old from Gurjaani. He lives with his wife and 7 years old son. Mikheil owns a vineyard and produces wine to sell. His wife has been working for years as a pharmacist at a local pharmacy. 

Mikheil purchased this pharmacy and needs money to purchase a stock of medicines. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan for purchasing medicines. Mikheil and his wife are very hardworking and they hope that they both will run the business well. Mikheil awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of medicines for his pharmacy

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en:
Chheang, who is a farmer living in Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province; she is 38 years old and a married mother of five dependent children, four of whom are in school and the other one is working as a construction worker. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming, catching fish and working at garment factory. She has been involved in her job for ten years.  The crops were destroyed by insects is the main challenge for her business and causes her not to have enough funds to do farming for this season. 

This is first time for her and she will take a loan of 2,500,000KHR via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is going to spend her loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, pay for labor fees and take the rest of money to buy fishing materials in order to increase her profits. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income and ability to renovate old house. Moreover, she is willing to keep her children in school until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pay for labor fees and take the rest of money to buy fishing materials in order to increase her profits.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ma Yann Wa Village Group A

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Zaw (pictured center), is married with three children. Two of his children are students and the eldest is a teacher. Zaw farms and plants seasonal foods such as bananas, betel leaves and coconuts.  When the weather isn't good, it is very difficult for the farmers during the cropping period.  Therefore Zaw hopes to make more improvements in the farm this year. 

Proximity's loan will help Zaw purchase fertilizer and gas for the harvesting machines.
 
Pictured above are the members from Ma Yann Wa Village Group A, named Thet, Thant, Than and Ni. The group is overseen by a CBO leader and the fund will help each member purchase fertilizer and crop seeds. 

Ma Yann Wa Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar.  Most families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and gas for the harvesting machines.

borrowers.first_name: Ma Yann Wa Village Group A

loans.name: Thiery's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 2 Novembre 2006 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement est composé de femmes qui jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Thiery (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée 51 ans, veuve et mère 04 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de poulet et de poissons qu’elle achète dans la sous région pour le revendre dans son quartier. 

Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter des poulets d’un montant de 90000 et du poisson d’une valeur de  75000 pour le revendre en détails. 

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte participer à la prise en charge de sa famille (soins médicaux, nourriture, habillement, scolarité etc.…)
texts.en:
This  group]  has been created on November 2, 2006 at the launch of its banc villageois. The group is composed of women who have a good rapport and team spirit. They mainly work as vendors. 

Ms. Thiery (the one standing on the far right raising her hand in the photo) is the star borrower of the group. She is 51 years old, a widow and the mother of four. She sells chickens and baby chicks which she buys in her local area in order to resell them in her neighborhood.

With this new loan she would like to buy chickens for 90,000 [West African francs] and fish for 75,000 francs to resell at retail prices.
Thanks to her revenues, she plans to help provide for the family needs (healthcare, food, clothing, schooling etc).

loans.use: to buy chickens and fish for resale.

loans.name: Lileth

texts.en:
Lileth is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lileth is 39 years old and has one child in school.

Lileth has a bakeshop business in the Philippines. Lileth requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lileth has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Lileth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
Elsa, de 47 años de edad, estudio sexto grado, está casada y su esposo vende con ella en el cafetín, tiene dos hijos pero ya están casados, con ella solo viven dos nietos.

Elsa, desde hace 23 años vende en el cafetín de la escuela, la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar la llevaron a vender en el cafetín, ahora gracias al apoyo de una amiga y de Dios ha lograron apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios; el cafetín está a una cuadra de su casa y se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para  preparar todo lo que lleva a vender y trabaja hasta las 4:00 p.m. luego regresa a casa para descansar un rato y luego limpiar la casa.  

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar galletas, dulces y para comprar dos mesas plásticas y 8 sillas plásticas.

Su sueño es comprar un carro para su negocio, comprar un panel solar y construir una casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elsa, 47 years old, studied until the sixth grade. She is married and her husband works in the cafeteria with her. She has two children but they are already married. Only two grandchildren live with her. 

Elsa has sold in the school cafeteria for 23 years. The need for her to help her husband with the household costs led her to selling in the cafeteria. Thanks to the support of a friend and of God they have now managed to support their children in their studies. The cafeteria is one block away from her home. She gets up at 4:00 am to prepare all that she brings to sell and she works until 4:00 pm. She then returns home to rest for a bit and then cleans the house.

The loan will be used to buy cookies and sweets and to buy two plastic tables and 8 plastic chairs.

Her dreams are to buy a car for her business, a solar panel and to build a home for her children.

loans.use: to buy cookies and sweets and to buy two plastic tables and 8 plastic chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cake ingredients such as wheat flour, rice flour, butter, eggs, yeast, and some kinds of soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Airene is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Airene has a food vending business in the Philippines. Airene requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Airene has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Airene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila works hard to support her family. Cerila is married and has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines.

Cerila requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

Cerila has been in this business for 2 years now.

Cerila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is an ambitious 20-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He practices livestock and crop farming for income. He uses the income to run his business and meet his family’s basic needs.  

The challenge that James is facing is common to a rural smallholder farmer - high cost of transport. He lives in a remote location accessible on poor roads that are not busy. Arranging logistics of transporting his produce from the farm requires too much planning, time and money. To solve this problem, James is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas. 

With this asset, James will be able to transport his produce to formal markets where he will get better prices for his produce. Your loan investment in James' business will elevate his family’s livelihood and generate more income for them to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Phanna's Group

texts.en:
Phanna is 26-year-old woman living in a remote area of Battambang province, and the mother of two dependent children who are in school.  Nowadays, she sells coconut and drinking-coffee to support her living standard for one year. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loan cycles already and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. The previous loan has helped her to have better house to stay. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to apply for a new Kiva loan via VisionFund. As the leader of a group with two members, she is asking for a loan amount of 2,000,000 KHR and another member is seeking of 1,400,000 KHR. She is going to manage her entire loan portion to buy coconut and coffee for sale. She hopes to get more income from her business to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy coconut and coffee for sale.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en: Amjad is a 21-year-old entrepreneur from Qalqilya, which is located in the West Bank. He lives with his family in a small humble house. He is the only breadwinner for the family, and they depend on him for support. Amjad has a barbershop in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but it lacks many tools. Amjad took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy new tools and expand his shop. He hopes that the new grooming tools will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough money to get married.

loans.use: to buy new tools and expand his barber shop

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 52 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, cigarettes, canned goods, home products, and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, cigarettes, canned goods, home products, and other groceries

loans.name: Alex Vinicio

texts.es:
Alex es un joven de 21 años, soltero, nació en la ciudad de Latacunga y que gracias al gran esfuerzo realizado por sus padres logro culminar sus estudios primarios, debido a su estado civil y a su edad el vive con sus padres. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado tales como toretes los mismos que son de hacienda y es por esta razón que son muy cotizados y tienen una buena ganancia, esta actividad la heredo de su padre y con la que ha podido ayudar en los gastos de su casa.
Ellos viven en un sector rural de la ciudad llamado Pilligloma un barrio rural alejado de la ciudad, reconocido por el clima que posee, Alex vino a la Fundacion por recomendación de un hermano y solicita un crédito para la compra de alimento y para adecuar los corrales.
El se dedica a esta actividad durante dos años y es de su agrado porque ha sido algo a lo que se han dedicado su familia durante mucho tiempo.
Alex agradece a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal .
texts.en:
Alex is a 21 year old youth, single and born in the city of Latacunga. Thanks to the great effort made by his parents he was able to complete primary school. He lives with his parents due to his marital status and his age. 

He works buying and selling cattle such as ranch steer. For this reason they are highly valued and profitable. He inherited this work from his father and with it has been able to help with the household costs.

They live in a rural area of the city named Pilligloma. It is a rural neighborhood, far from the city and renowned for its climate. Alex came to the Foundation on a brother’s recommendation. He is requesting this loan to buy feed and to repair the corrals. 

He has done this work for two years and it has been his pleasure because it is something in which his family has worked for a long time. Alex thanks Kiva for making the growth of his work and personal life possible.

loans.use: to buy feed and to repair the corrals. In this way he will grow his business and will be able to support his parents with the expenses.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn is a 39-year-old married homemaker with four children. She resides in the province of Siem Reap, Cambodia. Her husband is 43 years old and works as a worker in a cassava plantation. Among her four children, the oldest daughter works as a servant, and three others are in school. Together, the family can make around USD $7 each day. 

Soeurn’s husband does not have his own motorcycle for commuting to work, so she needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband. This loan will help improve her husband’s traveling conditions in order to earn income to support the family. In the future, she is going to sell groceries at home.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband for commuting to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk supply to clients daily to meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as engines, mirrors and chains so as to meet client needs in order to offer better and faster transport services.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising pigs and pre-paid mobile load.

Catherine dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Her name is Janet, 39, and she lives in Bicutan, Taguig city, Philippines. She is married to Benedicto, her business partner and has one child in High School. Just like many Filipino families, Janet find ways and means to make a living and send her child to school.

Janet has had a backyard poultry business for a number of years now. She buys chicks and feed and raises them for the purpose of farming meat and eggs for food.  To help her raise healthy chickens she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to buy more chicks and chicken to grow her poultry enterprise. Her fresh, healthy, and reasonable priced chicken than the branded ones has drawn her many customers in their community. Her poultry farm means a lot to her as it is her family's source of income to fund their daily needs and pay the school requirement of her child.

Janet's precious dream is to expand her business and be able to save enough money to send her child to College. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies .

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for chicken feed and chicks to grow in her poultry farm

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is 47 years old, married, and has seven children. Two of her seven children are in school.

Dulce is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Dulce requested a 22,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Dulce has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Dulce would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a food processing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Elizabeth is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Speaking with Vincent, it becomes obvious that he is a very hard-working and helpful man, and that everything he does is for his family's benefit and well-being. He lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with his family. He has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. He has been doing agriculture for 7 years now. He makes money selling produce from his farm, including milk, eggs, and crops.He also has a side hustle business (motorbike business). He enjoys ploughing his farm and watering his plants. 

Crop diseases pose a big challenge for him and also poor productivity. Vincent is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, he plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on his farm. Increased productivity will allow him to improve his quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, he has learned about the culture of saving and he plans to use the increased income to improve his farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Vincent and his family.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 44 years old and married with five children. Emily works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, school supplies, home care products, and other groceries.

Emily has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Emily would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, school supplies, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Djiparkhan

texts.ru: Джипархан очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 14 овец. Джипархан весной этого года на 1,04 Га земли посеяла помидоры, нашла покупателей. Однако неожиданно урожай пострадал от болезни "хлопковая совка", помидоры засохли. Джипархан с сыном живут вдвоем, помочь им некому. У Джипархан есть активный кредит в Банке с остатком 30,000 сом (KGS). Так как урожай пострадал в следствии форс-мажорных обстоятельств и требуется восстановление бизнеса, Джипархан повторно обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). На полученные средства она приобретет химикаты для обработки помидоров и восстановления почвы, 30,000 сом (KGS) направит на погашение действующего кредита. Джипархан планирует восстановить свой бизнес, нарастить активы и посеять лук.
texts.en: Djiparkhan is very thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her with her previous financing.  She currently has two cows and 14 sheep on her farm.  This spring, she planted tomatoes on 1.04 hectares of land and found some customers for her crop.  However, her harvest suffered from the consequences of a parasite called "cotton bollworm" (tomato fruitworm), and her tomatoes dried up.  Djiparkhan lives alone with her son without any outside assistance.  She has an active account in the bank; she still has 30,000 som (KGS).  Since a "force majeure" caused the destruction of her harvest and forced her to start her business anew, she has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy pesticides to treat her tomatoes and prepare her soil.  She will also use 30,000 som (KGS) to repay her current loan.  Djiparkhan is planning to restore her business, to build some assets and to plant onions.

loans.use: to buy pesticides to treat her tomatoes and soil, and to repay her current loan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coarse salt.

loans.name: Ginette's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 2 Novembre 2006 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement est composé de femmes qui jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ginette, (debout derrière à  gauche avec la main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est veuve et mère de 05 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente d’habillement et de chaussures qu’elle achète dans la sous région pour le revendre chez elle.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des habits et des chaussures d’une valeur de 250000f et payer un transport de 35000f aller et retour pour le revendre en détails

 Les bénéfices lui serviront s’occuper de ses enfants ( soins médicaux ; habillement, nourriture).
texts.en:
The banc villageois was created 2 November 2006 during its inauguration. This group is composed of women who get along and share a good group spirit. They primarily work in small-scale commerce.

Ginette, who is standing in the back on the left of the photo with her hand raised, is the featured borrower of this group. She is a widow and a mother of five children. 

Ginette works selling clothing and shoes, which she buys in the subregion and resells in her area. With this loan, she plans to buy clothing and shoes for 250,000 francs CFA and to pay the return transport, 350,000 francs CFA, for her retail sales. 

Earnings will serve to help take care of her children (healthcare, clothing, food).

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes and to pay for return transport

loans.name: Dabel's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe, créé depuis le 23 Mai 2009 vient d’entamer son treizième cycle et les femmes sont encore plus déterminées dans le travail. Elles vivent dans le même village ont de solides liens de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

 Madame Dabel (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans, mariée et mère de 01 garçon. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires (thé, sucre, riz et huile).

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 01 sac de sucre de 25 kg à 25000f, 01 sac de riz à 13000f  et une bouteille et de l’huile raffiné d’une valeur de 12000f pour le revendre en détails dans son village.

Les bénéfices lui serviront de participer à la dépense familiale pour mieux prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group, created on 23 May 2009, has just started its 13th loan cycle, and the women are still very determined in their work. The group members live in the same village and share strong ties of solidarity. They all work primarily in small-scale commerce.

Dabel, who is standing on the far right in the photo with her hand raised, is the featured borrower of the group. She is 55 years old, married, and has one son. She works selling food products (tea, sugar, rice, and oil). 

With this loan, she plans to buy one 25-kilogram sac of sugar at 25,000 francs CFA, one sac of rice at 13,000 francs CFA, and one bottle of refined oil for 12,000 francs CFA, which she will resell at retail in her village.

Earnings will help her to support her family's expenses and take better care of her family's needs. She will also strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and a bottle of refined oil

loans.name: Seng Leang

texts.en: Seng Leang is 49 years old, living in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district and she has three children. Nowadays, she grows cassava as the main source of her family’s income. She does rice farming to sell to earn additional income to complement her family’s needs. She has been with this current job for 20 years. For Seng Leang, she has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three cycles already and she has fully repaid her past loans. Now, she does not have enough funds to do farming for this season, so she decided to apply for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to help the crops grow well and produce more yields. She hopes to earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to help the crops grow well and produce more yields.

loans.name: Dioulde's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 12 Juillet2008  lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement compte des femmes qui habitent toutes la même zone. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce

Madame Diouldé (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 03 garçons et 01 fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour le revendre en détails dans son village natal. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des légumes d’une valeur de 50000f pour le revendre en détails et renouvelle son achat tous les 05 jours. 

Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront  d’assister son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et s’occuper de sa famille habillements soins médicaux …..
texts.en:
The banc villageois was created 12 July 2008 at its inauguration. This group of women all live in the same area. They get along well and share a strong group spirit. They all work primarily in small-scale commerce.

Diouldé, who is seated on the far right with her hand raised, is the featured borrower of the group. She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of three sons and a daughter. 

Diouldé works selling vegetables. She buys the vegetables in the weekly markets and resells them at retail in her village. This new loan will allow her to buy vegetables for 50,000 francs CFA, which she will resell at retail. She will also be able to renew her purchases every five days.

Earnings will allow her to help her husband with the daily expenses and to provide for her family's clothing and healthcare needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and to renew her purchase every five days

loans.name: Engiel

texts.en:
Engiel is 50 years old and married with three children. With one of her children in school, Engiel works very hard to provide for them.

Engiel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, accessories, home care products, and other groceries.

Engiel has been in this business for 10 years.
