In the future, Engiel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, accessories, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a smallholder farmer based in Nkubu, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He is single but being the first-born in his family, he financially supports his old parents and three siblings. He makes a living doing dairy and banana farming, and uses the income to grow his business and meet his family’s basic needs.

The challenge common to rural smallholder farmers that Kenneth is facing is the high cost of transporting goods to the market. He is seeking a loan to buy a motorcycle to avoid dealing with brokers and being exploited. Through your loan, Kenneth will buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle all sorts of terrain.

With this asset, Kenneth will be able to transport his produce to formal markets where he will get a fair price for his produce. This intervention will elevate his business to the next level and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mariama Cherif's Group

texts.fr:
Créé depuis le 16 Décembre 2009, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables, elles s’activent également dans l’agriculture sous pluie. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. 

Madame Mariama Chérif, âgée de 39 ans (assise à l’extrême gauche avec un foulard vert et une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée âgée de 39ans  et mère de 03 enfants dont 01 garçon et 02 filles. Elle s’active dans l’embouche. Elle achète des veaux pour les revendre 02 ou 03 mois après.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 05 chèvres à 20000f l’une pour après trois mois d'embouche les revendre dans son village ou dans les villages voisins.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et les besoins en nourriture et santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Created on 16 December 2009, this banc villageois is made up of a group of village women who joined the program in order to make their work in small-scale commerce more profitable. They also work in rain-fed agriculture. A good atmosphere permeates the group meetings.

Mariama Chérif is 39 years old and is the featured borrower of this group. She is seated on the far left in the photo with her hand raised and wears a green scarf. She is married and the mother of three children, of whom one is a boy and two are girls. 

Mariama Chérif works by fattening livestock. She buys calves to resell two or three months later. With this new loan, she plans to buy five goats at 20,000 francs CFA each. After three months of fattening the goats she will resell them in her village or surrounds. 

With the earnings, she plans to support her husband to take care of the children's expenses and the family's food and health needs.

loans.use: to buy five goats

loans.name: Roubiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé le 12 Juillet2008  lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement compte des femmes qui habitent toutes la même zone. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce

Madame Roubiatou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe, elle est mariée âgée de 45 ans et mère de 03 filles et 02 garçons. Elle est vendeuse de tissus teintés.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des tissus teintés d’une valeur de 300000f pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier, payer un transport de 35000f et renouveler sa marchandise après qu’elle se soit épuisée. 

Les bénéfices, elle les utilise pour s’occuper de ses enfants et aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was created 12 July 2008 during its inauguration. The group is composed of women who all live in the same area and who get along well and share a strong group spirit. They work primarily in small-scale commerce.

Roubiatou, who is seated on the far right in the photo with her hand raised, is the featured borrower of the group. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of three daughters and two sons. 

Roubiatou works selling dyed fabric. With this loan, she plans to buy dyed fabric worth 300,000 francs CFA, which she will resell at retail in her area. She will also pay for transport, 35,000 francs CFA, and renew her stock once it is depleted.

Earnings will be used to take care of her children and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy dyed fabric, to pay for transport, and to renew her stock

loans.name: Santhiaba 1 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 23 Mars 2001. Ce groupe est composé de femmes qui mènent le commerce comme activité. Madame Habibatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 38 ans et mère de sept enfants dont six fille et un garçon. Elle s'active depuis quatre ans dans l'aviculture. Avec le prêt sollicité elle compte acheter 100 poussins et 50 Kg d'aliments pour chaque rotation. La vente des sujets se fera à domicile et livraison à la commande. Avec les bénéfices elle va appuyer son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was inaugurated 23 March 2001. This group is made up of women who work in commerce. 

Habibatou, who is on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the representative of the group. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, of whom six are girls and one is a boy.

Habibatou has worked for four years in poultry farming. With this loan, she plans to buy 100 chicks and 50 kilograms of feed for each cycle. 

Sales of the chicks will be made from her home and by ordered delivery. 

With the earnings, she is going to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy chicks

loans.name: Elinkine Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 22 Mai 2013. Ce groupe est constitué de vingt membres. Ces femmes font le petit commerce et elles remboursent leurs prêts avec succès. Madame Anta qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 51 ans et mère de six enfants dont trois filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de draps et de nappes depuis plus de quatre ans. Avec le montant sollicité elle va acheter des draps et nappes en quantité. Les bénéfices vont servir à épargner et à aider son mari à la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was inaugurated on 22 May 2013. The group is made up of twenty women, who work in small-scale commerce. All of their loans have been reimbursed with success.

Anta, who is on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of six children, of whom three are girls.

Anta has worked selling sheets and tablecloths for more than four years. With this loan, she is going to buy sheets and tablecloths in bulk. 

Earnings will be saved and used to help her husband cover their children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy sheets and tablecloths

loans.name: Polite Ladies Group

texts.en:
The Shopping Centre in the Glenview High density suburb is a hive of activity every day as there are different products offered to the passersby. There are vegetable vendors, clothing for sale and the men and women who ply their trade doing poultry business. It is here that you find Hilda. In this competitive place she stands her ground and does her business daily, operating from the shopping centre. She is a member of Polite Ladies Group. This is a homogeneous group with all four members in the poultry business.

After hearing other women in business talking about Thrive Microfinance and how it uplifts women in business, Hilda and her group members decided to join Thrive. At Thrive she, along with her group members, benefited and learnt a lot. She highlights that she personally learnt the importance of savings, record keeping and marketing her products. Hilda was given a loan by Thrive Microfinance and it is with this loan that she is planning to increase the number of chickens she sells. An increase in her business means that her income levels are increased, thereby improving her standard of living and enabling her to properly plan for the future. In the future she is planning to buy a residential stand and build a home for her family.

loans.use: To extend her fowl run.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a precision seeding machine

loans.name: Samirna

texts.es: Samirna inspirada en su deseo de ser una trabajadora independiente y tener su propio negocio, aprovecho el conocimiento que tenía su cónyuge en la elaboración de Pasabocas y aprendió cada una de las técnicas culinarias para su optima preparación.  Hoy en día en su microempresa de Pasabocas ofrece una amplia variedad de productos; empanaditas hawaiana, rellenas con queso, carne, pollo, deditos de queso con bocadillo, bolitas de carne con lentejas y demás delicias que le encarguen sus clientes.   Todos los días labora en dos turnos; a partir de las 3:30 a.m. hasta las 8:30 a.m. y  de 4 p.m. hasta las 7 p.m. y posteriormente distribuye sus Pasabocas a tiendas y cafeterías.  Como su demanda es cada vez es mayor, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para invertir en ingredientes; harina, carnes, queso, azúcar, sal, aceite y demás.  Samirna es madre de dos adolescentes a quienes ofrece bienestar y desea que sus ventas incrementen para tener más utilidades.
texts.en: Samirna, inspired by her dream of being an independent worker and having her own business, took advantage of the knowledge that her spouse has in the making of Pasabocas (tasty snacks), and she learned each of the culinary techniques for their optimal preparation. Today, her microcompany of snacks offers a wide variety of products; Hawaiian empanadas filled with cheese, meat and chicken; cheese fingers with sandwiches, meat balls with lentils, and other delicacies that her clients request. Every day she works two shifts, from 3:30 a.m. until 8:30 a.m. and from 4 p.m. until 7 p.m., and afterwards she distributes her snacks in stores and cafeterias. Because her demand is bigger every time, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in ingredients: flour, meat, cheese, sugar, salt, oil, and others. Samirna is the mother of two teenagers, to whom she offers well-being and hopes that her sales increase to have more utilities.

loans.use: to invest in: flour, meat, cheese, sugar, salt, oil, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a precision seeding machine

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr: Hamidou  est agriculteur inscrit à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Toba au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Agé de 53 ans, Hamidou est le père de 8 enfants âgés de 1,5 à 21 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ce qui  a incité Hamidou à devenir agriculteur. Il a mentionné que, "Si tu n'es pas salarié, il faut cultiver pour nourrir la famille." Il cultive l'arachide, le maïs,le sorgho et le haricot sur sa parcelle de 10 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de main d'œuvre et de matériels agricoles. Il a partagé que, ""Le travail du maïs est moins fatiguant et c'est plus rentable"." Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour donner une belle image à ses activités et aux autres membres de myAgro n'ayant pas le moyen d'acheter le semoir. L’accès au semoir lui permettra de convaincre les autres  à adhérer à myAgro même s'ils doivent prêter son semoir, ajoute-t-il. Hamidou espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants .
texts.en:
Hamidou is a farmer who has joined myAgro and who lives and works in the village of Toba, southwest of Bamako in Mali. At 53 years old, he is the father of eight children, aged from one and a half to 21 years old. Three of the children are currently in school.

Hamidou became a farmer because it allows him to ensure his family's self-sufficiency. He mentions that, "If you do not have an income, it is necessary to farm to feed your family." He grows groundnuts, corn, sorghum, and beans on his 10 hectares of land. He faces difficulties as a farmer though, such as a lack of farm labor and farming supplies. He shares that, "Farming corn is less tiring and more profitable."

This year, he wanted to buy a seeding machine to help his farming and to help the other members of myAgro who do not have the means to buy a seeding machine. Access to the machine will [also] allow him to convince others to join myAgro, even if it means by lending them his own seeding machine, he adds.

Hamidou hopes with an increase in yields and returns that he can cover his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a precision seeding machine

loans.name: Nanko

texts.fr: Nanko est un agriculteur inscrit à myAgro qui vit et travaille dans le village de Sido au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Agé de 64 ans, Nanko est le père de 20 enfants âgés de 7 à 40 ans, dont 6 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille ont incité Nanko à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive le maïs,le mil sur sa parcelle de 4 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de bœufs. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour avoir un semoir qui est très efficace. L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'être rapide en semis et en usage d'engrais. Nanko espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir acheter un tracteur pour mieux se lancer.
texts.en:
Nanko is a farmer who has joined myAgro and who lives and works in the village of Sido, southwest of Bamako in Mali. At 64 years old, he is the father of 20 children, aged from seven to 40 years old. Six of the children are currently in school.

Nanko became a farmer because it is a family tradition, it provides a principal source of income and food for his household, and because it allows him to ensure his family's self-sufficiency. He grows corn and millet on his four hectares of land. He faces difficulties as a farmer though, such as a lack of cattle. 

This year, he wanted to buy a seeding machine to make his planting more efficient. Access to this machine will allow him plant and fertilize more quickly. 

Nanko hopes with an increase in yields and earnings that he can buy a tractor, which will help him to better prepare for his farming.

loans.use: to buy a precision seeding machine

loans.name: Diasso Awa Group

texts.fr:
Alimata est une femme mariée.
Elle à plus de 20 ans dans la coiffure et la vente des layettes. Elle coiffe très bien ce qui fais sa force et sa grande clientèles.
Elle est à son  19eme crédit à ACFIME et à toujours bien remboursé. Elle sollicite le crédit pour acheter des layettes à 50000f des sous vêtement à 100000f bijoux à 75000f accessoires de coiffure (pommade,gel, shampoing,dissolvant, vernis)
texts.en:
Alimata is a married woman who has worked in a beauty salon and has sold baby clothes for more than 20 years. 

She does well in this work, because of her strength and the number of her customers.

She is on her 19th loan with ACFIME and has always repaid her loans on time. 

She is seeking this loan to buy 50,000 francs CFA worth of baby clothes, 100,000 francs CFA worth of underwear, 75,000 francs CFA worth of jewelry, and hair dressing supplies (ointment, gel, shampoo, thinner, and polish).

loans.use: to buy baby clothes, underwear, ointments, gels, and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a precision seeding machine

loans.name: Vololonjanahary Andrianiaina

texts.fr:
38 ans, mariée, Vololonjanahary est mère de cinq enfants dont deux seulement fréquentent l'école (12 et 4 ans), et le dernier est encore âgé de 9 mois. 
Les deux époux pour entretenir la famille exercent le même type d'activité, il s'agit de la vente en demi-gros et en détails des poissons séchées. Elle y est depuis qu'elle est encore célibataire car c'était l'activité de ses parents. Elle est donc bien expérimentée dans ce domaine. 
Le prêt va lui permettre d'augmenter et de renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de pouvoir augmenter les bénéfices ainsi que le revenu pour pouvoir continuer à financer les études de ses enfants et améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Thirty-eight years old and married, Vololonjanahary is the mother of five children. Two of the children are in school, who are four and 12 years old, and the youngest is only nine months old.

The two spouses take care of their family by both working in the semi-wholesale and retail selling of dried fish. 

Vololonjanahary has done this type of work since she was single, because it was her parents' work [as well]. She has, therefore, a lot of experience in this area. 

This loan is going to allow her to increase and strengthen her working capital as a way to increase her profits, which will finance her children's education and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy four sacs of rice and one sac of flour

loans.name: Miguel Geronimo

texts.es:
Miguel es un agricultor nato, aprendió este oficio cuando tenía 10 años en la finca de su papá, cuando este murió le heredo varias cabezas de ganado y eso fue el inicio para que se dedicara a la agricultura y ganadería. Sin embargo, hace algunos años decidió probar suerte en la venta de piedras canteras que sirven para la construcción. De esta forma a sacado adelante a su familia.
Por ello, solicita un crédito para la compra de 3 llantas para el camión en el cual trasporta el material de construcción, esto le será de gran ayuda porque podrá circular sin el peligro latente de un accidente de tránsito. Entre los planes de Miguel esta comprar otro camión y continuar trabajando con MiCrédito.
texts.en:
Miguel is a born farmer who learned the trade when he was ten years old on his father's farm.  After his father died, Miguel inherited several head of cattle which marked the beginning of his activity in agriculture and livestock farming.  But several years ago he dediced to venture out into the sale of quarry stones for construction.  This is how he supports his family.

Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy three tires for the truck he uses to transport construction material.  It will be of great help as he will be able to drive without the latent risk of a traffic accident.

Among Miguel's plans is to buy another truck and continue working with MiCredito.

loans.use: To buy three tires for the truck he uses to transport construction material.

loans.name: Esmeralda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Esmeralda, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado y dejo la escuela por que su mamá ya no pudo ayudarle, porque eran 7 hermanos y era madre soltera; ahora está casada y esposo trabaja en un taller de enderezado y pintura, tiene dos hijos y ambos están estudiando. 

Esmeralda, desde hace 2 años tiene una tienda y la necesidad la llevo a dedicarse a este negocio, ella inicio la tienda con $100.00 dolares y después de 2 años tiene un inventario de $500.00 dolares, pero su sueño siendo tener un mini-super; ella se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. por que a las 5:00 a.m atiende a sus primeros clientes que le compran pan y café.

El crédito será invertido para comprar azúcar, frijoles, jabón, maíz, maicillo, aceite y papel para su tienda.

Su sueño es, que sus hijos se prepare academicamente y convertir su tienda en un mini-super.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, 30, has a third grade education but had to leave school because her mother was single with seven children, and could not help her. Esmeralda's husband works at a paint and body shop and they have two children who attend school.

For two years Esmeralda has been running a store which began out of necessity. She started up with $100.00 but after two years has an inventory worth $500.00. Her goal is to have a mini-supermarket. She gets up at 4:30 a.m. to attend to the first customers who arrive at 5:00 a.m. for bread and coffee.

The loan will be used to buy sugar, beans, soap, corn, millet, oil and paper for her store.

Her dream is to see her children get academic training, and to convert her store into a mini-supermarket.

loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, soap, corn, millet, oil and paper for her store.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es: Eduarda de 62 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 32 y 28 años de edad desde hace 15 años en la vivienda que con mucho esfuerzo y humildad construyo junto a su esposo. Ella siempre mostrando su tenacidad se gana la vida con el cultivo y venta de verduras, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 40 años, por lo que se siente feliz y satisfecha con su negocio. Eduarda desea mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tejas, lámina, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eduarda, 62, lives with her husband and two children, ages 32 and 28.  For 15 years she and her family have lived in the house she and her husband built through much effort and humbleness.  She always has shown her tenacity in earning a living with her crop growing and vegetables sales which she has been involved in for over 40 years.  She is very happy and satisfied with her business.

Eduarda wants to improve her family's quality of life and is therefore requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy files, metal sheeting, wood and nails to change the roof of her house.  This will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy tiles, metal sheeting, wood and nails to change the roof of her house and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel de 39 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus tres hijos, dos de  16 y 14 años y otro de 6 meses de edad. Miguel es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia es por ello que es admirado por sus vecinos, ya que siempre está viendo la manera de sacar adelante a sus hijos y velando por que en el hogar no les falte nada, él se dedica a prestar sus servicios en un centro educativo desempeñando el cargo de contador y gracias a su sueldo devengado logra solventar los gastos de su vivienda. Miguel con el propósito de mejorar su condición habitacional ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para poder colocar techo a un cuarto dormitorio y aun cuarto cocina, además desea instalar una regadera en el baño de su vivienda. Por lo anterior con el crédito solicitado el piensa comprar: lámina galvanizada, tubo pvc, grifería para ducha y demás materiales necesarios.
texts.en:
Miguel, 39, lives in his own house with his three children, ages 16, 14 and 6-months.  He is a very hard-working man who is dedicated to his family and therefore admired by his neighbors.  He always is looking for ways to support his children and make sure that they want for nothing.  

Miguel works as an accountant at an educational center and thanks to his salary can cover household expenses.  In an effort to improve home living conditions he has decided to request a loan through FUSAI to put a roof over a fourth bedroom and a kitchen.  He also wants to install a shower in the bathroom.  Therefore he is requesting the loan to buy metal sheeting, pvc pipes, faucetry for the shower and other needed materials.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, pvc pipes, faucetry for a shower and other needed materials.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
En el sector de las Mercedes vía a Pto. Nuevo con un clima cálido húmedo es un lugar donde su gente se dedica a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas  vive el señor Julio un hombre luchador de 41 años el viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos y siempre tuvo que trabajar muy duro para salir adelante es casado y tiene 5 hijos el último es discapacitado pero son una familia muy unida que busca salir adelante. 
El Señor Julio tiene una finca que heredó de sus Padres en la misma tuvo que trabajar mucho tiempo para poder sembrar todo tipo de frutas y verduras del sector, actualmente se dedica a la venta de leche cruda tiene varias vacas lecheras, también tiene plantaciones de cacao que ya se encuentran en cosecha aprendió de estas actividades por ayuda de sus Padres debido a que desde niño ha vivido y trabajado en el campo, gracias a esta actividad y a la ayuda de Dios ha podido salir adelante, a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 8 horas diarias, Solicita este crédito para comprar fertilizantes que necesita para sus plantaciones de cacao, con esta inversión mejorará su producción y calidad de vida, el señor Julio agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada para poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos y calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio lives in the sector of Mercedes on the road to Pto. Nuevo, which has a warm, humid climate and farm activity.  He is 41 years old and comes from a low income family.  He always had to work hard to get ahead.  He is married and has five children, the youngest of which has a disability.  But the family is very close and tries to prosper.

Julio inherited a farm from his parents on which he has had to work hard to plant all kinds of fruit and vegetables.  Now he sells raw milk from his many dairy cows, and also has a cocoa plantation which is now in harvest.  He learned the trade from his parents when he was a child.  Thanks to his work and through God's grace he has been able to get ahead, working an average eight hours a day.

He is requesting a loan to buy the fertilizers he needs for the cocoa plantations.  This will improve production and quality of life.  Julio is grateful to Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva for the support and opportunity to improve his income and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve production which will improve quality of life.

loans.name: Faridun

texts.ru: Фаридун человек, который всегда трудится ради своих близких и родных. Он из района Шахритус, женат и отец двух замечательных мальчиков. Фаридун на протяжении 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Этим видом деятельности он занимается прежде всего для того чтобы получать продукты питания. Например, чтобы на столе всегда был хлеб, растениеводы выращивают зерновые культуры, такие как пшеница, рожь и другие злаки. Фаридун уже посадил овощи и посеял пшеницу, но у него не хватило средств на покупку минеральных удобрений. По этой причине он срочно обратился за кредитом, потому что если он не закупит минеральные удобрения в ближайшие дни в этом году останется без урожая. Его единственная надежда остается на получения кредита.
texts.en:
Faridun is a man who always works hard for the good of his nearest and dearest. He is from the Shahrituz region and is married with two wonderful boys. He has been working in agriculture for 10 years, an occupation he pursues most of all in order to get food. For instance, in order to get bread on the table, farmers grow grains such as wheat, rye and other cereals. 

Faridun has already planted vegetables and wheat, but didn't have enough money to buy mineral fertilizers. For this reason he is urgently requesting a loan, because if he doesn't buy fertilizer soon, he won't have a harvest this year. His only hope is to receive a loan.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Абдусамад 30 летний мужчина из городка Истаравшан. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Абдусамад обеспечивает свою семью за счет своих услуг. Он предоставляет услуги таксиста на своей машине. У Абдусамада старая машина и на покупку новой машины у него нет достаточных денежных средств. Сейчас машина сломалась и Абдусамад не может работать и зарабатывать. Он просит помочь ему купить автозапчасти и отремонтировать машинку. Тогда он сможет снова выйти на работу и возобновить источник дохода.
texts.en: Abdusamad is a thirty-year-old man from Isfara.  He is married and has four children.  Abdusamad provides for his family by offering taxi services with his own car.  Abdusamad's car is old but he doesn't have the money to buy a new one.  Currently his car has broken down and he can't work to earn a living.  He is asking for help to buy repair parts and get his car repaired.  Once it has been repaired, he can go back to work and earn an income.

loans.use: to buy parts for car repair

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is 48 years old and widowed with two children.

Emilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Emilda has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Emilda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Dostonbek

texts.ru: Достонбек добрый активный юноша. Ему 21 год и он женат. Все члены его семьи очень любят его, так как он очень понимающий человек. Например, Достонбек с детства хотел, получит высшее образование и стать кем-то в жизни, но, к сожалению, у его родителей не было денег для обучение сына. Они с трудом находили средства, чтобы прокормить семью. Достонбек не расстраивался и решил, что будет помогать своим родителям. Он начал заниматься скотоводством. Когда она стал заниматься скотоводством, он смог прокормить свою семью и даже кое что продать. Их жизнь изменилась в лучшую сторону. Разведение и продажа скота стала важным переворотом в его жизни. Достонбек хочет развиваться все больше и больше, а для этого ему нужно купить ещё несколько телят, но у него нет денег. Он решил обратиться за кредитом и обещает, что его бизнес будет самым лучшим в районе.
texts.en:
Dostonbek is a kind and ambitious young man.  He is 21 years old and married.  Every one in his family loves him because his is so understanding.  For example, Dostonbek had always wanted to get a higher education and become someone in life but, unfortunately, his parents did not have any money for his education.  It was difficult for them to earn enough to feed the family.  Dostonbek didn't get upset, rather he decided that he would help his parents.  Dostonbek got into the cattle business and became able to feed his family, with enough left over for him to sell.  Their life changed for the better.

Raising and selling cattle was an important breakthrough in Dostonbek's life.  He wants to grow his business bigger and bigger buy buying a few calves, but he doesn't have the money.  He has decided to apply for a loan and he promises that his business will become the best in his region.

loans.use: to purchase a few calves

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Матлуба. Ей 53 года. Матлюба замужем за Карима. В браке у них родилась прекрасная дочка Угулой. Матлуба с мужем бок обок живут уже четверть века. 
  Матлуба дома занимается животноводством. В работе ей помогает муж. Ей нравится проводить время на скотном дворе и ухаживать за скотинами. На данный момент у нее осталось мало количество коров и Мутлуба планирует купить еще пару телят. Но чтобы реализовать задумку, нужны средства. Она будет признательна, если получит заемные средства и купить телят. Поддержите Угулой.
texts.en:
This is Matluba.  She is 53 years old and married to Karim.   Matluba and her husband have already lived side by side for a quarter century.  Their marriage produced their beautiful daughter, Uguloi.

Matluba works at home in the cattle business.  Her husband helps her with her work.  She likes to spend her time taking care of her cattle.  Currently she is down to only a few cows and Matluba is planning to buy a couple calves.  However, in order to turn her plans into reality, she needs money.  She will be grateful if she receives the loaned funds and can buy the calves.  Please support Uguloi!

loans.use: to buy a couple calves

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба приветливый, аккуратный и тактичный человек. Ей 25 лет, она замужем и замечательная мать двоих детей. Несколько лет назад  из-за финансовых проблем её муж уехал на заработки в другую страну, а Насиба осталась одна со своими детьми. Сначала муж хорошо зарабатывал за границей, но в последние годы из-за кризиса и он не смог отправить им деньги. Тогда Насибе и её детям стало трудно жить без денег, и она решила открыть свой бизнес по продаже женских национальных платьев. Все свои товары она шьет и продает на рынке сама. К счастью она достигла немалого успеха, и у неё стало много покупателей. Насиба всегда вежливо разговаривает со своими клиентами и даёт им совет. Она всегда встречает их с улыбкой. Сейчас ей заказали пошив новых платьев, но у неё нет достаточно денег на приобретение тканей и ниток. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Насиба надеется, что её подержат, и она сможет удивить своих клиентов своими новыми фантазиями.
texts.en:
Nasiba is a friendly, business like, and tactful person.  She is 25 years old, married, and the wonderful mother of two children.  Because they were having financial problems, several years ago her husband went to another country to find work and Nasiba was left alone with her two children.  At first her husband earned good money abroad.  However, as a result of the crisis, he has not been able to send money home for the last few years.  Without money, it became difficult for Nasiba and her children to live, so she decided to start her own business selling traditional women's dresses.  She herself makes and sells all her dresses at the market.  Happily, Nasiba found a good deal of success and she now has many clients.  She always greets her clients with a smile, speaks with them politely, and offers advice.

Recently she received an order for new dresses, but she does not have enough money to buy the fabric and thread.   For this reason she has applied for a loan.  Nasiba hopes that she will receive support so that she can amaze her clients with her new creations.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Then

texts.en: Then is a 37-year-old farmer, living in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother of five dependent children, two of whom are in school. She grows potatoes to support her family’s living for the last fifteen years. Her crops grow not well and this is a problem for her business. She can earn income about 25,000 KHR per day and she is able to save around 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting her family’s expenses. This is the fourth loan cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid back her past loans. With her past loans, it has helped her to have enough food and improve her living standard. She is now applying for new loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy organic fertilizer, pesticide and pay for labor fees to grow her crops and increase the productivity of her crop yields. She hopes that this loan will help her to gain more yields which she will be able to sell at a higher price. On the other hand, Then wants to buy a plot of land to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, pesticide and pay for labor fees to grow her crops and increase the productivity of her crop yields.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maricel has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is 26 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Sara requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Sara has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Jarlinda

texts.en:
Jarlinda is 52 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Jarlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, sugar, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 6 years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, sugar, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Melanie Mae

texts.en:
Melanie Mae is 25 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She has been running a general store in the Philippines for two years. She also earns income from fishing and from buying and selling charcoal. 

Melanie Mae has requested a loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, soap, milk, sugar and eggs.

Melanie Mae has borrowed and paid three previous loans from NWTF. She aspires to saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, soap, milk, sugar and eggs

loans.name: Delight

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Delight works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store.  

Delight is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation for her buy-and-sell vegetables business. She will use the loan to buy fruits and vegetables to sell at her food stall.
 
Delight has sustained her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell at her food stall

loans.name: Marla

texts.en:
Marla is married and works hard to support her family. She has a computer shop business in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years.

Marla has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy an additional computer unit for her business.

Marla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer unit for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ruth is 44 years old, and has two children who are currently in school.

Ruth has a business of selling herbal medicines in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF, to buy more herbal medicines to sell.  She successfully paid back her previous loan. and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ruth has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more herbal medicines to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 54 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stall.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stall

loans.name: Namkapor Group

texts.en: Bounna’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Bounna and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Bounna and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Bounna’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Na Tau 18 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoan, 26, is Thai ethnic lady who has been married and is the mother of a small daughter. She lives with her husband and her child in a small Thai ethnic traditional house at a small remote village. They rely on agricultural production for a living with several activities such as cultivating rice, raising pigs, chickens, ducks. Mrs. Thoan has taken lots of effort to increase production and improve income for her family. 

This is the first time she has received a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy piglets to expand pig farming. She hopes that with the continuing support of the Program, her investment will go well so that she can provide better for her family. 

Mrs. Thoan dreams a more abundant life for her family and a bright future for her children. In the picture, she wears a blue T-shirt and stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets to expand pig farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Severino

texts.en:
Severino lives in Enrile with his family. He is 58 years old and has 13 children. 

He has become a responsible father by providing for his family's needs through his transportation business. He provides transportation services to the people in his village. Sometimes, they also hire him as a private driver. 

Severino is now asking for additional capital of 15,000 Philippine pesos to invest in his business. He will use the loan for maintenance on his jeepney and to buy crude oil. 

He hopes to continue extending safe travel and good services to all his passengers. This will also help improve his income.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his jeepney and to buy crude oil

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 29 years old with three children. With two children in school, Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Teresa has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia is 61 years old and widowed with one child. Gaudencia works very hard to provide for them.

Gaudencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Gaudencia has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cereals, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, noodles, etc. 

Gaudencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leang Group

texts.en: Phaivanh understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Phaivanh knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Phaivanh purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Phaivanh is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 24 years old. He lives in Telavi with his wife.

Davit wants to open a clothes shop and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan for purchasing a stock of clothes. He will open a shop and his wife will be a saleslady there.

Davit and his wife are very hardworking and they hope that the business will be profitable. Davit awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a clothes shop.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 67 years old, he is a widower, now lives alone and he has his own house. Jose is a farmer who sells lettuce and other vegetables and he goes to many fairs to sell his produce around the territory of La Paz.

Jose needs a loan to buy seeds. He wants to expand his business to sell more vegetables, so he hopes you can help him.  Jose has experience,he is healthy and he works hard.

loans.use: to buy seeds for producing vegetables which he then sells

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 24-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah City, in the besieged Gaza Strip, where unemployment is very high. 

Wisam has a small business buying products wholesale and reselling them for a small profit margin. As part of this business, he must buy items in bulk (large quantities) and delivers them to his customers using his personal vehicle. Wisam's loan will enable him to buy more inventory and goods to resell, and eventually increase the size of his business and his income. 

Wisam has taken out a USD loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy more products to resell.
Wisam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell and deliver

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en:
Jayson is 37 years old, single and lives with his family at Amulung. He has been managing a sari-sari (variety) store for over 10 years now. He also distributes and sells cases of soft drinks to nearby stores in their village.

He wants to improve his income so he can save funds to invest in his corn farming business too. He has determination and patience in improving his different businesses.

He is now asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy grocery items and cases of soft drinks to resell. Jayson hopes to become a successful entrepreneur and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and cases of soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He makes a living doing maize/corn farming. He spends most of his income on meeting his financial obligations as a husband and father.
  
At the moment, Joseph's biggest challenge is the high cost of transporting goods to the market. Most farmers in his shoes resort to dealing with brokers and end up being exploited. Joseph is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas. 

With this asset, Joseph will be able to transport his produce to formal markets where he will get a good price for his produce.  
Investing a loan into Joseph's business will elevate his family’s livelihood and generate more income for them to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for the speedy delivery of his farm produce to market

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 29, supports two children. She has been a livestock keeper in the market for the last four years. This business earns her 6,000 Kenyan shillings per month. 

Rose has applied for her first loan, of 25,000 KES, from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for a supply of milk. She plans to use the profits she gains to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for a supply of milk

loans.name: Dolores Margarita

texts.es:
Dolores, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con su mamá a quien cuida porque está invalida. 

Dolores, se dedica a vender zapatos para adultos, este trabajo lo realizaba su mamá y ahora ella lo realiza para cubrir las necesidades económicas de su mamá, el horario de atención es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. después tiene que llegar a asear a su mamá y lavar su ropa. 

Dolores, necesita el crédito para comprar más zapatos para vender, porque poco a poco se ha ido quedando sin mercadería, debido a que es de ahí de donde paga los gastos hospitalización de su mamá.

El sueño de Dolores, es mantener su negocio para ayudar a sus hermanas en el estudio, ya que ansían sacar una carrera universitaria que les permita integrarse a una empresa.
texts.en: Dolores is 39 years old. She studied through high school, she is single, doesn't have any children and lives with her mother whom she cares for because she is handicapped. Dolores works selling shoes for adults. Her mother used to do this and now she does it to help with her economic needs. Her schedule is 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., thereafter she has to come home to clean her mother and do her laundry. Dolores needs the loan to buy more shoes to sell, because, little by little,  she has reduced her inventory which is the source for paying her mother's hospitalization. Dolores' dream is to keep this business to help her sisters in their studies, since they would like to have a college career to be able to join a company.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is aged 57 years and he supports 5 children.  He has been a dairy farmer in the market for the last 5 years and the business earns him KES 6,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to enable him supply more litres of milk for his clients. 

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate his children.

His hope is to expand his business sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk productionso as to enable him supply more litres of milk for his clients

loans.name: Khmoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Khmoeurn, who is a farmer living in Kampong Cham province, is 37 years old and married. She has three dependent children, two of whom are in school. The other one is too young.

The main source of income is from cassava growing on four hectares of farmland, and she has been in this business for 17 years. The recent crop was not successful enough to produce a good harvest, so Khmoeurn can earn little income to support her family’s living.

Now, she leads a group of four members to take out a new loan, which will be her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan, which was completely repaid, enabled her to improve her harvest and she could provide her family members with proper clothes.

For this new loan, as the group leader of four members, Khmoeurn will use her loan portion to pay for labor fees to support her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her growing business to improve her living standard and to start new cassava farming business.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees to support her farmland.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y sus hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Teofilo se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de lechones para su cría y posterior venta, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Teófilo espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 52 years old. He lives with his spouse and their children in a rural area of the district of Pucará, which is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern sierra of Peru. The residents of this district mainly work in agriculture, livestock and commerce. 

Teofilo raises and sells pigs. His business is located at his residence. He has 4 years' experience in the business and very good personal and work references in the area. The loan he is asking for will be used to buy a greater quantity of piglets to raise and then sell, as well as balanced feed for them. With this, Teófilo hopes to offer a better product to his customers, which will allow him to generate more income and therefore increase his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of piglets to raise and later sell, as well as buy balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus tres hijos de 15, 9 y 7 años de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Ana es una mujer trabajadora que posee una tienda  de productos básicos desde hace más de siete años en su lugar de residencia por lo que es muy reconocido en el sector ya que se encuentra ubicado en una zona muy transitada, además es una persona muy responsable y honesta con sus clientes lo que la ha llevado a ganarse su preferencia por sus productos de calidad y a precios accesibles. Ella con el deseo de mejorar su condición de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de: arena, cemento, ladrillo, grava y demás materiales para iniciar la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio el cual le pueda brindar a su familia una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Ana is a 35 year old single mother. She lives in her own home with her three children aged 15, 9 and 7 years old, all of whom are studying.

Ana is a hard-working woman who has ran a store selling basic products for the last seven years. The store is attached to her home and the area where Ana lives is a high transit area. 

Ana is a very responsible and honest woman and has earned her customers' loyalty for the quality of her products and accessible prices. 

With the goal of improving her living conditions, Ana is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy: sand, cement, bricks, gravel and other materials to start on the construction of a bedroom. This will provide her family with a higher level of comfort in their home.

loans.use: To buy: sand, cement, bricks, gravel and other materials to start on the construction of a bedroom.

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lorena de 27 años de edad, es madre soltera nació en la ciudad de Latacunga, en la parroquia la Matriz tiene dos hijos, vive en casa de familiares desde hace 6 años atrás, con el sacrificio de sus padres pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios.
El mayor obstáculo en su vida ha sido el que el padre de sus hijos no está con ellos, pese a esto  Lorena no ha escatimado en sacrificarse y dedicarse en un 100% a sus hijos y a darles lo mejor que en sus posibilidades está, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, perfumes y cosméticos, esto ha servido para sacar a sus hijos adelante.
Tiene ingresos adicionales ya que el padre de sus hijos le da una pequeña pensión para la manutención de los pequeños, Lorena es una joven trabajadora, emprendedora y muy responsable por la crianza y educación de sus hijos, por eso Lorena nunca se da por vencida y de cualquier modo tiene que ver como subsistir.
Desde muy pequeña ha trabajado con su madre quien se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida típica, en su negocio dedica toda la tarde para vender sus productos ya que en la mañana cuida de su hija pequeña y atiende su hogar
Lorena  se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, actividad que la aprendió de su cuñada 	quien le brindó todo su apoyo y ayuda en un principio, y desde ahí  ha tenido  gran acogida con su producto, tiene clientes potenciales en las instituciones públicas y privadas de la ciudad, es muy reconocida por su carisma y amabilidad para comercializar sus productos.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de más mercadería que por temporada navideña es muy buena y con gran acogida por las promociones que hay. Esto le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y utilidad.
Lorena quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en: Lorena is 27 years old. She is a single mother, and was born in the city of Latacunga, in the La Matriz parish. She has lived with relatives for the past 6 years, and was able to finish high school with the help of her parents.The greatest obstacle in her life is that the father of her children is not with them. In spite of this, she has dedicated 100% effort to help her children and give them the best. She works selling clothing, perfumes and cosmetics, which have helped her get ahead. Her children's father also gives her a small child support pension. Lorena is hard working, enterprising and very responsible with her children's education and care. Since very little, she has worked with her mother who works selling typical food. Lorena cares for her small child and the household in the morning, and in the afternoon she works selling her products. Lorena also works buying and selling beauty products by catalog. She learned this trade from her sister in law who supported and helped her at the beginning. She has had great support with these products, and has potential clients in public and private institutions in the city, as she is well liked for her friendliness and kindness to sell her products. She wants this loan to buy more merchandise for the Christmas season, which is a good time for her to promote her products. This will help her increase her earnings and profits. Lorena is grateful and congratulates Kiva for making it possible to help her grow in her personal and professional life.

loans.use: To buy more seasonal and popular merchandise, to improve her earnings and her children's quality of life.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 54 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Liberty has a general store business in the Philippines. Liberty requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Liberty has been in this business for five years. In the future, Liberty would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for sale

loans.name: Mai Group

texts.en:
Onsing is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

Onsing and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.

The water filter Onsing and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. Onsing and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases.

And after totaling up the costs, Onsing and his group recognized the substantial financial savings that the water filter will bring for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es:
La señora Alba Marina de 66  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus  hijos  en casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de ropa  usada y nueva, vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo  al sur de Honduras.
Doña Alba Marina es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de mercadería como pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, biquinis, zapatos, tenis, sandalias, etc. con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Junio del  2015.
texts.en:
Alba Marina, 66 years old, lives with her husband and children in a house they own. She has worked for 10 years at her business selling used and new clothing. She lives in the city of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.

Alba Marina is an enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead and she struggles day to day to improve her quality of life. She is asking for the loan to purchase merchandise such as pants, shirts, shorts, boxers, spandex, t-shirts, dresses, skirts, bikinis, shoes, athletic shoes, sandals, etc. With the support from the loan, she plans to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a return client and wants to continue working with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good business and expand her customer base and at the same time improve her future along with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – June 2015.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, shorts, boxers, spandex, t-shirts, dresses, skirts, bikinis, shoes, athletic shoes, sandals, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ana Azalia

texts.es: La vivienda en la que vive Ana es una herencia de sus padres y en ella habita junto a sus 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 7 años de edad y su compañero de vida. Ana se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de verduras actividad que realiza de forma ambulante recorriendo los cantones cercanos a su caserío, además aprovechando su recorrido recolecta materiales reciclables para obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Ana desea mejorar las paredes y techo de su vivienda ya que las láminas de estos se encuentran deterioradas por el paso del tiempo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar las paredes y techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: The house where Ana lives was inherited from her parents and she lives there with her 3 children, aged 17, 15 and 7, and her life's companion. Ana has worked for 20 years selling vegetables, an activity she does as a traveling saleswoman, going to the cantons near to her community. In addition, she takes advantage of her traveling to collect recyclable materials to obtain more income. Ana wants to improve the wall and the roof on her house, since the sheeting on them has deteriorated over time. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire to change the walls and roof of her home.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized  metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire to change the walls and roof on her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mats for resale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, de 46 años de edad, está casado, estudio hasta noveno grado, se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para realizar las labores agrícolas y ganaderas junto a su esposa.

Daniel, trabaja durante la mañana en trabajos agrícolas, mientras su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a ordeñar vacas; en la tarde trabaja como fontanero en la planta de bombeo de la comunidad donde vive. 

Daniel, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca para incrementar la producción de leche para vender y obtener mejores ingresos.

Daniel, desea tener una vivienda digna para su familia, porque actualmente es de lámina y en el invierno se filtra el agua y les daña sus electrodomésticos
texts.en:
Daniel, 46 years old, is married, went to school until the ninth grade, and gets up at 5:00 am to do the work of agriculture and animal husbandry along with his wife.

Daniel works during the morning at agricultural tasks while his wife takes care of the domestic chores and milks the cows. In the afternoon, he works as a plumber at a pumping station in the community where he lives.

Daniel needs the loan to purchase a cow to increase the milk production to sell and to get better income.

Daniel wants to have a dignified house for his family because currently it is made of metal sheeting and in the winter, water leaks in and damages the appliances.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to increase the production of milk to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables and thus get more income to meet her daily expenses such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Ma Yan Wa Village Group C

texts.en:
Thant, the featured borrower, is 40 years old and married. He has two children. Both of his children are at primary school, and Thant hopes he can support them till they graduate.

Proximity's loan will help Thant purchase fertilizer and other farming supplies. He farms at his small crop farm, and plants vegetables and flowers. His wife looks after the house chores and sells vegetables at the market.

Pictured above are the members from Ma Yann Wa Village Group C. Besides Thant, they are named Sein, Hla, Taw, Naing, Maung and Min. The group is overseen by a CBO leader and the fund will help each member purchase fertilizer and crop seeds.

Ma Yann Wa Village is located in the Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar. Most families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and crop seeds.

borrowers.first_name: Ma Yan Wa Village Group C

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “SANTA ROSA” conformada por 05 socias entusiastas  y responsables. Ella es Marisol una de las socias de 42 años de edad, separada con dos hijos dependientes. Con  deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida Marisol pone una bodega desde hace 4 años que tiene dicho negocio. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de menestras arroz y azúcar. El grupo “SANTA ROSA” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Marisol es la tercera del lado derecho viste casaca color marrón y está abrazando a hijito.
texts.en: This is the new group Santa Rosa, made up of 5 enthusiastic and responsible members. Marisol is one of the members. She is 42 years old, separated, with two dependent children. With the desire to improve her quality of life, Marisol set up a store four years ago that she has as a business. Her last loan will be used to purchase legumes, rice, and sugar. The Santa Rosa group is grateful to the people from Kiva who made this loan possible, since it allows them to continue improving. Marisol is the third from the right wearing a brown jacket and hugging her young son.

loans.use: to purchase legumes, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Wa'el

texts.en:
Wa'el is a 31-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living. 

So Wa'el took out a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a water purification system for the family house. By taking out this loan, Wa'el will be able to decrease the family expenses and provide clean water for his family. Wa'el appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for income gain through milk production and supply.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an Avon dealership business.

Nida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Candelario De Jesus

texts.es:
Candelario, de 66 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es agricultor, está acompañado, su pareja es ama de casa y tienen 2 hijos.

Candelario, toda su vida ha trabajado en la agricultura y criando ganado, desde muy pequeño su padre lo llevaba a que le ayudara a realizar trabajos jornales en las fincas donde él trabajaba.- Actualmente, trabaja un área de 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y frijol y tiene 4 vacas; para realizar estas actividades recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, los cuales están siempre en la disposición de ayudarle.

El crédito será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes para que sus cosechas sean robustas y brinde una buena producción. 

El sueño de Candelario, es mejorar su calidad de vida y tener más ganado.
texts.en:
Candelario, 66 years old, went to school up to the second grade, is a farmer, and is partnered. His partner is a housewife and they have 2 children.

Candelario has worked all his life in agriculture and raising livestock. When he was very young, his father brought him to help do the daily work in the farms where he worked. Currently, he works an area of 14,000 square meters of corn and bean cultivation and has 4 cows. To do this work, he gets help from his children, who are always willing to help him.

The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers so that his harvests are robust and offer a good production. 

Candelario's dream is to improve his quality of life and have more cattle.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vanessa is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Vanessa has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines. Vanessa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials needed for her business like mice, key boards, etc.

Vanessa has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Vanessa would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials needed for her business like mice, key boards, etc.

loans.name: Mauricio Ramón

texts.es:
Mauricio es un pequeño productor de café que vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 3 mz, de las cuales 1 ha dedicado para el cultivo de café, el cual maneja bajo los criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo.

En los últimos tres años, Mauricio ha incrementado su producción de café pasando de 15 a 36 quintales pergamino por manzana. Esta mejora sumada al potencial económico que ve en este rubro lo motiva a seguir invirtiendo en su pequeña finca. Por tal razón, está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cafetal, y con ello obtener mejores rendimiento en este nuevo ciclo.

Su expectativa es que su finca produzca mucho más y que sus hijos puedan heredar una finca productiva que les permita construir un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a small coffee grower who lives with his wife and children in a community in the north of Nicaragua. His farm is 3 manzanas large, of which 1 he has dedicated to coffee growing, which he manages under the Fair Trade certification criteria. 

In the last three years, Mauricio has increased his coffee production going from 15 to 36 quintales of pergamino coffee per manzana. This overall improvement of the economic potential that is seen in this field motivates him to continue investing in his small farm. For this reason, he is asking for a loan which will allow him to guarantee the purchase of manure and fertilizer to care for his coffee crop and, with it, get better results in this new growing season. 

His expectation is that his farm will produce a lot more and that his children will be able to inherit a productive farm that will allow them to build a better future.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer which will allow him to have a good harvest.

loans.name: Muhayyo

texts.ru: Махайё 41 год. Она живет с отцом, братом и дочкой. Именно брат и отец помогли Мухайё вырастить дочку. Теперь ее дочка выходит замуж и Мухайё необходимо купить ей приданное и сыграть свадьбу. На все это нужны деньги. Средства Мухайё не позволят ей провести хорошую свадьбу, потому что она недавно отремонтировала дом и уже 1 месяц не работала (была занята ремонтными хлопотами).  Она работает швеей. Мухайё приняла решение обратиться за кредитом и сыграть достойную свадьбу с традициями для единственной и любимой дочки.
texts.en: Muhayyo is 41 years old and lives with her father, brother and daughter.  It was her father and brother who helped Muhayyo to raise her daughter.  Now her daughter is getting married and Muhayyo has to buy the dowry and put on the wedding.  She needs money for all of it.  Muhayyo doesn't have the means to put on a good wedding because she recently finished renovating their home and didn't work for a month while she was busy with the repairs.  Muhayyo works as a seamstress.  She has decided to apply for a loan and hold a fitting wedding with all the traditions for her one and beloved daughter.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: Alcides Arnoldo

texts.es:
El señor Alcides de 38  años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que dependen de él, y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa,  se dedica desde hace 05  años al oficio de transportista en Mototaxis, cuenta con 2 unidades o mototaxis propias, una ya la pago y la otra ya le falta poco para cancelar.
Don Alcides sus clientes son todas las personas que se trasladan al municipio de san Isidro, es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de repuestos, accesorios para mejorar el motor de una unidad de mototaxi con este préstamo el pretende mejorar su unidad  y su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de seguir trabajando  con Prisma.
Uno de sus sueños es  crecer con su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias para sacar adelante a su familia.

San Lorenzo valle, Honduras – Junio del  2015.
texts.en:
Alcides, age 38, has two dependent children. He lives in his own house with his wife. For five years he has been a 'mototaxi' [three wheeled motorized vehicle] driver. He has two of his own mototaxis. He has already paid for one, and there is a little left to pay on the other one. Alcides's customers are all of the people who travel through the San Isidro municipality. He is an enterprising man with the desire to improve his quality of life.

He is requesting the loan to buy replacement parts and accessories in order to improve improve the motor in one of the mototaxis. With this loan he plans to improve his vehicle and his quality of life. He is a returning client, who wishes to continue working with Prisma.

One of his dreams is to grow with his business and to improve his earnings in order to get his family ahead.

San Lorenzo valle, Honduras – June, 2015.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and accessories for his business.

loans.name: Nakulabye Maziima Group

texts.en:
Nakulabye Maziima is an exemplary group since their values involve truth, just like the name suggests. They all are engaged in different activities to earn their livelihoods. All the members are engaged in different activities such as agriculture, grocery, and vegetable sales businesses.

One person who deserves to be highlighted is Ronald (the gentleman raising his hand in the photo), a 43-year-old man with five children, who is engaged in cultivating vegetables and selling them in the market. Through his job, he works to support his family, to improve his business, and to continue growing. He is a very determined person who wants to continue expanding the business.

He is seeking part of this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other vegetables and fruits to continue to increase his sales. The group is very grateful for this opportunity for growth that it is receiving.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like vegetable seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 59 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Consolacion works very hard to provide for them.

Consolacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, cereals, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc. to sell.

Consolacion has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cereals, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc. 

Consolacion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, cereals, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 37, is a mother of four dependent children, two of whom are in school.

She is a farmer living in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She struggles for a living via cassava growing on a two-hectare area and working for others for a fee in order to supplement her income.

Her cassava crop has not been producing good harvests. Thus, in order to get more capital to support her business, she is applying for a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is her first loan and she will use the loan to buy cashew trees to grow so that she can earn supplementary income to sustain her family's expenses.

She hopes that her cashew trees will produce good harvests so that she can earn more income to update her living standard and to support her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy cashew trees to grow so that she can earn supplementary income to sustain her family's expenses.
