location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Cristine Mae is 19 years old and is the first of three children in the family. She is pictured with her mother, Bebelyn, who supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Cristine Mae is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education and is currently on her third year of this four-year course.

Bebelyn is borrowing PHP 6,000 to pay for tuition fees of the first semester and third year.

When she graduates, Cristine Mae plans to be gainfully employed so she can help improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Carlos Saul

texts.es:
Carlos es un pequeño productor del norte de Nicaragua. Junto a su esposa e hijos se dedican a la producción de café, desde hace más de 10 años, tiempo en el que, con mucho esfuerzo, ha logrado mejorar la calidad del manejo y los rendimientos de su pequeña finca.

Carlos logró que su producción de café en los tres últimos ciclos haya aumentado de manera significativa, por lo que está consciente de la importancia del manejo para este rubro si se quiere obtener mejores rendimientos.

Para este ciclo, Carlos está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas que aplicará a su cafetal a fin de garantizar el buen manejo nutricional de su plantación, y con ello una mejor cosecha y mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a small grower in the north of Nicaragua. Along with his wife and children, he has worked growing coffee for over 10 years, time in which he has, with a lot of effort, managed to improve the quality of management and the production of his small farm. 

Carlos managed to have his coffee production increase significantly in the past three growing seasons, so he is aware of the importance of management in this field if he wants to get better results. 

For this season, Carlos is asking for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies that he will apply to his coffee crop with the end of guaranteeing good nutritional care of his plantation and, with it, a better harvest and more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies that his coffee crop needs and to assure a good harvest.

loans.name: Xay Group

texts.en:
Onchanh’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Onchanh and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which he can now shift to other pursuits.

Onchanh and his village also understand the impact that unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years, filter users like Onchanh’s family should see a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ernesto José

texts.es:
Ernesto es un pequeño caficultor, con más de 5 años de experiencia en este rubro. Vive en una pequeña comunidad al norte de Nicaragua con su esposa. Desde pequeño ha estado dedicado a las actividades del café, el cual considera es un rubro bastante rentable.

El ciclo anterior la plantación de café de Ernesto fue afectada por la Roya, lo cual hizo que su producción disminuyera. Para este año, él está solicitando un crédito que le permita mejorar su producción mediante la compra y aplicación de insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su cafetal.

El sueño de este productor es contar con una finca productiva que le permita mejorar las condiciones de su familia, brindándoles a sus hijos mejores oportunidades que las que él ha tenido.
texts.en:
Ernesto is a small coffee grower with more than 5 years of experience in this field. He lives in a small community in the north of Nicaragua with his wife. Since he was little, he has worked in coffee-related tasks, which he considers to be a rather profitable field.  

In the previous growing season, Ernesto was affected by coffee rust, which reduced his production. For this year, he is asking for a loan that will allow him to improve his production through the purchase and application of supplies and fertilizers that his coffee crop needs. 

This grower's dream is to have a productive farm that allows him to improve his family's conditions, offering his children better opportunities than he has had.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers that he will apply to the coffee crops on his farm.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah City, in the besieged Gaza Strip, where unemployment is very high. Mahmoud has a small business buying products wholesale and reselling them for a small profit margin. As part of this business, he must buy items in bulk (large quantities) and deliver them to his customers using his personal vehicle. 

Mahmoud has taken out a USD loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy more products to resell. Mahmoud's loan will enable him to buy more inventory and goods to resell, and eventually increase the size of his business and his income. He has been transporting goods using his rickshaw for the past six months.

loans.use: to buy more products and to resell and transport them to the local traders.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es: Maritza de 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia a lado de su hija y de sus dos nietos de 8 y 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos  para obtener sus ingresos, además recibe el apoyo de su esposo que hace algún tiempo emigro al extranjero en busca de mejores oportunidades económicas. Maritza con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia está buscando la forma de poder construir un cuarto dormitorio pero debido a que no cuenta con el capital ha tomado la decisión de adquirir un crédito en FUSAI para la compra de los materiales necesarios como son: arena, hierro, cemento, grava, lamina, etc., y de esa forma comenzar con la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Maritza, 44 years old, lives in her own house with her daughter and her two grandchildren, ages 8 and 2. She is a woman who works in domestic service to earn her income. In addition, she gets the support of her husband who, some time ago, emigrated abroad in search of better economic opportunities. Maritza, with the goal of improving her living conditions and that of her family, is looking for a way to be able to build a bedroom but due to not having the capital, she has decided to get a loan from FUSAI to purchase the needed materials which are sand, metal, cement, gravel, metal sheeting, etc., and in this way begin the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in sand, metal, cement, gravel, metal sheeting, etc. and in this way begin to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a sari-sari (general) store owner from Alcantara, Cebu. She is a 33-year-old married woman and has a five years old son. Marilyn has been in the business of sari-sari store for four years. She earns about PHP15000 per month. Aside from sari-sari store business, Marilyn has been engaged in raising hogs. 

With that, she is requesting a loan to buy feed, some for school fees and the other part is to buy assorted goods for her sari-sari store such as canned goods, cooking oil, spices, noodles, chips, candies, biscuits, powdered milk, powdered juice, coffee, sugar and soft drinks. Marilyn’s greatest dream is to send his son to school and for him to have a degree in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, canned goods, cooking oil, spices, noodles, chips, candies, biscuits, powdered milk, powdered juice, coffee, sugar and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens for egg production and supply

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old, married and supports a family of 3 children. She has been practicing farming for the last 3 years earning KES 5,500 per month. 

Jane has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy egg layers for egg production and supply in the area for more income gain.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy egg layers for eggs production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana,  tiene 31 años de edad, es concubina tiene tres hijos dependientes de su ingreso, vive en una comunidad rural donde hace mucho frio y muy alejada al área urbano.
La señora Emiliana se dedica a la agricultura porque es la única actividad que aprendió de su padre, este año sus cultivos de papa fueron afectados por una plaga, aun así por el esfuerzo y la dedicación pudo controlar dicha enfermedad que estaba atacando a sus cultivos. Cuando cosecho su producto el precio de la papa estuvo muy bajo y tuvo que venderlo a un precio bajo quedándose con poca ganancia. 
La señora Emiliana es una persona fuerte con ganas de superarse y con lo poco que gano invirtió nuevamente en el cultivo de la papa y una helada le echo a perder sus plantaciones de papa. La comunidad entera sufrió los daños. 
Por estos motivos mencionados su estabilidad económica ha sufrido un desequilibrio, afectando directamente a sus ingresos y no tiene dinero para comprar e invertir nuevamente en la compra de semilla e insumos agrícolas que se requieren para la producción y para la alimentación de sus hijos. La Señora Emiliana, es una persona respetada en la comunidad donde trabaja, por lo dedicado al trabajo agrícola, con  lo cual saca a su familia adelante. Por esta situación en la que se encuentra está solicitando el préstamo para comprar semilla de papa, abonos de esta manera mejorar su economía y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Emiliana is 31 years old, is partnered, and has three children dependent on her income. She lives in a rural community where it is very cold and it is very far from the urban area. 

Emiliana works in agriculture since it is the only work she learned from her father. This year her potato crops were affected by an infestation, though with effort and dedication she was able to control this disease which was attacking her crops. When she harvested her product, the price of potatoes was very low and she had to sell them at a low price, leaving her with little earnings. 

Emiliana is a strong person with desire to improve herself and with the little that she earned, she re-invested it in the cultivation of potatoes and a frost ruined her potato crops. The entire community suffered the damage. 

For the mentioned reasons, her economic stability has suffered a disequilibrium, directly affecting her income and she doesn't have money to make purchases and re-invest in the purchase of seeds and agricultural supplies that she needs to for the production and to feed her children. Emiliana is a respected person in the community where she works, for how dedicated she is to agricultural work with which she has gotten her family ahead. 

For this situation she finds herself in, she is asking for the loan to purchase potato seeds and manure and, in this way, improve her economic situation and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and manure and in this way improve her economic situation and quality of life.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 59 years old and married with seven children. With one child in school, Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, personal care products, home care products, etc.

Victoria has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future, Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, personal care products, home care products, etc.

loans.name: Yessenia Yamileth

texts.es:
Yessenia, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, su esposo vive en los Estados Unidos, tiene dos hijos que aún viven en casa, solo ellos viven en casa con ella.

Yessenia, se dedica a la venta de antojitos desde hace 5 años aproximadamente, decidió dedicarse a esta actividad, porque necesitaba ingresos para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y ella anda vendiendo casa por casa sus productos.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar yuca, aceite, harina y sal para preparar los antojitos.

Sus sueños son, tener un negocio que le rinda más ganancias y así no estar dependiendo solo de la ayuda de su esposo.
texts.en:
Yessenia, 33 years old, studied up to ninth grade. She is married and her husband lives in the United States. She has two children who still live at home; only they live at home with her.

Yessenia has been selling fried snacks for about five years now. She decided to do this occupation because she needed income to help her husband with household expenses. She goes from house to house selling her products. The loan will be used to buy cassava, oil, flour, and salt to prepare the fried snacks.

Her dreams are to have a business that yields her more profits and thus not keep being dependent only on the help of her husband.

loans.use: to buy cassava, oil, flour, and salt to prepare fried snacks.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, 35, is a smallholder farmer based in Kapsowar, a small rural town which is situated in the North Rift region of Kenya. He has been doing this work for the last ten years to provide for his family. His primary income sources are milk and crops. Moses enjoys farming a lot. Looking after his cattle, however, is quickly becoming a serious challenge. His cattle stray from time to time from the designated grazing area into other people's farms. The consequences of this can be very severe, leading to disputes which can escalate to violence and hostility. 

Moses is seeking a loan to pay for fencing wire to fence his farmland. The $25 or more dollar loan you make will enable Moses to have small paddocks created by fencing to make stocking more intensive. The paddocks will also be designed to build up feed supply, which will also force the stock to graze a wider range of plants, and allow the plants to recover after grazing. The fence will also protect his crops from pests. 

When asked how the loan would benefit his family, he replied, "Improves security in my compound, improves stock management, and keeps my neighbours happy.

loans.use: To fence his farm land to prevent his cattle from straying and causing problems with neighbours

loans.name: Sokloeurn's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Memot district of Kampong Cham province, Sokloeurn is 22 years old and a mother of a child who is dependent on her and is not yet school-aged.

She grows cassava on two hectares area to earn the family's main source of income and she has been in this business for two years.

This year, the crop is not growing well. As a result, she cannot get good outputs to sell. Therefore, Sokloeurn leads a group of two to apply for a new loan; this is the third cycle for her. Her previous loan, which enabled her to provide her family with proper clothes, was completely repaid.

This time, Sokloeurn, the group leader, will use the loan to pay for labor workers fees and to buy organic herbicide to kill the weeds blocking the growth of her cassava crop. She hopes to earn more income to support her family and to add a hectare of land to grow cassava.

loans.use: To pay for labor workers fees and to buy organic herbicide to kill the weeds blocking the growth of her cassava crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new moto rickshaw's body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Thin's Group

texts.en:
Thin, 34, is married and a farmer living in Sandan district of Kampong Thom province. She has three children, one of whom is underage for school. Growing cassava has been her main source of income for 14 years. 

For her leisure time, she manages to use it wisely as she tries work for others for a fee for a supplementary income. Sadly, this year, she will get lower-than-expected outputs because her crop was unhealthy. In fact, it earns her about 25,800 KHR per day to support her family. 

Thin now leads a group of five members to apply for a loan, which will be her first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), to build a decent latrine for her family members to use. She hopes that her family members will live comfortably and avoid infectious disease.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family members to use.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам начинающий предприниматель. Ему 41 лет. Он женат. В браке имеет двоих детей. Жена Рустама занимается продажей горох на базаре. Рустам решил начать новый бизнес. Он хочет стать успешным человеком, чтобы его дети гордились им. Рустам очень хорошо готовит и решил воспользоваться своим талантом. Он откроет свое маленькое кафе. Где его основным и коронным блюдом будет его шашлыки собственного приготовления. Рустам не сомневается, что его бизнес будет успешным. Для приобретения столиков и продуктов он обратился за заемными средствами. Он надеется, что мир не без добрых людей и найдутся люди, которые поддержат его в начинаниях.
texts.en:
Rustam is a beginning entrepreneur.  He is 41 years old, married, and has two children.  Rustam's wife sells peas at the bazaar.  Rustam decided to start a new business.  He wants to be a successful man so that his children will be proud of him.  Rustam is an excellent cook and he decided to take advantage of his talent by opening a small café.  His specially made shish kabobs will be his specialty and his primary dish.  

Rustam has no doubt that his business will be successful.  He has applied for a loan in order to buy tables and food supplies.  Rustam hopes that there are good people in the world who will support him in his endeavor.

loans.use: to open a small cafe

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is a 58-year-old widower and a rice farmer with three children and lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. He has cultivated rice since 1988. Among his three children, one works as a factory worker, one is a driver and another is in school. Together, the family makes around USD13 each day. 

San's house is old and he would like to build a new one, but he is lacking the money to buy construction materials. That’s why he has decided to apply for a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI. With this loan, he will have sufficient construction materials to finish building his house in this rainy season and provide his children with better living conditions. 

In the future, he is going to buy more farmland and support his studying child through university.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a new house

loans.name: Iuni

texts.en: Iuni is 25 years old and has a partner for3 years with 2 children. She runs a small business selling ice-cakes in her community and has been doing this for 1 years. Iuni has requested a loan to buy new freezer, plastic bags, Chinese lollies, bag of sugar, cordial etc. She joined SPBD in June this year 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Iuni will spend it to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy new freezer, plastic bags, Chinese lollies (icepops), bag of sugar, spoons, etc.

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Josephina, who is in her early 40s, is single with three kids who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for eight years now. She works from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Josephina's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restore the out-of-stock items in her mamalishe (food stall) stock. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Josephina will share this loan with her loan group  Bega kwa Bega, which consists of three people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restore the out-of-stock items in her mamalishe (food stall) stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, cement, metal sheeting, nails, and wood, etc. to build a sink and a shed.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalope offers the grinding of glutinous rice and coconut within the market. She is married and had four children. Guadalope is 60 years old, yet she aims to have a stable source of income. She was grateful with her previous loan because it contributed to her rice and coconut grinding business.

Guadalope would like to request another loan amounting to PHP 25,000. She will use this amount of loan in buying five cavans of glutinous rice and one cavan of sugar to sell. She knows that she could further increase her income through this amount of loan.

Guadalope hopes to obtain the amount of loan she requested.

loans.use: to buy five cavans of glutinous rice and one cavan of sugar to sell

loans.name: Necencia

texts.en:
Necencia is 62 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Necencia is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Necencia has been in pig fattening for 30 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more stock of items to sell in her general store.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 10 years. Elizabeth earns more income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Crysten

texts.en:
Crysten is 32 years old and married with four children.  With four children in school, Crysten works very hard to provide for them.

For 10 years, Crysten has operated a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

In the future, Crysten would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 78 years old and widowed with eight children. Crisanta works very hard to provide for them.

Crisanta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, school supplies, home care products, and other groceries.

Crisanta has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Crisanta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, school supplies, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Jesus-Marie

texts.en:
Jesus-Marie is 24 years old and comes from Burundi.   He was accepted by Kepler from over 6,000 applicants, showing his motivation and ability through his high school results, standardized testing and a personal interview.

Jesus-Marie is one of six boys.  His family has moved to the capital city of Burundi from the countryside.   He says he works hard, continuing until he succeeds.  For fun, he likes to swim, either in a pool or Tanganyika lake. 

He will graduate Kepler with an AA and a BA from an accredited US university.  After Kepler, he wants both to find a job and to start his own business.  This will give him the means to help his family expand their business to include exports.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Malala Dimbiniaina Saraha

texts.fr:
Saraha est une jeune femme très simple mais travailleuse de 25 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari travaille en tant que soudeur dans un petit atelier d'ouvrage métallique. Ils ont ensemble deux enfants de 2 et 4 ans et  seul l'ainé va à l'école actuellement.
Pour aider son mari à soutenir la famille, elle décidait d'exercer une activité source de revenu en 2011. Elle commençait un petit commerce de vêtements fripes. Pour pouvoir développer son activité c'est à dire augmenter les quantités des marchandises et renforcer son fonds de roulement, elle demande du crédit. C'est le seul moyen qu'elle trouve plus rapide et efficace. Son souhait est de devenir une grossiste dans ce domaine un jour.
texts.en:
Saraha is a simple, hard-working, young woman.  She is twenty-five years old and married to a welder who works in a small metal-working workshop.  Together, they have two children who are two and four years old.  The eldest currently attends school.

In order to help her husband provide for their family, Saraha began earning a living in 2011.  She sells second-hand clothing.  She would like to expand her business by increasing the amount of stock she offers and increasing her working capital.  This is why she has requested a loan from the field partner.  Saraha believes this is the quickest and most effective way to achieve her goals.  In the future, she would like to become a second-hand clothing supplier.

loans.use: to buy 2 bundles of second-hand shirts for resale.

loans.name: William Patricio

texts.es:
Williames un joven ecuatoriano el mismo que  nació en la  parroquia Mulaló perteneciente al cantón Latacunga tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa propia de los padres en una zona rural en este sector es muy conocido por la actividad lechera, tiene su tienda en el mismo sector, además trabaja  como obrero.
Con el esfuerzo de sus padres pudo terminar la universidad, por la difícil situación económica  de su familia tuvo que trabajar desde muy pequeño y así poder ser un gran apoyo para él y su familia.
Ha sentido la difícil situación de no poder encontrar trabajo por la falta de oportunidades, pero pese a esto no se ha dado por vencido y ha salido adelante con su pequeño negocio.
Esta tienda le dejó su madre ya que ella por motivos de salud no pudo atenderla y ahora ella se dedica  a elaborar pan en casa, Por el momento solicita un crédito paralelo al que ya se le otorogo en Fundacion Alternativa, el mismo que lo utilizara para comprar mas mercadería para su pequeña tienda, G y esto mejorará sus ingresos y por ende sus utilidades.
Su mayor sueño es que algún momento pueda comprarse un carro ya que esto facilitará su movilización , y ahora William  quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
William is a young Ecuadorian man who was born in Mulalío parish, which is part of Latacunga canton. He is 22 years old, single, and lives in his own house with his parents in a rural area in this sector, which is very well-known for its dairy production. He has his store in this sector and, in addition, he works as a laborer.  

With his parents' efforts, he was able to finish university. Due to his family's difficult economic situation, he has to work since he was very little and so be able to be a great support for him and his family. 

He has experienced the difficult situation of not being able to find work due to the lack of opportunities, but despite this, he has not given up and he has gotten ahead with his little business.

This store was left to him by his mother who, due to health reasons, couldn't run it and now she works making bread at home. For the moment, he asks for a loan parallel to the one that Fundación Alternativa granted him, which he will use to purchase more merchandise for his small store, and with this will improve his income and, in the end, his profits.  

His greatest dream is that at some point he will be able to purchase a car since it will help him get around. And now William wants to extend a sincere thank you and greetings to Kiva for making possible the growth in his work and personal life.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise and stock his business, so he will increase his income and the quality of his life with his parents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kinds of hair oils for her husband's hair oil selling business.

loans.name: Pouli

texts.en:
Pouli is 37 years old and has a partner for 2 years with 1 child. She runs a small business selling banana chips in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Pouli has requested a loan to buy bags of salt, plastic bags, bananas, cooking oil, etc. She joined SPBD in June this year 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Pouli will spend it to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, plastic bags, bananas, bags of salt, etc.

loans.name: Lailihon

texts.en:
Lailihon is a confident woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is living in village with her family, is married and has two children. She is a farmer and works hard and responsibly. Her standard of living is poor and she is used to work to earn money to ensure her family. Additionally she works at the library as a cleaning woman. Her husband was an emigrant, but unfortunately he could not find a job and came back home. Recently he is busy with agriculture and earns less than usual. 

Her son went to serve in the army. And because of his health issues he is at medical clinic now and is getting treatment. Lailihon hasn’t time and gets tired at two jobs. She appealed to IMON asking financial support to pay for her son’s treatment at the medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits you compassion.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s treatment at a medical clinic

loans.name: Dodarbek

texts.ru: Додарбек из района Кубадиён. Ему 32 лет и он женат. У Додарбека есть двое прекрасных детей. Он очень любит свою семью. Додарбека в районе знают как лучшего повара по приготовлению гриля. Он сам лично отвечает за весь процесс приготовления гриля и очень ответственно относится к своей работе. Всем нравится, как он готовит гриль. У него есть постоянные клиенты, которые даже в выходные дни заказывают у него. Он сам доволен, тем, что удовлетворяет своих клиентов. У Додарбека есть желание, расширит свой бизнес. Он решил обратиться за кредитом и купить новый аппарат для приготовления шаурмы. Он очень надеется что ему помогут в этом.
texts.en:
Dodarbek is from the Qubadiyon region.  He is 32 years old and married.  He has two wonderful children and he loves his family very much.  He is known in the region for being an excellent grill cook.  Everyone likes how he grills.  He alone answers for the entire process and approaches his work very responsibly.  He has regular clients who come by to place an order even on their days off.  Dodarbek is pleased when he satisfies his 
customers.

Dodarbek wants to expand his business and has decided to take out a loan to buy a machine for making shawarma.  He hopes that people will help him with this.

loans.use: to buy a machine for making shawarma

loans.name: Nely Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Nely Suyapa de 39  años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio todo lo relacionado a la canasta básica familiar, también tiene unas máquinas comúnmente llamadas Videojuegos, donde sus clientes son los niños que llegan a jugar todos los días.
Doña Nely es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, huevos, pan, churros, frescos, jugos, lácteos, jabón, pollo,  etc. para surtir la pulpería,  con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Junio del  2015.
texts.en:
Nely Suyapa, age 39, lives with her husband and children in her own house. She has had a business selling grocery store items for ten years. She has everything for the family’s basic needs in her business. She also has some machines that are commonly called video games, where her customers are children who come to play every day.

Nely is an enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead. She struggles day to day to improve her quality of life.

She is requesting the loan to buy products like rice, sugar, beans, eggs, bread, churros, soft drinks, juices, dairy products, soap, and chicken, etc. in order to stock her grocery store. With the support of this loan she plans to improve her income and her quality of life as well. She is a client with the desire to continue working with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good, well-stocked business and to improve her future with her family at the same time.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – June, 2015.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, eggs, bread, churros, soft drinks, juices, dairy products, soap, and chicken, etc. in order to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Lidia Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Lidia Angélica de 68  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus  hijas  en su casa  propia, se dedica desde hace 21 años al negocio de venta de rosquillas, quesadillas, y rosquetes,  sus clientes son personas de la zona y también tiene contratos con personas de otros lugares.
Doña Lidia Angélica vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como: maíz, cuajada, leña y manteca que son la materia prima que necesita para elaborar sus rosquillas, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de seguir trabajando  con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un gran taller de rosquillas con varias empleadas y que su hija más adelante  tome el control de todo el negocio cuando ella ya no pueda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Julio del  2015
texts.en:
Lidia Angélica, 68 years old, lives with her husband and her daughters in their own house. She has worked for the past 21 years selling rosquillas [a ring-shaped sweet bread], quesadillas, and rosquetes [a ring-shaped sweet bread]. Her customers are people in the zone and also she has contracts with people in other areas.

Lidia Angélica lives in a village in the south of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead and struggle each day to improve her quality of life. She is asking for the loan to purchase products such as corn, curd, firewood, and butter which are the raw materials she needs to make her rosquillas. With the support of this loan, she plans to increase her income and also improve her quality of life. She is a return client with desires to continue working with Prisma. 

Her dream is to have a large rosquillas shop with a number of employees and that her daughter takes control of the business in the future when she no longer can. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – July  2015

loans.use: to purchase corn, curds, firewood, and butter for her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 59 years old and married with eight children, two of whom in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy adiitonal sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 11 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy adiitonal sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn is 35 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Marilyn has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Marilyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Hary's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a remote area of Kampong Cham province, Hary is 44-year-old and she is a mother of three dependent children. Nowadays, she does rice farming as the main source of her family’s income. Meanwhile, her husband is working as a construction worker to earn additional income. She has been with this business for twenty-six years. Her rice has not grown well because of insects, so it affected for her daily income. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four cycles already and she repaid her past loans completely. With her past loan, it has helped her to improve her family’s living buy having enough consumption to support her family. Hary is the leader of a group, which contains two members to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund. 

She is willing to take her new loan of 1,500,000KHR and another member is seeking of 1,500,000KHR as well. Hary will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to grow her rice crop well and increase her crop yields. She hopes that this loan will help her to gain more yields than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to grow her rice crop well and increase her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Humanisme 4 Group

texts.fr:
Marguerite est une femme veuve âgée de 57 ans. Vendeuse de plus  10 ans. Son expérience dans l’activité et son bon accueil de la clientèle sont pour elle un atout pour faire marcher son activité.
Elle veut le prêt pour acheter le petit mille (3 sacs, l’arachide (3 sacs) les oranges et mangues en quantité suffisante pour son commerce.  Elle a déjà reçu le prêt plusieurs fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Marguerite is 57 years old and a widow.  She has worked as a small retailer for more than ten years and believes that her experience and welcoming nature attract customers and ensure her business is successful.

She plans to use her loan to buy three sacks of pearl millet, three sacks of peanuts, oranges and mangoes.

Marguerite has already had several loans and has always repaid them fully and on time.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, oranges, 3 sacks of peanuts and 3 sacks of pearl millet

loans.name: Nay Yaung Kar Village Group A

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Tan (pictured left) is 59 years old and married with eight children. Tan is proud that all of his children are married and working on their own. Tan owns five acres of crop farm, and plants coconuts, betel leaves and banana for additional income. Tin's wife looks after the livestock, such as pigs, chickens and ducks, which they raise for extra income and their savings.

 Proximity's loan will help the family purchase fertilizers, crop seeds and gases for agricultural machines. Tin aims to expand his fish raising business by the end of the year. Fish raising and crop farming are becoming a very popular for businesses in the area.

Pictured above are the members from Nay Yaung Kar Village Group A, named Tan, Myint, Soe, Tar and Thaung. These members are overseen by a CBO (Community Based Leader). The fund will help each member to purchase fertilizers and gases for crop machines. 

Nay Yaung Kar Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar, which includes 700 households in the village. Most of the families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and gases for agricultural machines.

borrowers.first_name: Nay Yaung Kar Village Group A

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is a generous woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1968 and is living in village with her family. She is married and has two children. She is hardworking, bright and talented person. 

Her daughter is ill. The standard of their living is poor. She has not money to buy medicines for her daughter. Her business in agriculture is not giving her enough money. She plants vegetables and keeps livestock. Her life began a difficult period, but still tries her best to ensure and feed her family. 

She appealed to IMON asking financial support from Kivalenders to buy medicines to her daughter. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her daughter

loans.name: Angelica Yadira

texts.es:
La joven  Angélica Yadira de 27  años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hija  en su casa  propia, se dedica desde hace 04 años al negocio de venta de quesadillas y rosquillas,  sus clientes son personas de la zona y también tiene clientes en la zona de Pespire,  vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras.
Angélica Yadira es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de  maíz, cuajada, manteca, leña, etc. que son la materia prima que necesita para elaborar los panes, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de seguir trabajando  con Prisma.
Uno de sus sueños es tener una gran clientela para mejorar sus ventas y al mismo tiempo sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del  2015.
texts.en:
Angélica Yadira is 27 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in their own house and has worked for 4 yeas selling quesadillas and rosquillas [a ring-shaped sweet bread]. Her customers are people in the zone and she also has customers in the zone of Pespire. She lives in a village in the south of Honduras.

Angélica Yadira is an enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead and struggle each day to improve her quality of life. She is asking for a loan to purchase corn, curds, butter, firewood, etc. which are the raw materials she needs to make her breads. With the support of this loan, she plans to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a return client with desire to continue working with Prisma.

One of her dreams is to have a large customer base to improve her sales and at the same time her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, curds, butter, firewood, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is 32 years old and married with 1 child. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. 

Sina has requested a loan to buy fishing net, fishing gear, spear, goggles, torch, etc. She joined SPBD in June this year 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sina will spend it to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear, spear, fishing shoes, fishing net, torch, etc.

loans.name: Serey's Group

texts.en:
Serey, a farmer living in Kam Rieng district of Battambang province is 34 years old and a mother of three dependent children. To make a living, she grows cassava to earn the main source of income. Additionally, she works as a paid worker to earn supplementary her income. Her cassava business is growing slowly for there is insufficient capital to support. 

Serey is now leading a group of seven members to take out a new loan. This is the second cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid back her past loan. In fact, the previous loan has enabled her to support her living condition and renovate her house better than before. Anyway, this new loan will be used to pay for plowing fees, buy cassava seeds and organic fertilizers, which are expected to increase the crop products better. She hopes to earn more income to buy more organic fertilizers to increase the productivity of crop much better.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees, buy cassava seeds and organic fertilizers, which are expected to increase the crop products better.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Beverly has been in this business for six years. Beverly earns additional income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Minda dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Pao's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kratie province, Pao is 33 years old and a mother of four children. She struggles for a living via cassava growing on 1.5 hectares of her farmland. In order to earn supplementary income, she works for others for a fee. 

Pao’s main challenges are getting lower outputs from the cassava business and being able to sell the crop at a lower price. Thus, she can manage to earn about 27,700 KHR per day to support family’s needs. 

She forms a group of two members to take out a loan, which is the first time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizers and organic pesticide to prevent pests on her crop, which will hopefully result in producing more crop products. She hopes to increase the crop products, and she wants the price of the crop to rise.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and organic pesticide to prevent pests on her crop, which will hopefully result in producing more crop products.

loans.name: Nay Yaung Kar Village Group C

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Aye (pictured center) is 54 years old and married with eight children. He farms at his five acres of crop farm while his wife looks after the livestock that they raise for additional income. 

He is looking forward to purchasing fertilizer and crop seeds with the help of Proxmity's loan. Since Aye values education, he sent all of his children through high school.  They are now working by themselves with their own family. 

Pictured above are the members from Nay Yaung Kar Village Group C, named Saw, Sa, Khin M, Khin O and Myint. These members are overseen by a CBO (Community Based Leader). The fund will help each member to purchase fertilizer and crop seeds.

Nay Yaung Kar Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar, which includes 700 households. Most of the families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and crop seeds.

borrowers.first_name: Nay Yaung Kar Village Group C

loans.name: Jesus Alexis

texts.es:
Jesús es un pequeño cafetalero de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Con 37 años de edad, es un productor apasionado por lo que hace. Junto su esposa, trabaja su pequeña finca para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 

La actividad agrícola a la que se dedica fue herencia de su padre, y es algo que ahora él también está transmitiendo a sus hijos involucrándolos en algunas actividades de la finca. En los tres últimos ciclos, este productor ha logrado mantener el volumen y calidad de su cosecha, y para mantener el buen desarrollo de su producción, ha elaborado un plan de mantenimiento para el cual está solicitando un financiamiento, en particular para la compra de insumos que requiere aplicar a sus cafetos. Jesús confía que con un manejo adecuado, logrará mejores resultados en la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Jesús is a small coffee farmer of the northern part of Nicaragua. At 37 years old, he is a producer passionate about what he does. Alongside his wife, he works his small farm to improve their living conditions. The agricultural business that he works in was a heritage of his father, and it's something that now he is also transmitting to his children, engaging them in some of the farm's occupations. 

In the last three cycles, this producer has managed to maintain the volume and quality of his crop yields. To maintain the smooth development of his production, he has elaborated a maintenance plan for which he is requesting a loan, particularly for the purchase of inputs required to apply to his coffee trees. 

Jesús is confident that with a proper management, he will achieve better results in the next harvest.

loans.use: to buy the agricultural inputs required for his coffee plantation to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Marie Angeline

texts.fr:
45 ans, mère de trois enfants, Marie Angeline est mariée et son mari est maçon tâcheron. Ses trois gosses vont actuellement à l'école. 
Comme activité source de revenu, elle vend des chaussures à l'occasion et ce depuis 2007. Elle demande un prêt pour  pouvoir augmenter les  marchandises en modèles et en pointures. Un étalage bien garnis attire des clients selon elle. 
Son désir est de développer et améliorer son activité afin de pouvoir offrir à ses enfants une meilleure éducation et une meilleure condition de vie. En outre, elle voudrait aussi préparer et prévoir dès maintenant sa retraite.
texts.en:
Marie Angeline is forty-five years old and married to a stone mason.  Together, they have three children who all currently attend school.

Since 2007, Marie Angeline has been selling second-hand shoes to earn her living.  She will use her loan to increase her stock of different styles and sizes of shoes.  She believes that this will attract more customers to her stall.

Marie Angeline wants to improve her business so she can offer a better standard of education and living conditions to her children.  She would also like to start putting money aside to prepare for her retirement.

loans.use: to buy one bale of second-hand shoes for resale.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is 48 years old and a married woman. Many years ago she started her own business of selling milk with the support of her son. 
She helps her son in all family matters, as well as financial matters. She uses the cow's milk for her family usage purpose but the produced milk from buffaloes her son sells in the market. After selling milk into the market the remaining milk she sells in neighborhood or locality.  In this ways both are generating healthy income to support the family.  She shared the feeling of her achievement; now she can educate her young children by utilizing additional income.  

She is in her fifth loan cycle with the BRAC Pakistan. She has some past savings, and she has applied for a loan to purchase an additional cow for producing more milk to sell. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

She is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow for more milk production and selling purposes.

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Хабибулло хороший муж и прекрасный семьянин. Он женат на Наргис. Хабибулло вместе с женой воспитывают троих детей, двое сыновей и дочку. Хабибулло занимается продажей сухофруктов. Его жена Наргис предоставляет услуги швеи. На данный момент его жена имеет проблемы со здоровьем. Она нуждается в реабилитации. Хабибуло обратился за кредитом, чтобы отправить жену на операцию в Российскую Федерацию. Он накопил денег, но их не хватает. Он надеется, что его тут поддержат, и Хабибулло будет молиться за здоровье своей жены.
texts.en:
Habibullo is a great husband and a wonderful family man.  He is married to Nargis.  Habibullo and his wife are raising three children:  two sons and a daughter.   Habibullo is in business selling dried fruits; Nargis is a seamstress.  Currently his wife has health problems and she needs surgery and rehabilitation.

Habibullo has applied for a loan in order to send his wife to the Russian Federation for the surgery.  He has saved up money, but it's not enough.  Habibullo hopes that people here will support him and he will be praying for his wife's health.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medical treatment

loans.name: Xiomara Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara Antonia de 37  años de edad, vive con su hijo y sus padres  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 06  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende  todo lo relacionado a la canasta básica familiar, vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras.
Doña Xiomara Antonia es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería como arroz, azúcar, harina, huevos, café, pan, aceite, refrescos, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, también le ayudara a tener más productos para atender mejor a sus cliente,  es un cliente subsiguiente con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras,  Junio del  2015.
texts.en:
Xiomara Antonia, 37 years old, lives with her son and her parents in their own house. She has worked for 6 years at her grocery store business; in her business she sells everything related to basic family pantry items. She lives in a village in the south of Honduras.

Xiomara Antonia is an enterprising woman with desire to get ahead and struggle each day to improve her quality of life. She is asking for the loan to purchase products to stock her grocery store such as rice, sugar, flour, eggs, coffee, bread, oil, soft drinks, etc. With the support of this loan, she plans to increase her income and improve her quality of life. It will also help her to have more products to serve her customers better. She is a return client with desire to continue working with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good, well-stocked business and at the same time improve her future along with her family. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras,  June 2015.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, flour, eggs, coffee, bread, oil, soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Alberto de 46  años de edad, no tiene hijos que dependan de él y vive con su esposa en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 05  años a la venta de Leña para cocinar, leña como carbón rojo, pintadillo, madera blanca y otros más, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos, amistades y demás personas que viven en la zona,  vive en una aldea de al  sur de Honduras.
Don Jorge Alberto es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materiales como cementó, arena y mano de obra para poder terminar de repellar su casa,  con este préstamo el pretende mejorar su calidad de vida al realizarle mejoras a su casa, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de  seguir trabajando  con Prisma.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder seguir apoyando en el hogar.


San Lorenzo valle, Honduras – Junio del  2015.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto is 46 years old. He doesn't have any children who depend on him, and he lives with his wife in their own house. He has worked for 5 years selling firewood to cook, such as red coal, pintadillo wood, white wood, and others. His customers are all his neighbors, friends, and other people who live in the zone. He lives in a village in the south of Honduras. 

Jorge Alberto is an enterprising man with desire to improve his quality of life. He is asking for the loan to purchase materials such as cement, sand and pay labor costs to be able to finish re-plastering his house. With this loan he plans to improve his quality of life by making improvements to his house. He is a return client with desire to continue working with Prisma.

His dream is to grow his business and increase his earnings to improve his quality of life and to be able to continue supporting his household. 

San Lorenzo valle, Honduras – June 2015.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and pay labor costs for his house.

loans.name: Marlon Yokir

texts.es:
El joven Marlon de 26  años de edad, no tiene hijos que dependan de él y vive con su esposa en una casa que cuida,  se dedica desde hace 03  años a la venta de Leña para cocinar, leña como carbón rojo, pintadillo, madera blanca, etc. también maneja un puesto de venta de combustible como gasolina y diésel, esta venta es con los camioneros y rastreros que transitan por la zona, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos, amistades y demás personas que viven en la zona.
Marlon vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras, es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de llantas para mejorar su carro de trabajo y también necesita dinero para pagarles a varios ayudantes para el corte de leña,  con este préstamo el pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo  con deseos de  trabajar  con Prisma.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo valle, Honduras  - Junio del  2015.
texts.en:
Marlon is 26 years old. He doesn't have any children who depend on him and he lives with his wife in a house they care for. For the past 3 years, he has worked selling firewood for cooking, firewood such as red coal, pintadillo wood, white wood, etc. and also he runs a stand which sells fuel such as gas and diesel. This stand is with the truck drivers and dredgers who travel through the area. His customers are all his neighbors, friends and other people who live in the zone.

Marlon lives in a village in the south of Honduras. He is a very enterprising man with desire to improve his quality of life. He is asking for the loan to purchase tires to improve his work vehicle and also he needs money to pay the various assistants to cut the wood. With this loan, he plans to increase his income and improve his quality of life. He is a new client with desire to work with Prisma.

His dream is to grow his business and improve his earnings to improve his quality of life. 

San Lorenzo valle, Honduras  - June  2015.

loans.use: to purchase tires and pay labor costs for his business.

loans.name: Ronaly

texts.en:
Ronaly manages a mini grocery with a Xerox machine and a pizza pie stall. She has been running her mini grocery and Xerox machine business for two years, and the pizza pie stall for one year. Ronaly's husband works at a university school. The couple has been blessed with three children.

Ronaly plans to buy more stock of grocery items and a laminator machine; that's the reason why she's requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to keep her business progressive and profitable. She believes that having this amount of loan will enable her to obtain her goals.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and a laminator machine for her mini grocery store

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Jessica works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle taxi business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Jessica is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy wheels and spare parts for her bicycle taxi for her business.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her bicycle taxi.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Norma is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mydee

texts.en:
Mydee is 30 years old and married with four children, three of whom in school, Mydee works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Mydee has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Mydee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edna is 60 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Edna has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her business.

Edna has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Edna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her business

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 58 years old and has eight children. Charito is married, and one child is still in school.

Charito is in the agricultural business of farming corn in the Philippines. Charito requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Charito has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Гулшан 23 летняя девушка из славного района под названием Чоми. Район был назван в честь персидского писателя Абдурахмани Джоми. Гулшан дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. В швейной деятельности она занята 2 года. Гулшан решила отремонтировать дом и обустроить хорошее место для работы. Ремонт начался, но денег не хватило на приобретения стройматериалов. Гулшан обратилась за кредитом в МДО "Хумо" потому что организация больше поддерживает женщин и упрощает для них процесс кредитования. Гулшан надеется, что с помощью кредита она сможет купить стройматериалы и завершить ремонт.
texts.en:
Gulshan is a 23-year-old young woman from the famous A. Jomi region.  The region is named in honor of the Persian writer Abdurakhmani Jomi.  Gulshan works at home sewing women's clothing.  She has been in this business for two years.  

Gulshan has decided to repair her house and to fit out a good place for working.  The work has begun, but she doesn't have enough money for building materials.  Gulshan has applied to MLO Humo and Partners for a loan because this organization better supports women and simplifies the lending process.  Gulshan hopes that with the help of the loan she will be able to buy the building materials and finish the repairs.

loans.use: to buy building materials and repair her home

loans.name: Fernando Rafael

texts.es:
Fernando es soltero y  es muy trabajador, tiene 43 años, vive en casa arrendada y no tiene hijos.
Se dedica a la reparación de equipos electrónicos desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, tiene mucha experiencia en este negocio, tiene su taller en la ciudad de Otavalo, trabaja de lunes a sábado. Viaja todos los días desde su domicilio ubicado en la ciudad de Ibarra hasta su negocio en la ciudad de Otavalo, cuando a Fernando le entregan equipos para ser arreglados, el los revisa y si hay algo que comprar lo hace de regreso a su casa en la ciudad de Ibarra, el hace compras de materiales a diario dependiendo los arreglos que tenga que hacer a los equipos electrónicos.
Vive en la ciudad de Ibarra un lugar reconocido por sus platos típicos tales como las tortillas con fritada, los helados de paila, el arrope de mora entre otros, por esta exquisita gastronomía Ibarra es una ciudad muy visitada por turistas locales y nacionales, a los que la ciudadanía recibe con mucha amabilidad. 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de estanterías metálicas para su negocio, de esta forma tendrá una buena imagen por lo que le visitaran más clientes. Quiere tener más organizado su negocio, ya que hay muchas personas que han dejado sus equipos electrónicos para ser arreglados pero no han regresado a retirarlos y ya no hay más lugar donde ubicarlos con la compra de estanterías metálicas Fernando adecuara su negocio, dando una buena imagen a su negocio, y un mejor servicio. Agradece a KIVA por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Fernando is single, is a very hard worker, is 43 years old, lives in a rented house and doesn't have children.

He has worked repairing electronic equipment for approximately 10 years. He has a lot of experience in this business. He has his shop in the city of Otavalo, and works from Monday to Saturday.He travels every day from his home located in the city of Ibarra to his business located in the city of Otavalo. When people give Fernando their electronics to be repaired, he looks them over and if he has to buy something, he goes back to his home in the city of Ibarra. He makes his purchases of materials daily, depending on the repairs that he has to do to the electronics. 

He lives in the city of Ibarra, a place known for its traditional cuisine such as tortillas with fry-up, large dish ice creams, blackberry jelly and others. For this exquisite cuisine, Ibarra is a city visited by many local and national tourists, who the residents welcome warmly. 

He asks for the loan to purchase metal shelving for his business. In this way, he will have a good look so that more customers will visit him. He wants to have his business more organized, since there are many people who have left their electronics to be repaired but have not come back to get them, and he doesn't have any more space to keep them. With the purchase of metal shelving, Fernando will outfit his business, giving his business a good look, and better service. He is grateful to Kiva for the offered help.

loans.use: to purchase metal shelving and give a better image and service in his shop.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 58 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Carmen runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income from farming rice and selling vegetables.

Carmen has borrowed and repaid four loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) before this loan. She has requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, breads, cooking oil, etc. Carmen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, breads, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 43 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Rowena has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables and from pig fattening.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erlinda is 45 years old, and one child is in school.

Erlinda has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Simon Deonicio

texts.es:
Simón es un pequeño productor de café de 58 años, que vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Posee una finca de 2 mz, las cuales ha dedicado al cultivo del rubro de café, y bajo el certificado del sello de comercio justo.

Este pequeño productor ha venido mejorando su producción de café en los últimos años, y para este año está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cafetal.

Su sueño es incrementar los rendimientos de su café, a fin de mejorar los ingresos para facilitar a su esposa e  hijos mejores condiciones. Él está seguro que este rubro tiene un gran potencial y que le permitirá seguir garantizando los ingresos que necesita para su hogar.
texts.en:
Simón is a small coffee producer who is 58 years old.  He lives in a community in northern Nicaragua.  He owns a field of 2 parcels, which he has dedicated to growing coffee with a fair trade certification.  

This small producer has continued improving his production of coffee in recent years, and for this year he is requesting a loan that will enable him to guarantee the purchase of supplies and fertilizers to maintain his coffee field. 

His dream is to increase his coffee harvest, and as a result, improve his income to provide his wife and children with better conditions.  He is sure that this field has great potential and that it will allow him to continue guaranteeing the income he needs for his home.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizers that he will apply to his coffee fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replenish the stock in her mamalishe business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Emma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF, to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.  Evelyn has been raising livestock for 4 years, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lanie is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lanie has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines. Lanie requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy garments, and other materials needed for her business.

Lanie has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Lanie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy garments, and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, tiene 4 hijos, pero solo viven dos hijos con ella, está acompañada y su pareja es jornalero, sus hijos trabajan en el campo.

María, se dedica a la siembra de maíz con su esposo e hijo y la parcela en donde trabajan está a 15 minutos caminando y no tiene horario fijo.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar insumos agrícolas para la siembra del maíz.

Sus sueños son poder construir una casa de bloque.
texts.en:
María, 42 years old, went to school up to the second grade. She has 4 children but only 2 live with her. She is partnered and her partner is a day laborer. Her children work in the countryside.

María works growing corn with her partner and son and the plot where they work is 15 minutes away by foot and they don't have a set schedule.

The loan will be used to purchase agricultural supplies to plant corn.

Her dream is to be able to build a concrete house.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to plant corn.

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es:
María, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada, su pareja es agricultor, tiene tres hijas, pero solo dos hijos viven en casa todavía.

María, se dedica a repastar ganado y luego lo venderlo, tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, aprendió este negocio con su esposo, el ganado lo tiene en casa en una pequeña parcela, en el negocio solo le ayuda su esposo.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar dos chivos para engordarlos y luego venderlos. 

Sus sueños son, comprar un camión para trasladar el ganado y no tener que pagar transporte.
texts.en:
María, 47 years old, went to school up to the third grade, is partnered, and her partner is a farmer. She has three daughters but only two still live in the house.

María works grazing livestock and later selling them. She has been doing this work for more than 10 years. She learned the business with her partner. She has the livestock on a small plot of land at her house. Only her husband helps her with her business.

The loan will be used to purchase two young goats to fatten them and later sell them.

Her dream is to purchase a truck to carry the livestock and not have to pay for transportation.

loans.use: to purchase two young goats to fatten them and later sell them.

loans.name: Eder Romantizier

texts.es:
Edér, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos pequeños que no van a la escuela.

Eder, se dedica a hacer viajes con un microbus desde hace aproximadamente 4 años, tiene un cafetín en el cual vende antojitos con su esposa por las tardes, el cafetín está a dos cuadras de su casa y trabaja de 4:00 p.m. a 5:00 p.m. y los viajes los realiza de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar productos como golosinas, gaseosas, pan, dulces, entre otros para el cafetin y para arreglar el portón donde guarda el micro bus.

Sus sueños son, comprar un micro bus con linea para trabajar con permiso, porque actualmente trabaja informal.
texts.en:
Edér, 33 years old, went to school through secondary school. He is partnered and his partner takes care of the domestic chores. They have two young children who don't go to school.

Edér has worked making trips in his microbus for approximately the past 4 years. He has a small cafe where he sells snacks with his wife in the afternoons. The cafe is two blocks from his house and he works from 4:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. and he makes the trips from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

The loan will be used to purchase products such as sweets, soft drinks, bread, candies, and m ore for the cafe and to fix the gate where he keeps the microbus.

His dream is to purchase a microbus in a line to be able to work with a permit, since he currently works informally.

loans.use: to purchase products such as sweets, soft drinks, breads, candies, and more for his cafe and to fix the gate where he keeps the microbus.

loans.name: Na Tau 19 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Suoi, 46, is a Thai ethnic woman who works as a farmer and lives in a remote village. She has three sons; one of them has gotten married, and they all live with her and her husband in an old Thai ethnic traditional house. 

Mrs. Suoi and her husband work very hard at agricultural production to provide for the family, with plenty of activities such as cultivating rice, raising buffalo, pigs, chickens, ducks, musk ducks and fish. She has always wanted to expand her animal husbandry. 

This is the third time she has taken a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program after her successful investment in pig raising through using the second loan in the program. This time, she will use the loan to buy baby fish to expand her fish farming. She hopes that with the continuing support of the program, she will gain good income and gradually improve the living conditions for her family. 

Mrs. Suoi dreams that all of her sons will have a more sufficient life and escape from poverty. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish to expand her fish farming

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is single and raises livestock in the Philippines.

Aileen has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF, to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Aileen has been in this business for 2 years.  In the future, Aileen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending and pig fattening.

Liza requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc. Liza dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 20 years old and married with 1 child. She makes and sells furniture to earn a living and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Joan has requested a loan to buy wood,coping saw,smoothing plane,card scraper etc . She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy timbers,coping saw,smoothing plane,card scraper etc

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 58 years old, married, has 7 children and from Tudela, Misamis Occidental.
