She owns and operates a sari-sari store (convenience store) that gives her income sufficient enough to support her family. She sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC upon learning of the programs and services it offers. 

Recently, she avails a loan of 50,000.00 to restock business with canned goods, condiments, confectioneries and others.

loans.use: to restock business with canned goods, condiments, confectioneries and others

loans.name: Nay Yaung Kar Village Group B

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Myint (pictured left) is 51 years old and married with six children. Four of the children have their own family. Since the youngest son is still in school, Myint wants to earn enough money so his son is allowed to stay in school until graduation. Myint works on his five acres of crop farm and plants betel leaves. His wife looks after the house chores and raises their ducks.

Proximity's loan will help the families to purchase farming necessities such as fertilizers and gases for cropping machines.

Pictured above are the members from Nay Yaung Kar Village Group B, named Maung, Khin, Kyaw, Ohm L, Ohm S and Thet. These members are overseen by a CBO (Community Based Leader). The fund will help each member to purchase fertilizers and crop seeds. 

Nay Yaung Kar Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar, which includes 700 households. Most of the families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and crop seeds and farming machinery

borrowers.first_name: Nay Yaung Kar Village Group B

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a smallholder farmer based in Nandi Hills, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He is married and has 4 children. He makes a living doing small-scale livestock and crop farming. After selling his farm’s products, he uses the income to keep his business running and meet his family’s basic needs.  
The challenge that Nicholas is common to rural smallholder farmers - high cost of transporting goods to the market. Most farmers would rather avoid this cost by dealing with brokers but they end up being exploited. Nicholas' thinking is different. He is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas. 
With this asset, Nicholas will be able to transport his produce to formal markets where he will get a fair price for his produce.  
Your loan investing into Nicholas' business will elevate his family’s livelihood and generate more income for them to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Marlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the general store.  Marlinda is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF, to  buy ingredients for food production, for her food vending business.

Marlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Faamaile

texts.en:
Faamaile is a 33 years old woman who is unmarried with 1 child. She runs a business of sewing clothes in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Faamaile has requested a loan to buy new sewing machine, needles, threads, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and develop another profitable business. She joined SPBD in June this year 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machine, needles, threads, materials, etc.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a brave woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1979. She is living in a small quiet town with her family. She is divorced and has one child. She is a business lady, with a beauty salon of cosmetologist service. She is a cosmetologist and eyebrow shaping woman, with ten years of experience in this field. She learned her activity by herself and is well known because of her activity. 

Everything was okay, but then her son became sick and needs to be treated by specialist doctors in Moscow. She hopes her son will be safe after treatment. She appealed to IMON asking financial support from Kiva lenders to treat her son.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to treat her son in a medical clinic of Moscow

loans.name: Alejandro De Jesus

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 61 años y es un productor de café que vive al norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 15 manzanas, de las cuales 2 ha dedicado al cultivo del café, el cual maneja bajo criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo. En los últimos años, él ha venido incrementando su producción, logrando pasar de 20 a 40 quintales de café pergamino.

Su meta es continuar mejorando la productividad de su finca, y para este ciclo está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar el mantenimiento de su plantación de café mediante la compra y aplicación de insumos requeridos para una buena nutrición de las plantas.

Alejandro dice que su esfuerzo y trabajo es para mejorar las condiciones de su esposa e hijos y poderles brindar un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 61 years old and he is coffee producer living in the north of Nicaragua. He has a 15-block farm, of which two blocks [3.48 acres] are for coffee cultivation that he manages following Fair Trade certification criteria. 

In recent years he has been increasing production, being able to go from 20 quintals to 40 quintals of Pergamino coffee. [Pergamino coffee: the processed coffee beans that remain after the coffee berries have been skinned, the pulp removed and the beans dried.]

Alejandro's goal is to keep on improving productivity. He is applying for this loan to purchase and apply the inputs required for good plant nutrition that will allow him to ensure the maintenance of his coffee plantation.

Alejandro comments that his work and efforts are aimed at improving the living conditions for his wife and children, to secure them a better future.

loans.use: to ensure the proper maintenance of his coffee plantation and increase production for the next harvest.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 43 years old and has three children.  Susan is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma Yann Wa Village Group B

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Thein (pictured bottom right), has five acres of crop farm in the Delta region of Myanmar. Similar to many farmers in this area, his savings are low before the harvest season. Proximity's loan will help him purchase the necessary farming resources he needs before the harvest. Thein supports a family of five, and all of his children help him in the farm. Thein hopes to make developments and improvements on his farm this year. The group of eight is overseen by a CBO leader. The fund will help them purchase farming essentials before harvest time.

Ma Yann Wa Village mainly focuses on crop farming, as well as planting other seasonal foods. In addition, they raise livestock such as ducks and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary farming resources before the harvest.

borrowers.first_name: Ma Yann Wa Village Group B

loans.name: Domingos

texts.pt:
O senhor Domingos de 34 anos de idade é trabalhador como pedreiro, casado pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequenta o ensino primário e 1 ainda sem idade escolar, sustenta sua mãe enviando lhe dinheiro e vive na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar cimento, chapas de zinco,  varrões, pedra para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Seu sonho é terminar a obra ampliando com mais dois quartos,  mobilar pois actualmente vive numa casa de apenas um  quarto e sala.
Diz que ira pagar pontualmente e solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar o seu sonho e que gostaria de melhorar muito as suas condições de vida trabalhando com a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Domingos is 34 years old. He works as a mason. He is married with 3 children, 2 of them are in school and the third is still too young to attend. He also supports his mother by sending her money. And he owns his home.
He wants to use this loan to buy cement, zinc sheets, bars, stone to continue working on the construction on his home.
His dream is to finish the works by adding two more rooms, with furniture, as currently, the home only has a bedroom and a living room.
He says he will pay back this loan on time and will request for more loans to fulfill his dream of improving his quality of life working with Hluvuku.

loans.use: To buy cement, zinc sheets, bars and stone

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and buy more ingredients for cakes, such as wheat flour, butter, eggs, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa works hard to support her family. Celsa is married and is a florist the Philippines.

Celsa requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more flowers to sell.  She has been in this business for 25 years.

Celsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more flowers to sell

loans.name: Marijo

texts.en:
Marijo is 43 years old and married with six children, five of whom go to school, Marijo works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF, to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. for her store.  Marijo has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Marijo would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Roselia

texts.en:
Roselia is a married woman with 11 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Roselia is 68 years old now.

Roselia has a buying and selling of coconut wine business in the Philippines. Roselia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Roselia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Roselia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Amy has been in this business for 23 years. Amy earns additional income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for opening a juice business.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de Caaguazú, se formó con mujeres unidas que quieren salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su sacrificio. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, trabajando cada una por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosalina, quien es una persona muy emprendedora que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y ser útil, no solo a sí misma, sino también a las demás personas. Ella se dedica a vender remedios naturales, y por medio de su humilde trabajo tiene los medios para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales, para poder vender y seguir con su negocio como lo viene haciendo, teniendo de esa forma mejores productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, y así seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group was established in the city of Caaguazú and consists of women who have joined together so that they can move forward and help their loved ones through the sacrifices they have made. They are also participating in the poverty elimination program, which allows them to work toward improving their living conditions.

One of the member is Sra. Rosalina, who is an enterprising individual who strives to get ahead and become useful, just like the other people in her group. She is in the business of selling natural remedies. Through her modest form of work, she is able to provide everything for her family that she was not able to have.

Rosalina is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of natural remedies that she can sell so that she can continue her business as before. She will also have better products to offer to her customers, which will help her continue improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is 43 years old, married and has four children attending to school. In order to survive, for their daily needs, Mario’s wife sells grocery items in their village. While Mario does a farming business. Mario grows rice and corn. His profit serves to support his wife's business, and they are able to have continual source of income, and provide for their children needs in school. Mario wishes for a loan of P25,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds for their farm. He is hoping to harvest plenty from his rice and corn to support his family needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for their farm.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Monalisa is 41 years old and has four children who are in school.

Monalisa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Monalisa requested a PHP 23000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Monalisa has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Monalisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 32 years old with two children.

Suzette works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Suzette has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Suzette aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is married with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF, to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell at the store.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Loningning

texts.en:
Loningning is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, paints, etc., for her fishing business.

Loningning has been in this business for 12 years. Loningning earns additional income from a beauty parlor.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, paints, etc

loans.name: Nyabwari

texts.en:
Nyabwari is 25 years old and supports 5 adult members.  He has been offering motorcycle transport services in the market for the last 5 years, and the business earns him KES 3,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase spare parts such as engines, mirrors and chain so as to meet client needs in order to offer better and faster transport services.  

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and purchase fertilizers and cereals for planting in his farm, so as to enable him practice agriculture.

His hope is to expand his business through purchase of more motorcycles to offer transport services.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as engines, mirrors and chain so as to meet client needs in order to offer better and faster transport services

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
Mylen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mylen is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mylen has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Mylen requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy garments, and other supplies to use in her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mylen has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Mylen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy garments, and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Cresencia requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.  Cresencia has been in this business for 20 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Sopheak is 28-year-old and she has two dependent children who are in school.  She does rice farming and works on her co-villager’s farm for a fee, to support her family.  She has been doing this for five years. Her crops have not grown well and it is the problem for her business. As a result of not having enough funds to do farming, she is now leading a group of two, to apply for Kiva loan via VisionFund. This is second loan cycle for Sopheak with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has helped her to improve her living standard. She is now applying for new loan of 1,600,000KHR and another member is seeking 1,400,000KHR. As the group’s leader, she is going to manage her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticide and pay for plowing fees to help the crops to grow well and produce more yields. She hopes that this loan will help her current business to provide her more income so she can update her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticide and pay plowing fees, to help the crops to grow well and produce better yields.

loans.name: Ritchie

texts.en:
Ritchie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ritchie is 35 years old and her three children are in school.

Ritchie has a business buying and selling ornamental plants in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase fertilizers, flower pots and other materials for her business.

Ritchie has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, flower pots and other materials for her business

loans.name: Las Girasoles Tecpanecas Group

texts.en:
Approximately 90 kilometers from Guatemala City in the central plateau, rests the city of Tecpan. There, in one of the rural communities of the area, include a group of women with who strive to reach individually set goals by using the most of their environments and by creating small businesses in their local markets. 

The group of women identifies themselves as the trust bank “Las Girasoles Tecpanecas” or the Tecpan Sunflowers. The group comprises of women who are enthusiastic, collaborative and have ample expectations for their families and businesses. Each member has a different and unique business such as: food sale, agriculture, weaving and selling clothing, and sale of cosmetics. 

As is the case of Dolores, a working woman, in her 68 years she has been a fundamental pillar in her household by sharing the costs of expenses and supporting the education and sustainability of her family. Since she herself did not get the opportunity to go to school, Dolores is constantly motivating and supporting her children to continue and complete their formal education. Dolores brings income to the household by owning and running a small food business, with the loan she hopes to receive, Dolores hopes to reinvest into her business by purchasing new spices, rice, cooking materials, and other items for her business.  

For these women it is their very first time asking for a loan from Kiva, they feel privileged that they are receiving the support of investors from all around the world. Thank you Kiva investors for constantly showing support towards the development of Guatemalan women!

loans.use: To purchase new spices, rice, cooking materials and other items for her food business

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Tecpan Group

texts.en:
7 tenacious women unite in hopes of making their surrounding world a better place through the development of their micro-business. They call themselves “Mujeres Unidas Tecpan” and are able to create such a change with the help from the loans they receive from Friendship Bridge

To oversee the leadership and management of the group, Rosa, a prior member, has been elected as the president of “Mujeres Unidas Tecpan”. Rosa is a 35 year old married mother of 5 who, dedicates her time and effort to buy and sell lingerie in her local market. Rosa is asking for a loan so that she may acquire a larger quantity of product to further satisfy her clients, while simultaneously gaining new ones.  

With the utmost amount of gratitude towards the investors from around the world, Rosa is eager to further amplify her business and payback the loan with much haste. Rosa, along with the other small business owners, is working towards eliminating poverty by building up the local economy little by little. Thank you for the support and confidence in Rosa and all clients of Friendship Bridge that are a living answer to the long term problem of alleviating poverty.

loans.use: To acquire a larger quantity of lingerie product to further satisfy her clients

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret is aged 54 years and she supports 2 children.  She has been a farmer in the market for the last 8 years and the business earns her KES 7,500 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm so as to get a better harvest for family use and sale to clients the surplus harvest. 

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to enable her sell milk to clients. 

Her hope is to expand her agricultural sector and purchase textile materials, ready made clothes and vegetables for sale in the market.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm so as to get a better harvest for family use and sale to clients the surplus harvest.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 40 years old, married with three children. All her children attend school.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a smallholder farmer from a rural home in Rift Valley, Kenya. Dairy farming to Elias is not only a source of income but also a livelihood. He has been doing this business for many years and he is still committed to the growth of his farm.

Elias is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a dairy cow. He plans to spend 5% of the loan amount on the cow’s insurance to protect his family from sliding into poverty in case of the cow's death. 
The impact of this loan on Elias and his family include financial inclusion, business growth, wider asset base, and increase in income.  His ultimate goal is to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and a better living for his family

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is 59 years old and has five children. She is widowed and has one child who is still in school.

Albina is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Albina has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción, de 69 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, no pudo estudiar por la situación económica y tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar, creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron estas actividades; su familia está conformada por su esposa quien le apoya con los oficios domésticos y con el cuido del ganado.

Concepción,  se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para ir a trabajar, durante la mañana en las parcelas que posee, mientras sus hijos le apoyan en la siembra de maíz y frijol y en la tarde ordeña las vacas.

Concepción, necesita el crédito para comprar una novilla para incrementar su producción de leche, que le generara ingresos adicionales. 

Concepción, desea comprar una yunta de bueyes para que le ayuden a poder arar y obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Concepción, 69 years old, makes a living in agriculture and raising livestock.  He wasn’t able to attend school because of his economic situation and had to work.  He grew up with his parents who taught him these activities.  His family is made up of his wife, who helps him with the housework and with caring for the livestock.

Concepción gets up at 5:00 a.m. to go to work in the morning in the plots of land that he owns, while his children help him plant corn and beans.  In the afternoon he milks the cows.

Concepción needs the loan to buy a heifer to increase his milk production which will generate additional income for him.  Concepción would like to buy a team of oxen so that they can help him to plow and obtain a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to increase his milk production.

loans.name: Jean Marcel

texts.fr:
Jean Marcel est un père de famille travailleur de 36 ans.Il est marié et son épouse est femme de ménage dans une société privée.Ils ont ensemble trois enfants âgés entre 9 à 14 ans. Ces derniers vont tous à l'école en ce moment.
Il est maçon tâcheron depuis, c'est son occupation principale, mais pour améliorer le revenu de la famille il décidait en Novembre 2014 d'exploiter une activité d'élevage de poules pondeuses. Et pour développer ce 2ème activité, il a recours à un prêt.
C'est pour le bien-être de ces enfants qui le pousse à travailler dur et à lutter. Son désir est de leurs offrir une meilleure qualité de vie et les faire réussir dans leurs études et dans la vie.
texts.en:
Jean Marcel is the hard-working father of a family, aged 36. He is married and his wife is a cleaning lady in a private company. Together they have three children aged between 9 and 14. The children all attend school at present.

Jean Marcel is a mason working as an odd-job laborer; this is his main job, but to improve the family's income, he decided in November 2014 to start a business raising laying hens. In order to develop this second income source, he has asked for a loan.

It is the well-being of his children that drives him to work hard and to struggle. His desire is to offer them a better quality of life and to make them successful in their studies and in their lives.

loans.use: to buy 100 chicks to raise as laying hens

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is aged 47 years, married to Josephine and he supports 2 children. 

He has been offering medical care in the market for the last 10 years and the business earns him 5,000 KES per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more drugs so as to enable him to offer better services to clients and meet their clients. 

Kennedy plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan, educate his children, expand his business of a kinyozi (barbershop), and purchase cereals and start a grocery business.  His hope is to expand his business sector.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs so as to enable him to offer better services to clients and meet their clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply more for income gain

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old, single man from Deir Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, a few years ago, Mohammad decided to started his own business. He manages a store selling books and stationery. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Mohammad came to FATEN in order to finance his bookstore.  Mohammad is working with his loan officer to improve his business. Because funding is difficult to find and banks are not so helpful in Gaza, he took a USD loan from FATEN to buy some stationary for his book store. 

The loan will increase his sales and also his income. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some stationary for his book store.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Pich is a young woman, aged 26, living in a rural area of Kandal province. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming and she works at garment factory to earn additional income. She has been involved in these businesses for six years. Her business earns her about 36,000 KHR per day and she is able to save around 17,000 KHR each day after offsetting her family’s expenses. 

Unfortunately, her farming business has been ruined by insects and it is the main challenge for her business. Pich has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle already and she has fully repaid her past loan. The previous loan enabled her to improve her living standards. 

Pich will take this new loan to buy a motorbike to drive her from home to work in order to save the cost and time of transportation. She hopes that this loan will help her to work regularly and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Merciditha

texts.en:
Merciditha is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Merciditha is 74 years old and has eight children who are in school.

Merciditha has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merciditha requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Merciditha has been in this business for five years. In the future, Merciditha would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marchel

texts.en:
Marchel is 34 years old, married and has two children, who are in school.  She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Marchel requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marchel has been pig fattening for 16 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is 38, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a milkman by trade; he sells milk in the market. His customers like to buy fresh, delicious milk from his shop. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market and the customers as well.

Due to quality and low reasonable rates many of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase the stock of milk on a daily basis and wants to buy milk in large quantity. But he does not have enough cash in hand to buy milk in large quantity.

Therefore, Allah Rakhihas requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy more milk in bulk to sell.

She is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy milk in bulk for her husband's milk selling business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling animal feeds in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from poultry and a general store.  Gemma is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of animal feeds to sell on her stall.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of animal feeds to sell on her stall.

loans.name: Sonat

texts.en:
Sonat is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 27 years old. She lives in a small wooden house  with her parents and her 4 brothers and sisters. Her family owns 2 hectares of rice fields, 2 hectares of cassava fields and 1 pig. 

In May/2014 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong,  a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. 

Sonat makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for fertilizer and diesel for the field.  

Thanks to the loan,  she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Joyce lives with her handsome husband in Kapsowar, a small rural town in Kenya. The Kapsowar area is also referred to as the mango region of Kenya because half the mangoes consumed are from that region.

She has been farming for the past five years and has never looked back. To earn a decent and honest living, she sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. Joyce is satisfied with the returns she gets through farming. However, she wants to diversify and start horticultural farming. The main challenge she faces is accessing funds.

She is kindly requesting a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. To access funds, Joyce joined Juhudi Kilimo, an institution that supports smallholder farmers with both financial and technical solutions. When asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo, she answered, “They assist small-scale farmers.”

Through horticulture, she will be able to improve her living standards and secure the future of her family. In the long run, the ultimate goal for Joyce is to permanently improve her family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to start horticultural farming

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 59 years old, married and has three children.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sokunthea's Group

texts.en:
Living in a remote area of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Sokunthea is 40 years old and he is the father of three dependent children who are all in school.

For his living, Sokunthea raises pigs for sale as the main source of his family’s income. He does rice farming to earn additional income to complement his family’s needs. He has been with both businesses for twenty-two years. His pigs are not growing well, which causes him to get a low price.

Sokunthea has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before and this is his first time to request a loan. As a group leader of five members, he will manage his entire loan portion to buy a decent latrine to improve his family’s living and avoid infectious diseases. He hopes that all his family’s members will have good health and that they are able to perform their jobs better than before to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine to improve his family’s living and avoid infectious diseases

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena de 52 años de edad, es madre soltera y  vive con sus hijos  en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 15 años al negocio de venta de rosquillas y quesadillas,  sus clientes son personas de la zona y también tiene muchos clientes en las comunidades vecinas, vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras.
Doña María Elena es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como: maíz, leña, cuajada y manteca, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito pretende comprar los productos por mayor y conseguir mejores precios, al mismo tiempo  espera mejoren sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de seguir trabajando  con Prisma.
Su sueño es crecer su negocio tener más clientes y poder mejorar su calidad de vida junto a sus hijos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del  2015.
texts.en:
María Elena is 52 years old, is a single mother, and lives with her children in her own home.  She has worked for 15 years selling donuts and quesadillas.  Her customers are people from the area and she also has many customers in the neighboring towns.  She lives in a town in the south of Honduras.

María Elena is a enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead and fight each day to improve her quality of life.  She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as: corn, firewood, cheese curd, lard, and others.  With the support of this loan she intends to buy the ingredients wholesale to get better prices.

She hopes to increase her income and also improve her quality of life.  She is a successive borrower who wants to continue working with Prisma.  Her dream is to expand her business, have more customers, and to be able to improve her and her children's quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2015

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, cheese curd, lard and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Avik

texts.en:
Avik is 21 years old and he lives with his mother in Gavar city of the Gegharkunik region. His father and brother are in the Russian Federation doing their work abroad. Avik now works at the military unit in Gavar city and at the same time he is engaged in farming and agriculture with his lovely mother.

On his farm Avik has cows and calves. From his farm he sells a lot of milk, macun (a national dairy product), cheese, curd and also meat. His mother already managed to find a lot of regular customers for their farm products, who buy all of it right from their house. Avik also cultivates potatoes on his plot of land and he sells it to resellers.

Now he asks for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a calf and also a lot of fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a calf and also a lot of fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in an assortment of air fresheners and disinfectants.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 26 years old, married and has one daughter who is at school. Four years now, she has been supporting her family by running two businesses,beauty salon and motorcycle for transportation. She is doing great, wishing to start another business of cereals. Teddy starts working from 08am to 08pm per working day and able to make a good profit each month. 

This is her fifteenth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, paid back in full, to buy the motorcycle which she is using for transportation and bought salon working equipment. Teddy managed to receive some extra income which she used to plow back to her businesses,covered school fees and home cost. 

She is truly appreciate Kiva's support to her family and business life. In the coming years, she would like to build a house for her family. With this credit, Teddy will start selling cereals,found to be good in making profit. She will buy bags of cereals to resell. 

She will hold accountable as per schedule to repay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy bags of cereals to resell.

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es: La señorita Ruth, se dedica a la costura hace 4 años, es madre soltera cuenta con una hija bajo su dependencia a la cual está sacando adelante con esfuerzo y trabajo, que desempeña actualmente en la costura, trabaja de manera que le proporcionan todo los materiales y las telas cortadas ella solo se encarga de costurar hasta el acabado final, costurando Chompas, chalecos y chulos, últimamente está elaborando busos deportivos, La señorita Tiene la mentalidad de superación por tal motivo fue a capacitarse en el ámbito de la costura para perfeccionar sus habilidades en el "Centro de educación Alternativa Oblatos". Con estas habilidades que perfecciono piensa independizarse y emprender su propio taller de costura, por tal motivo necesita el préstamo para la compra de telas y máquinas de costura. Con esta ayuda podrá mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Srta. Ruth has been a seamstress for four years. She is a single mother with a daughter who is dependent on her, so she strives to move forward through her effort and work. Ruth currently does sewing work, which involves gathering all of her materials and cutting the fabrics. She alone does all of the sewing up through the final steps. Ruth produces sweaters, vests, and winter caps. Lately she has been producing track suits.

Srta. Ruth has the drive to succeed. For this reason, she obtained training in the sewing trade at the Center of Education for Alternative Trades so that she could perfect her skills. This allowed her to become independent and be able to establish her own sewing workshop. Ruth needs a loan in order to buy fabrics and sewing machines. With this assistance she will be able to improve her income, as well as her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing machines.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anabelle is 49 years old and her child is in school.

Anabelle has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested an 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net and other equipment.

Anabelle has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment

loans.name: Tsovik

texts.en:
Tsovik is 50 years old and she lives with her family in Kapan city of Syunik region. Tsovik has a specialty as a tailor and for many years she worked in that field. Now she works as a saleswoman in the food market and at the same time she has nice and cute vegetable and fruit garden. Here she cultivates potatoes, beans, cucumber, tomatoes and peppers. 

She also has very nice and sweet harvest of apple, cherry and apricot trees. Part of this harvest she sells and the other part she uses for her family. Tsovik has a daughter (she is already married) and her son works as a policeman in the city’s police station. Her husband is also employed but he manages to help his wife with the work on their land. 

Tsovik is asking for this loan as she decided to build a pantry in her garden where she will keep her land’s harvest in a good way and separately.

loans.use: to build a pantry in her garden to keep her harvest.

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine is greatly thankful for her previous two Kiva loans and she mentions that both of them were very positive and helpful for her family (she paid her daughter's tuition fees). 

Now she hopes that already having the experience of a Kiva partnership, she will manage to have one more deal. This nice and charming woman lives in the city of Sevan in Gharkunik region with her husband, daughter and son. Hermine graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute Historical faculty and has been working in a school as a teacher for 18 years already, teaching Armenian History. 

She likes her work and the subject that she teaches and she considers it one of the most important in the school program. Now Hermine is asking for this loan as she wants to buy a computer and professional literature which she greatly needs so she can be aware of innovations in the field of pedagogical methodology.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional pedagogical literature.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons for her tailoring services.

loans.name: Rocio Esmeralda

texts.es: Roció de 25 años de edad vive en casa familiar con su esposo y su hijo de 6 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, calzado y joyería de primera calidad desde hace varios años, lo hace de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados y comunidades que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Roció está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de fardos de ropa, joyería y calzado como: blusas, camisas, ropa para niños, shorts, zapatos deportivos, anillos collares, etc. para poder seguir con su negocio y ofrecer nuevos estilos de productos a sus clientes para de esta forma generar buenas ganancias y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roció is 25 years old and lives in the family home with her husband and 6-year-old child who is currently in school.  She has worked for a few years selling good quality second-hand clothing, footwear, and jewelry.  She does this by traveling in the different markets and towns near her home.  With the income she obtains and with her husbands help, they are able to cover some of the household expenses.  

Roció is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy bundles of clothing, jewelry and footwear such as: blouses, shirts, children's clothing, shorts, athletic footwear, rings, necklaces, etc. in order to continue with her business and offer new styles of product to her customers.  In this way she she can make a good income and be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell in her business.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia is 26 years old and partner for1 year with no child. She runs a small business selling banana chips in her community and has been doing this for 1 year. 

Sesilia has requested a loan to buy cooking oil, plastic bags, bananas, bag of salt, etc. She joined SPBD in June this year 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sesilia will spend it to extend her business to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, plastic bags, bananas, bags of salt, etc.

loans.name: Nally

texts.en:
Nally is 56 years old, married with five children.

Nally works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Nally has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from frozen foods and pig fattening businesses.

Nally aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: José Hilario

texts.es:
José, de 26 años de edad, vive con sus padres desde pequeño, no estudio porque no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a un centro escolar cercano, tiene otros tres hermanos quienes también viven junto a sus padres en la comunidad.

José, trabaja de ayudante de albañil en la zona y en otros tipos de trabajos; anteriormente trabajo en el proyecto de construcción de una calle durante más de un año, de cada pago que recibía cada quince días, iba comprando materiales para la construcción de su propia vivienda y fue así como ahora tiene su propia vivienda.

José, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió gracias a su papá, además puede hacer pan de diferentes variedades y ha trabajado en la crianza de especies menores también.

Él, solicita el crédito para comprar tres cerdos, comprar concentrado para alimentarlos y para pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde también siembra granos básicos junto a su padre.- Anteriormente, adquirió un crédito con el cual compro cerdos y ya los vendió y las ganancias las invirtió en el mejoramiento de su vivienda.

José, sueña con mejorar su casa y tener más comodidades; pero también preetende ir de a poco mejorando la galera donde engordara a los cerdos.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old. He has lived with his parents since he was little. He didn't study as he had no opportunity to go to a nearby school. He has three siblings who also live with his parents in their community.

José works as an assistant bricklayer in the area and at other kinds of work. Previously he worked on a street construction project for more than a year and was paid every 15 days. He bought materials to build his own house and that is how he now has his own house.

José learned everything he knows from his dad. He can also make different kinds of bread and he has worked raising small animals too.

He is requesting the loan to buy three pigs, concentrated feed for them and pay the rent on the land where he grows basic grains together with his father. He previously accessed a loan with which he bought pigs which he has sold and the profits were invested in improving his house.

José dreams of improving his house and having more amenities. He also wants to little by little improve the shed where he fattens his pigs.

loans.use: to buy three pigs, concentrated feed for them and pay the rent on the land where he grows basic grains with his father.

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo lives and runs his trading business in Kapan city of Syunik region. Here he rents a shop where he organizes the sale of great range of products such as vegetables, fruits, juices, sweets, bakery, dairy products, meat, canned food, coffee and etc. All these items, Kamo buys from Kapan city distributors in order to keep his stall always full and fresh. He has his regular customers thanks to his polite service and great assortment of products in his shop. 

Kamo is married and his wife being unemployed greatly helps him in his business. They have two children; their daughter is married and lives with her family and their son is at the army now. 

Kamo asks this loan as he wants to refresh the assortment of his shop and he will buy new assortment of sweets, bakery items, dairy products and also more assortments of fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of sweets, bakery items, dairy products and also more assortments of fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Ma Yan Wa Village Group E

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Hnin (pictured center), is 54 years old and married with four children. The parents are proud that all of their children are working on their own in the city. Hnin works at his five acre farm, and he hopes to have a more successful cropping rate this year. 

Proximity's loan will help him purchase fertilizers and other farming supplies. He is purchasing and storing the fertilizer in advance because he thinks the price will increase in the future. To boost his income, he hopes to open a grocery store underneath his house.

Pictured above are the members from Ma Yann Wa Village Group E, named Ye, Taw, Ngwe, Sein, Aye and San. A CBO leader oversees all the members.  The fund will help each member purchase fertilizers and crop seeds. 

Ma Yann Wa Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar. Most families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farming supplies.

borrowers.first_name: Ma Yan Wa Village Group E

loans.name: Beatriz Del Carmen

texts.es: Beatriz de 43 años de edad, vive en casa de  su propiedad junto a su familia conformada por sus hijos de 21, 17 y 11 años de edad quienes gracias al apoyo que reciben de su madre estudian actualmente. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías elaborando pinturas en madera y telas desde hace catorce años por lo que posee una gran clientela y una gran demanda por sus productos ya que no son muy comunes en la zona donde ella reside, es una persona humilde, trabajadora, responsable, luchadora y con ganas de sacar a su familia adelante y por medio de su labor ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares. Beatriz solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: madera, telas, pinturas, aceites, etc., para poder seguir elaborando sus productos y continuar abasteciendo su demanda ya que posee clientela establecida y así poder mejorar sus ingresos para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 43 years old, lives in her own house together with her family, which is composed of her children who are 21, 17 and 11 years old. Thanks to her support they are currently studying. She makes a living by producing crafts, making paintings on wood and fabric. She has been doing this activity for fourteen years now, so she has many customers and her products are in great demand, as they are not common in the area where she resides.

She is a humble, hard-working, responsible and striving person who wants to get her family ahead. Thanks to her efforts she has managed to pay for many of her family's expenses. Beatriz requests a loan to buy supplies, such as: wood, fabric, paints, old, etc. to be able to continue making her products and meeting the demand, as she has established customers, being able to increase her income so as to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy: wood, fabric, paints, oils, etc. to continue producing her products

loans.name: Blanca Exa

texts.es:
Blanca, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y solo tiene dos hijos.

Blanca, se dedica al comercio de ropa, este negocio lo aprendió cuando se casó, como fuente de ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia; tiene ocho años de dedicarse a vender ropa, sale tres días a la semana a vender y lo hace caminando a pie tres kilómetros cada vez que sale.

Blanca, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para revender, específicamente comprará diez docenas de sandalias y trescientas prendas de ropa para mujer, porque es la que más se vende, con ello estará satisfaciendo la necesidad de comprar más mercadería por mayor y viajar menos hasta la capital para comprar. 

Los sueños de Blanca son, sacar adelante su hijo para que estudie y seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Blanca, who is 33 years old, went to school through seventh grade. She is married. Her husband works in agriculture, and she has only two children.

Blanca sells clothing. She learned this business when she married, as a source of income to be able to raise her family. She has sold clothing for eight years. She goes out three days a week to sell and she does it by walking three kilometers every time she goes out.

Blanca needs the loan to buy clothing to resell. Specifically, she will buy 10 dozen sandals and 300 articles of clothing for women, because that is what she sells most. With that, she will be satisfying the need to buy more merchandise wholesale and travel less [often] to the capital to buy.

Blanca's dreams are to raise her children so that they can go to school and to continue improving her house.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell; specifically, she will buy 10 dozen sandals and 300 articles of clothing for women

loans.name: Dimas Antonio

texts.es: Dimas de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica a la cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene 28 años de experiencia en el rubro, conoce muy bien esa actividad ya que sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la tierra, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Dimas esta solicitando un crédito para la compra semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Dimas, who is 33 years old, lives in his own house with his life companion and their son. He raises corn and beans. He has 28 years of experience in this work. He knows this business very well, since his parents taught him to work the land. He sells his products in the surrounding areas of the zone where he lives.

Dimas is applying for a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, compost, etc., and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph in order to continue with his work, which generates good earnings for him.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, etc., and to improve the land

loans.name: Las Piedritas Group

texts.es: PROFETA de 58 años de edad es casada y tiene 04 hijos uno de ellos aun dependiente. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “las piedritas”  la cual lo conforman 06 socios con deseos de  trabajar honradamente y progresar. Ella hace más de 30 años que se dedica al negocio de venta de pollo lo cual lo realiza en un mercado. Gracias a su constante dedicación logro sacar adelante a  su familia. Su mayor deseo es que todos sus hijos sean profesionales. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de pollos. La Alcancía “las piedritas” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Profeta es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca color celeste y polo color negro.
texts.en:
Profeta is 58 years old, married and has 4 children, one of who is still dependent on her.  She belongs to the community bank "las piedritas" (little rocks) which is made of 6 members who desire to work honorably and make progress.  For more than 30 years, she has dedicated herself to her chicken sales business, which she does in the market.   Thanks to her constant dedications he has been able to bring her family forward.  Her greatest wish is that all her children will be professionals.  She asks for the loan to buy chickens.  The community bank "Las Piedritas" thanks Kiva investors for the help they provided.  

Profeta is the third from the left and is wearing a blue jacket and a negro polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Nurys Raquel

texts.es: Nurys de 47 años en compañía de su esposo, ofrecen comidas típicas de la Región Caribe Colombiana en los diferentes barrios del sur de Barranquilla.  Esta pareja de emprendedores a raíz del desempleo que estaban afrontando, palparon la oportunidad de sacar provecho de la buena sazón y exquisiteces de platos que Nurys preparaba, así mismo su cónyuge contaba con una gran experiencia en rutas de la ciudad.  Con gran acogida todos los días su cónyuge sale a las calles de la ciudad a comercializar en su triciclo metálico los diferentes platillos; arroz con pollo, arroz con liza, granos, pastas, carnes y jugos.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en víveres como aceite, arroz, carnes, verduras, frutas y demás.  Con esta inversión podrá ampliar su cobertura y satisfacer a la demanda.  A futuro Nurys desea remodelar su vivienda para abrir un restaurante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nurys is 47 years old. Along with her husband she offers traditional food from the Caribbean region of Colombia in the various neighborhoods of the south of Barranquilla.

Because of the unemployment they were facing, this pair of entrepreneurs felt an opportunity to take advantage of the good seasoning and exquisite dishes that Nurys prepared and her husband's great knowledge of the streets of the city. They are well received every day as the couple hits the streets of the city on their metal tricycle to sell their different dishes; chicken with rice, arroz con liza (a rice dish with fish). grains, pastas, meats and juice.

Nurys is currently applying for a loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in food like oil, rice, meat, vegetables, fruit and others. With this investment she can expand her market and satisfy demand.

In the future Nurys wants to remodel her house to open a restaurant and improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to invest in food like oil, rice, meat, vegetables, fruit and others.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 50 years old and she lives with her family in the frontier village Sarigyugh of Tavush region. Marine has vocational education and a specialty of accountancy of which she managed to work several years. Now she works at the kindergarden as a cook and at the same time she is running farming and agriculture. Marine is married and she has three sons and a daughter. Their single daughter is a student, smallest son is school-aged and other two sons are temporally live in Russian Federation doing there different constructional works. 

Marine with her husband work all day long and very hard about their farm in order to cover the needs of her big family. In her farm she has a cow, a calf, sheep and chickens. She also has large plot of land on which she cultivates beans, garlic, potatos, peppers and also trees of fig, apple and persimmon. Marine sells these vegetables and fruits with her farm products such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat and eggs. She sells all her farm products at the city’s wholesale market. 

Marine would like to develop pig breeding in her farm and that is why she decided to start partnership with Kiva; with this loan of 300.000 Armenian drams she will buy piglets for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy piglets for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 33 years old, married to Samwel and supports a family of 2 children.  She has been practicing farming for the last 6 years earning KES 13,000 per month.
 
Hellen has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Mansueta has been in this business for 5 years. Mansueta earns more income from raising livestock.

Mansueta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn is 37 years old and married with five children, three of whom in school, Lorelyn works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, spices, can goods, etc.

Lorelyn has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Lorelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, spices, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merly is 35 years old and all three children are sent in school. Merly has a food vending business in the Philippines. Merly requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Merly has been in this business for five years. In the future, Merly would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
José, de 65 años de edad, es agricultor, proviene de familia muy humilde y que debido a eso le fue imposible estudiar un grado académico superior al de quinto grado, es viudo, su esposa falleció hace varios años, tiene cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos están casados, viven cerca de donde José y el ultimo está soltero.

José, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años, el hijo menor es quien le ayuda en este trabajo, ambos se levantan muy temprano para ir a trabajar al campo, el terreno donde tiene la cosecha está a una distancia de medio kilómetro aproximadamente y siembra maíz.

José, utilizará el préstamo para comprar tres sacos de abono, pesticidas y para pagar mano de obra, ya que la milpa está sembrada pero le falta fertilizante para que crezca y sea abundante. 

El sueño de José, es que su cosecha sea prospera para cancelar a tiempo su deuda y de la ganancia mejorar el nivel de vida para él y su hijo.
texts.en:
José, who is 65 years old, is a farmer. He comes from a very humble family, and because of this, it was impossible for him to go to school beyond fifth grade. He is a widower. His wife died several years ago. He has five children. Four of them are married. They live near José, and his youngest son is single.

José has worked in farming for many years. His youngest son is the one who helps him in this work. Both get up very early to go to work in the field. The land where he has his crops is at a distance of approximately half a kilometer. He raises corn.

José will use the loan to buy three sacks of compost and pesticides and to pay for labor, since the corn field is planted, but he lacks the fertilizer to make it grow and be abundant.

José's dream is that his crop will be bountiful to pay off his debt on time and from the earnings improve the standard of living of himself and his son.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of compost and pesticides and to pay for labor

loans.name: Ma Yan Wa Village Group D

texts.en:
The Featured Borrower, Maung (pictured center), has five acres of crop farm in the Delta region of Myanmar. He is 57 years old and married with two children; one of them is at university while the other is working. Maung's savings are running very low before the harvest season, and therefore he needs this loan to help him purchase the necessary farming resources. He aims to expand his farm by a few more acres before the end of 2015.

Pictured above are the members from Ma Yann Wa Village Group D, named Aung, Tun, Tin, Myo.  The group is overseen by a CBO leader and the fund will help each member purchase fertilizer and crop seeds.

Ma Yann Wa Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar. Most families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary farming resources.

borrowers.first_name: Ma Yan Wa Village Group D

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Mrs. Ha is a hardworking woman, 33 years old and is married with a baby. Her family’s income is mainly from small business, husbandry and cultivation. 

She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Kitara Group

texts.en:
Lydia is a member of the group who lives with her husband, son and daughter in the city outskirts. Her family’s main occupation is farming and their income is just enough to cover the family's living expenses, including the children’s education fees.

Lydia is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for the corn since she does not have enough money. She hopes the loan will help her family have money to invest in the cornfield and that, in the next crop harvest, the cornfield will bring her family big corncobs with solid seeds and double the yield of the previous crop. 
The sixth person at the back(right) is the UGAFODE Credit staff.

loans.use: To buy farm in puts so that he can boost her yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for her husband's manufacturing iron accessories business.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province, Sarom is 38 years old and she has four dependent children who are all in school. She grows cassava and rice as the main sources of her family’s income to support her family’s living. The crops have grown not well so she is able to sell it in a very low price. 

Sarom has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loan cycles already and she has fully repaid back her past loans and those loans helped her to have a better living condition. Due to lack of funds, Sarom is now leading a group of seven members to take new loan. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy a decent latrine for his family’s uses. She hopes that this loan will help her family’s members have good health to update her living standard.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for his family’s uses.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.es:
Joselito tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el centro poblado Huacapampa, que pertenece al distrito de Cañaris que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Joselito se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Joselito espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Joselito is 31 years old and lives with his spouse and children in his home made of rustic materials.  It is located in thepopulated center of Huacapampa, which belongs to the Cañaris district, located in the Ferreñafe province, in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.  Life in this district is tranquil and the inhabitants make a living through to agriculture, commerce and raising animals.  

Joselito makes a living through agriculture, specifically through coffee cultivation.  He has 10 years of experience and many good personal and professional references in the area.  The loan he is awarded will be used to buy compost and fertilizer to do the necessary maintenance of his coffee crops.  He will also purchase labor during the harvest season.  Joselito hopes to offer a high quality coffee which will have a positive impact on his income level and improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer to do adequate maintenance for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Kakchiquel San Marcos Group

texts.en:
San Marcos La Laguna is a small town located on the shores of Lake Atitlan, Guatemala. This specific town is one that generates much tourism both nationally and internationally bringing in many potential clients to tourist based businesses. Here, you can find the trust bank “Kakchiquel San Marcos” which is initiating its second cycle of loans with KIVA.  

From the previous loans, the members of Kakchiquel San Marcos took advantage of their opportunity and profited greatly from their investments. One of the members of the group is Francisca, a woman who generates income by owning and running a business of growing chickens and producing cloth for clothing. Francisca is asking for a loan to invest the majority into purchasing more chicken and a smaller portion in acquiring new fabrics to create new clothing. The income that Francisca brings in is imperative to her family’s well-being that, with the help of her husband job, feeds and clothes her 4 children.   

The trust bank Kakchiquel San Marcos is happy that other than the loan they also receive training once a month in various areas of personal development. For example, this past month, the group members received training over budgeting and saving their monthly income. 

Accordingly, the women are in total appreciation of the support and financing on behalf of all the Kiva investors around the world. Thank you Kiva investors for your confidence in the development of Guatemalan women!

loans.use: to purchase chickens for resale.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is 38 years old and he lives with his big family in the frontier village Aghavnavank of Tavush region. Aram’s wife is unemployed and she takes care of their children (two sons and a daughter) and their house. Aram works now as a forester and at the same time he is busy with farming and agriculture. In his farm Aram has cows, a calf, a bull, pigs, sheep and chickens. 

On his plot of land Aram cultivates potato, beans, cucumber, tomato, carrot and greens. He also has nice orchard with sweet harvest of apple, apricot, persimmon and fig. All the harvest of his land and farm products such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), curd, meat and eggs he sells right from his farm. 

Aram mentions that the most profit he manages to have from the sale of pork from his farm. As he mentions his family is happy with their peasant life in their nice village. Now this loan Aram asks as he wants to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 59 years old and married with five children. She is in agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josephine has been in this business for 20 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a respected member of her community where she has been running an Early Childhood Development (ECD)center for the last 12 years. She remains energetic and fully involved with the center even at her senior age. "I love kids and enjoy seeing them growing up in a responsible way" says the 58-year old mother of 3boys. 

She is requesting for a Kiva loan to buy and erect a palisade fence. The loan will be used to purchase the fence as well as buy poles and bags of cement. The palisade fence will give the center an attractive look as well as enforce safety for the children while they are playing.
 
Currently the center's wire mesh fence is worn down and has collapsed in some parts thus leaving the kids exposed during playtime. "We are located next to a busy road and this fence will help keep our children safe."

Priscilla hopes to move her center from her backyard, where it currently is to a free standing location that will allow the center grow independently.

loans.use: to buy and erect palisade fence to improve the safety of children at the centre

loans.name: Genesis Chuatuj Group

texts.en:
7 women who live on the outskirts of Quetzaltenango, Guatemala form the trust bank “Genesis Chuatuj”.  These women have come together to gain access to a loan from Friendship Bridge, and hope to be financed by Kiva. 
 
Elizabeth, a 42 year old member of the group, has 6 years of formal education who, identifies herself as a working and fighting woman with aspirations to better her surrounding family. Elizabeth manifests to build her business of raising animals (pigs and chickens) with the help of her 7 children. She is asking for a loan so that she may purchase more pigs and chickens to increase her income and be able to provide better opportunities for her children. 

Other than the loan, Elizabeth and her group benefit from the monthly trainings, thanks to the Micro-credit Plus program that Friendship Bridge offers; a program which offers non-formal education in various areas of development such as: Health, Family planning, Woman’s empowerment, and Business Administration. 

The trust bank Genesis Chuatuj appreciates the confidence of the investors from around the world that believe in the development of Guatemalan women. Thank you Kiva Investors!

loans.use: purchase more pigs and chickens to fatten for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Cheryl

texts.en:
