Ma. Cheryl is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling sea foods. Ma. Cheryl is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell to customers.

Ma. Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make modifications and improvements to one of his apartments.

loans.name: Jose Guillermo

texts.es:
José es un hombre perseverante y audaz, se dedica a la compra y venta de piedra canteras para construcción de viviendas  desde hace más de  20 años, oficio que aprendió al lado de su papá. Y con el tiempo ahorro para comprar un camión e independizarse. Con ese negocio ha podido generar bueno ingresos económicos para su hogar. 
Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para comprar piedras canteras que posteriormente saldrá a vender de forma ambulante por diversas zonas de su comunidad.  Entre los planes de José esta ahorrar para comprar otro camión y así ampliar sus ventas.
texts.en:
José is a determined and daring man. He has been buying and selling quarry rock to build homes for over 20 years; he learned this trade at his father's side. And over time he saved to buy a truck and become independent. With this business he has been able to generate good financial income for his household.

However, he is requesting a loan to buy quarry rock that he will later go out and sell door-to-door in different areas of his community. Among José's plans is saving to buy another truck and thereby increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy quarry rock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise to diversify his sales.

loans.name: Hta Ni Pat Village Group 1 A

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Hla (pictured left), is 46 years old and supports a family of six. Some of his children are working while the others are in school. The loan will help him purchase supplies for his crop farm such as fertilizer and crop seeds. Hla wants to expand his farm by the end of this year. He owns a few acres where he plants both rice and vegetables. Even though schools are far from the village and not every parent can support their children's education, Hla wants her children to be well-educated. 

Pictured above are the members from Hta Ni Pat Village Group A, named Bi, Yi, Nyunt, Khin and Pu. A CBO leader oversees all the members of the group. The fund will help each member purchase fertilizer and hire the labor to help in the farm. 

Hta Ni Pat Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar. Most families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his crop farm such as fertilizer and crop seeds.

borrowers.first_name: Hta Ni Pat Village Group 1 A

loans.name: Napoleon Alexander

texts.es:
Napoleón, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado y tiene 2 hijos.

Napoleón, trabaja cuidando ganado desde los 7 años de edad, a los nueve años su madre le compró una vaca para que se encargara de cuidar; dejo sus estudios para dedicarse a trabajar en una hacienda ganadera, de la cual es encargado, el tenía 8 cabezas de ganado propias, de las cuales vendió cuatro para hacerle mejoras a su casa. 

Napoleón, es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica a cuidar una hacienda ganadera y también a cultivar 28,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol; además tiene ganado propio, para llegar hasta donde tiene sus trabajos, tiene que trasladarse 30 minutos, mientras su esposa está pendiente del hogar y del cuido de sus hijos.

Napoleón, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca y una ternera, para cuidarlas y engordarlas, con la venta de este ganado pretender hacerle mejoras a su casa, además espera obtener la lecha para elaborar productos lácteos.

El sueño de Napoleón, es ayudar a su hijo con el estudio hasta donde pueda y tener más ganado.
texts.en:
Napoleón is 35 years old, studied until the 3rd grade, and is married with two children.  He has worked raising livestock since he was 7 years old, and at age 9 his mother bought him a cow whose care he was in charge of.  He left his studies to work on a cattle ranch, which he is now in charge of.  He had 8 animals of his own, four of which he sold to make home improvements.

He is a very hardworking person.  He works taking care of the cattle ranch, and also cultivates 28,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of beans.  Additionally, he has his own livestock.  To get to his work, he has to travel 30 minutes, while his wife is in charge of the care of the home and their children.

He needs the loan to buy a cow and a calf, to raise and to fatten.  With the sale of this livestock he intends to make improvements to his home.  He also hopes to get milk to make dairy products.  His dream is to help his children with school when he can and to have more livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a calf.

loans.name: Simeli

texts.en:
Simeli is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling chicken buns,cooking noodles, ice-cakes, etc in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Simeli has requested a loan to buy bag of sugar, bag of flour, yeast, bag of onion, boxes of chickens, etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Simeli will use it to extend her business for more improvements and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, bags of sugar, bags of flour, yeast, boxes of chickens,bags of onion, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Lenida

texts.en:
Lenida is 55 years old and has four children. Lenida is married and has three children are presently in school.

Lenida is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Lenida requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lenida has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, born in 1986, is a small-holder farmer who has been doing mixed farming for the last 7 years in Kitale, Kenya. He sells produce from the farm, which includes milk and other crops, at the local market. He also engages in other personal businesses to make enough money to provide for his family. John spends a lot of time tending to his animals and land. Spraying is the activity he finds to be the most enjoyable. John complains that working on the land is becoming more strenuous with age. 

The one factor contributing to the strain is the type of tools he employs. John is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase farm equipment. Small-holder farmers usually prefer indigenous tools because they are economical, feasible and sustainable. Despite being common, they are generally not preferred to modern tools since they are inefficient and tiring to use. With your funding, John will be able to afford modern tools that are properly designed to be more comfortable to use and meet farmer's requirements. These tools will make John's work easier and more efficient. This will boost his productivity and income. Money from this investment will go towards his family's basic expenses.

loans.use: To purchase modern farm implements.

loans.name: Vang

texts.en:
Mrs. Vang is 27 years old, maried and has a baby. She and her husband have been practicing agro-forestry for the last eight years. She wants to apply for her loan to buy more certified seeds and fertilizers to improve her farming. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her child. Her future hope is to improve the family's living standards. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to buy more certified seeds and fertilizers to improve her farming

loans.name: A

texts.en:
Mrs. A is 52 years old, married and has two children. She has been practicing farming and forestry for the last 25 years, earning 3,000,000 VNĐ per month. 

She wants to apply for her loan to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and farm inputs to enable high production and supply for more income gain. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to expand to a retail business in the area. Her future hopes and dreams are to financially stable.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and farm inputs to enable high production and supply for more income gain

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 59 years old and married with nine children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Nida is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Nida has been in this business for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 68 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su cónyugue, no cuenta con ningun hijo en su poder; ella vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, que pertenece a la provincia de Jaén, región cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.Contando con servicios de agua y luz.

La actividad que realiza es brindar servicio de hospedaje, alquiler de habitaciones, tiene 15 años dedicándose a esta actividad, el servicio lo realiza en su domicilio, con buenas referencias personales y laborales. El destino del crédito será para invertir en construcción de nuevas habitaciones para su hospedaje, con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 68 years old, lives in her own home made of rustic material with her spouse, and does not have any children. She lives in a rural part of the Pucará district, which belongs to the Jaén province, in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. They have electricity and water services.

She makes a living by providing lodging services, renting rooms. She has done this work for 15 years, which she does from her home, with good personal and professional references. The loan will be to invest in the construction of new rooms for her lodging. With this, she will increase her income and therefore improve her quality of life. In this category there is no competition in the area, therefore she has the best prices.

loans.use: to invest in the construction of new rooms for her lodging.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material such as rexine, zipper, buckles etc for sewing handbags with the help of her children.

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer ecuatoriana nacida en la ciudad de Latacunga perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi  de la República del Ecuador, este cantón es muy reconocido por sus tradiciones y su gente que es muy trabajadora. Tiene 68 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos pero ya ninguno de ellos vive con ella, su esposo murió hace cuatro años de una enfermedad, con mucho sacrificio y dedicación Olga termino sus estudios primarios, ha trabajado desde muy niña debido a la mala situación económica que vivían en casa de sus padres, ella por si sola tuvo que conseguir las maneras de poder salir adelante.
 Olga ha sido muy luchadora y muy trabajadora dándoles un  buen ejemplo a sus hijos, tiene un puesto de chochos con tostado fuera de un colegio del lugar, con este humilde oficio a ha tenido que luchar muy duro para poder regalarles a sus hijos una mejor vida y lograr que sean  profesionales llenos de valores y principios que ella desde muy pequeños les ha ido inculcando.
Olga  construyo su casa con mucho esfuerzo pero a la vez con mucha alegría y orgullo ya que su madre le heredo un pequeño terreno, lamentablemente no la ha podido terminar de construir por falta de recursos económicos.
Hoy está solicitando un crédito para comprar más producto y poder tener en stock.
Olga  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Olga is an Ecuadorian woman who was born in the city of Latacunga, which is in the province of Cotopaxi in the Republic of Ecuador; this canton is very well known for its traditions and its people, who are very hardworking. She is 68 years old; she is the mother of four children, but none of them live with her anymore; her husband died of an illness four years ago. With a lot of sacrifice and dedication, Olga finished her primary education; she has worked since she was very young because of her parents' bad financial situation. She had to find ways to get ahead on her own.

Olga has been very determined and hardworking and has set a good example for her children. She has a stand where she sells chochos, a kind of bean, and toast outside of a local school. With this humble work she has had to work very hard to be able to give her children a better life and make sure they become professionals with values and principles, which she has been instilling in them since they were very young.

Olga built her house with a lot of hard work, but also with a great deal of happiness and pride, as her mother left her a small plot of land. Unfortunately, she has not been able to finish construction because of a lack of financial resources.

Today she is requesting a loan to buy more produce so she can stock up.

Olga thanks Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making her professional and personal growth possible.

loans.use: to buy produce and stock up, which will increase her daily output.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is 49 years old and she lives with her husband and son in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. Lusine has higher pedagogical education and she works now at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. Lusine is beloved and respected teacher and she arranges have very interesting and really very informative lessons at the school. 

She also gives paid private courses at her house helping the pupils who are going to have entrance exams. Lusine with her pedagogical activities also manages farming and agriculture. Now this loan of 700.000 Armenia drams Lusine asks as she wants to buy  a computer and also professional literature which she greatly needs for her private courses at her house.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional literature which she greatly needs for her private courses at her house

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en: Mrs. Xuan is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. She would like to take a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living condition and health for her family. Her income is mainly from small business  so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for fixing a lathe machine and cutting tools for her husband's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Yahaira

texts.es:
Carácter: Yahaira ha sido beneficiada con crédito por parte de Fundación Mujer en 3 ocasiones anteriores, estos préstamos fueron pequeños, principalmente para materiales. Su equipo lo adquiere con capital propio y el apoyo de su esposo; demostró en estos préstamos una buena gestión y moral de pago. La empresa, taller Anita, cuenta con un edificio independiente de la casa, maquinaria, mesa de trabajo y equipo par acorte de moldes. La clientela incluye público general además de empresas y escuelas que la buscan para confección de uniformes, que es su fuente de ingresos principal. Vive con su esposo y 2 hijas, que aportan a los gastos del hogar. La clienta compra sus materiales en distintas tiendas en Puntarenas, principalmente y en San Ramón es otro lugar que visita para comprar sus telas.

 El Taller Anita tiene 13 años de trabajar en la zona de Barranca, es ampliamente conocido y atiende público en general, empresas y escuelas de la zona, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, especializándose en la confección de uniformes, motivo por el cual solicita este crédito. Tiene una cobertura local y entrega en forma directa su mercadería, además atiende a sus clientes de esta misma manera, al momento de tomar medidas o realizar otras labores propias de su empresa. Trabaja durante todo el año, teniendo sus meses fuertes en el segundo semestre del año. En la zona no existe una competencia directa. Y su trabajo es muy bien referenciado por sus clientes. Ella ha tenido crédito con Fundación Mujer demostrando una buena conducta de pago.
texts.en:
Yahaira has benefitted with a loan through Fundación Mujer on three previous occasions.  These loans were small, and principally for materials.  She bought her equipment with her own money and with the support of her husband.  She showed in these loans both good management and moral repayment.  The company, Taller Anita, has a building independent of the home, and also has machinery, a work table, and equipment to cut patterns.  The customers include the general public, businesses, and schools who are looking for someone to make uniforms, which is her principal source of income.

She lives with her husband and two daughters, who contribute to the household expenses.  Yahaira buys her materials in certain stores in Puntarenas, mainly, and also visits San Ramón to buy fabric.  The Taller Anita has 13 years running in the Barranca zone, and is well known.  It serves the general public, businesses and schools of the area, sews every type of clothing, specializing in the making of uniforms, the reason for which she is requesting this loan.

She works locally and directly delivers her merchandise.  Furthermore, she serves her clients in the same way, from taking measurements or carrying out other work for her company.  She works all year, having her strong months in the second half of the year.  The area she is in doesn't have direct competition, and her work is well-referenced by her customers.  She has borrowed before with Fundación Mujer, demonstrating good repayment conduct.

loans.use: to buy materials to make band uniforms for national celebration parades.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
Amado tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Cañaris que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Amado se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Amado espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Amado is 36 years old, lives with his spouse and their children in their own home made of rustic materials. He lives the Cañaris district, which is located in the Ferreñafe province, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. Life in this district is peaceful; the inhabitants work mostly in agriculture, trade and raising livestock.

Amado makes a living in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of coffee. He has 10 years of experience in the business and has many good personal and professional references in the area. The loan will be used to purchase compost and fertilizers for proper maintenance of his coffee cultivation, as well as for hiring manual labor for the harvest season. 

With this, Amado hopes to offer the highest quality coffee to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level and improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers for proper maintenance of his coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, rice, salt, soap, oils and margarine, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Hiari  Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Sophia is early 40s, married and has three sons and three daughters, who are at school.  She has had a business of clothes selling for 12 years now and works from 07am to 06pm per working day. Sophia is able to make a fair monthly return. 

From Kiva partner's Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her seventh credit request to be apportioned among HIARI YA MOYO, four members group who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She used the previous credits, paid back in full, to pay school fees for her kids and partly bought business stocks. 

She is really appreciative of Kiva's support. Sophia will use this loan to buy new fashionable clothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy new fashionable clothes for her business.

loans.name: Edwin Patricio

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 23 años de edad, actualmente se encuentra  casado con Enma, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la escuela primaria y luego  la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy chico para poder sustentar sus necesidades y poder terminar la secundaria.
 Ahora Edwin  vive junto a su familia  en la parroquia Juan Montalvo  del Cantón Latacunga ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador en un barrio llamado Pusuchisi. Este sector  está ubicado en el noroccidente de la provincia, es una zona rural su clima es muy frio, aquí la mayoría de su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, debido a su situación climática y geográfica, lo cual también produce efecto en las cosechas de las cuales se obtiene productos de la Región Sierra. Su gente vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
Edwin heredó de sus padres la habilidad para la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, cerdos, terneros, conejos etc. A esta actividad se dedica desde hace tres años atrás y dedica de  8 a 10 horas cada día paralelamente con las actividades del hogar.  Con la experiencia que ha adquirido a través de los años, se siente preparado para dar un paso de crecimiento para lo cual solicita el crédito, con esta inversión hará que su producción aumente para que de esta manera  pueda mejorar su estilo de vida y el de su familia, 
Edwin y su familia  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 23-year-old man who is currently married to Enma. Thanks to his parents' efforts, he managed to finish primary school; later, a lack of financial resources led him to work from a very young age in order to be able to meet his needs and to be able to finish secondary school.

Now, Edwin lives with his family in a community called Pusuchisi in the Juan Montalvo parish of Latacunga canton, located in the province of Cotopaxi of the Republic of Ecuador. This area is located in the northwest of the province; it is a rural area with very cold weather. Because of the climatic and geographic conditions, the majority of the people there earn their livings farming and raising young animals. These conditions also have an effect on the harvests, from which they obtain products of the Sierra Region. The people live day-to-day on these activities. Although this place is far from the city, there are families who have started all kinds of businesses to meet their needs and those of their community.

From his parents, Edwin inherited his skill in raising and selling young animals like chickens, pigs, calves, rabbits, etc. He has worked in this business for three years; he dedicates from 8 to 10 hours every day to this activity alongside his household activities. With the experience that he has acquired over the years, he feels prepared to take a step toward growth, so he is requesting the loan. With this investment, he will increase his production so that he will be able to improve his way of life as well as that of his family.

Edwin and his family are grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making their work-related and personal growth possible.

loans.use: to buy more young animals and increase his production, thereby improving his way of life.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a smallholder farmer from a rural home in Siongiroi Kenya. Dairy farming to Paul is not only a source of income but also a livelihood. He has been doing dairy farming for years and he is still committed to the growth of his farm.

Paul is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a dairy cow. He plans to spend a small part of the loan amount on the cow’s insurance. This is a risk-mitigating measure to protect his family from slipping into poverty in case the cow dies.

The impact this loan will have on Paul and his family includes financial inclusion, business growth, capital accumulation, and increased income.  His ultimate goal is to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to improve his family living standards

loans.name: Dat's Group

texts.en:
Dat lives in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. She is 47 years old, and she is a mother of four children; one of them is a dependent child. 

Nowadays, she does rice farming to support her family’s living, and has done so for 29 years. Due to the price of rice being depreciated, it has caused her to gain a low return from her business. 

For Dat, she has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, and this is her first loan cycle. She is willing to take a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and another member is seeking of 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide for growing rice. She hopes that her crop will grow well so that it gains her more yields to improve her living.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide for growing rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Mrs. Anh is a single mother, 47 years old and is a farmer. She has two over 18 year’s old children. She would like to improve her living standard, especially her children but has a lack of capital. 

The loan can help her to build a hygienic latrine. Farming is main income source of her family and she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en: Thuong is a hard-working woman who is 23 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. Shrimp farming and small business are the main sources of income for her family. She has a shrimp pond and she sells shrimp. She requested a loan to purchase more shrimp stock to raise and sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family. She is able to make the monthly loan repayments with support from her parents.

loans.use: To purchase more shrimp stock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Atiya's Group

texts.en:
Atiya is a 32-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. 

Atiya's husband has a business that provides services to the construction industry. He transports supplies, such as sand, pebbles, concrete, cement, and soil, from one place to another. He has been doing this work for many years, generating reasonable income for his family. 

Her husband's truck is currently broken due to overloading and bumpy roads. He is poor and does not have enough money to make repairs. For this reason, he is unable to provide services and is earning no income.

Atiya has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband will use the loan to repair the truck so he can start providing services again. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain the truck for her husband's construction supply business.

loans.name: Lianna

texts.en:
Lianna is 50 years old and she lives in Ijevan city of Tavush region. She lives with her big family. Lianna for several used to work at the city’s carpet combine. Now Lianna is engaged farming and she also has her own small business at the city’s wholesale market where she sells bread and an assortment of cookies. While in her farm she simultaneously takes care of pigs and chickens. Lianna profitably sells pork and eggs from her farm. She also has nice orchard from which she gathers harvest of persimmon, fig and apple. All the family members (her husband, son, daughter and daughter-in-law)Lianna help in her farm works.

She must also keep her small business working since it is also some source of income for her family. This loan of 320.000 Armenian drams Lianna asks as she wants to buy several piglets for her farm and some part of her money she will also use for the development of her small business.

loans.use: to buy several piglets for her farm and some part of her money she will also use for the development of her small business

loans.name: Ana Lilian Paz

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 41 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de frutas y verduras, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante recorriendo los cantones cercanos y las principales calles de su municipio. Ella vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 18, 17 y 13 años de edad, con los que vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace varios años. Ana desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado a causa del tiempo y las inclemencias del clima, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y hierro para mejorar el techo y brindar mayor protección a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is a 41 year old hard-working woman who for the last 15 years has made a living selling fruits and vegetables, which she does as a street vendor in the neighborhoods close by and on the main streets of her municipality.  

She lives with her husband and 3 children, ages 18, 17 and 13 years old, and has lived with them in their own house for several years.  Ana wants to improve the roof of her home, as it is deteriorating because of the weather and the severity of the climate.  This is why she is requesting a credit from FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal, wood, nails and iron to improve her roof and give her children better protection.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal, wood, nails and iron to improve her roof and give her children better protection.

loans.name: Nua

texts.en:
Mrs. Nua  is a hardworking woman, 43 years old. She is married and has two children, all of them have a job. Her family’s income is mainly from small business and  her husband is a woodworker. 

She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Las Praderas De Pariachi Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “LAS PRADERAS DE PARIACHI” y está conformado por 08 socios comprometidos y responsables. Liduvina de 49 años de edad es separada con 4 hijos uno de ellos dependiente. Ella se dedica al alquiler de local para eventos desde hace más de 3 años. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio y le va bien se siente feliz porque gracias al préstamo mejora cada día más su calidad de vida. Su último crédito lo destinará para  la compra de pintura y cemento y así pueda mejorar la infraestructura de su local. El grupo “las praderas de pariachi” agradece a las personas de kiva por hacer posible éste crédito. Liduvina se encuentra sentada es la segunda del lado derecho viste casaca a cuadros. El joven franklin por motivo de trabajo no pudo asistir.
texts.en:
This is the "LAS PRADERAS DE PARIACHI” group and it is made of 8 committed and responsible members.  Liduvina is 49 years old, separated, and has 4 children, one of which is a dependent.  For 3 years she has dedicated herself to renting a space for events.  Due to great effort she has been able to improve her business and it is going well.  She feels happy because her quality of life is better each day thanks to the loan.  

Ludirían is sitting second on the right and has a plaid jacket.  One young member,  Franklin, could not attend because of work.

loans.use: to buy paint and cement.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is aged 48, living with her husbandand four children in a small town near Lahore,Pakistan. Her husband provides the decorative shelters, wedding tents on weddings, birthday and engagement ceremonies. His does not consider it a profitable business because this is a seasonal business. Now the marriage season is going to peak but most of his tents have become damaged or are imperfect due to lack of usage from a long time. He wants to buy new wedding tents to provide better services to his customers. 

Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new tents and decorative lights to provide the decoration services. 
Haleema thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to use this loan for her husband's business of decorative shelters/tents for weddings and celebrations etc

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es una señora de 60 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Sololá, vive junto a sus tres hijos  de las edades entre  28 y 36 años, todos ellos ya trabajan.

Paula es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia y muy comprometida, en ayudar a su esposo para generar ingresos  y así contribuir en los gastos de la casa, para poder sacar adelante a su familia, Paula desde muy pequeña creció y trabajo al lado de su mamá y heredo el oficio con que su mamá apoyaba a su familia, ella ahora se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas por las calles de su comunidad.

Ella desde hace varios años cuenta con este negocio pero el anhelo de paula es conseguir un préstamo, y mejorar la calidad de servicio para sus clientes comprar una variedad de frutas de buena calidad, y con las ganancias que genera su pequeño negocio ella estaría pagando el préstamo. Paula es una mujer muy trabajadora y ella tienen la esperanzas de conseguir el préstamo y su sueños es ver su casa con otra perspectiva.
texts.en:
Paula is a 60-year-old woman. She lives in a community of Sololá along with her three children, whose ages are between 28 and 36 years; all of them already work.

Paula is a woman who is very dedicated to her family and committed to helping her husband to generate income to contribute to the household expenses and to be able to provide for their family. Since she was very little, she grew up working alongside her mama, inheriting the trade with which her mama supported the family. She now works buying and selling fruits in the streets of her community.

She has had this business for several years, but Paula's desire is to get a loan and improve the quality of her service for her customers. She will buy a variety of high-quality fruits, and with the earnings her little business will generate, she will pay back her loan. Paula is a very hardworking woman and she has hopes of getting the loan. Her dream is to see her house with a new look.

loans.use: to buy a variety of high-quality fruits

loans.name: Durman

texts.en:
Durman is from the district of Shahrituz. Shahrituz is the warmest place of Tajikistan. Most of residents of this district are involved in animal husbandry. So they provide for their families. 

Durman is one of those people who engage in animal husbandry and crop yield. He does not have another source of income except this. For this, Durman works very hard, so that his family does not remain without food. 

Durman really need urgently to buy two cows and feed for them. Currently he has only one cow, but it is not enough! The only thing he wants is to improve his farming activity to get more effective result and yield. With this new cow, Durman is sure to produce more, to earn more and be able to save money for his family.

loans.use: To purchase two cows to expand his farming activity

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a smallholder dairy farmer in the Mariashoni village of Kenya. He enjoys dairy farming because it provides his family with a livelihood and income. He has been doing this work for many years, and he is still determined to grow the business.

Moses is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. He plans to spend part of the loan on the cow’s insurance in order to protect his family from slipping into debt and further into poverty in the event the cow dies. 

The impact this loan will have on Moses and his family includes financial inclusion, business growth, wider asset base, and increase in income.  His ultimate goal is to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chachygul

texts.ru: Чачыгул, 34 года, замужем, есть сын. У нее высшее образование, работает в школе преподавателем, также занимается животноводством. Чачыгул очень любит свою деятельность, в хозяйстве есть 10 коров, 80 овец и лошадь. Ее ежемесячный доход, в том числе от заработной платы, составляет 43,000 сом (KGS). Накопления Чачыгул старается вкладывать в образование и воспитание сына. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку 20 овец для откорма и реализации. Благодаря кредиту, Чачыгул сможет откладывать доходы от бизнеса на дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en:
Chachygul is 34 years old, married and has one son. She has higher education and works as a school teacher. She also works with livestock breeding. Chachygul loves her business very much. She has 10 cows, 80 sheep and one horse on her farm. Her monthly income, including her salary, is 43,000 som (KGS).

Chachygul strives to use her savings for her son's education and upbringing. She turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase 20 sheep for fattening and reselling. Thanks to the loan, Chachygul will be able to save money to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing

loans.name: Rasha

texts.ru: Раша, 51 год, вдова, мать-героиня 8 детей, самому младшему сыну - 6 лет. У Раши среднее образование, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 31 года назад. Благодаря упорному труду, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 3 овцы и 2 лошади, а также имеет земельный надел мерою 2,40 ГА, на котором ежегодно выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса Раши составляет 16,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Раша обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетелей для откорма на пастбище и дальнейшей реализации, то позволит улучшить благосостояние Раши и ее семьи. Доходы от кредита Раша планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует построить сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Rasha is 51 years old, a widow, and a "hero-mother" of eight children. The youngest son is six years old. Rasha has a high school education and works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started with this 31 years ago. 

Thanks to her persistent work, her farm currently has a cow, three sheep and two horses. She also has a plot of land of 2.40 hectares, on which she grows barley every year. Rasha's monthly income from the business is 16,000 som (KGS). This money is unfortunately not enough for a decent life and providing for the family.

With an aim to further develop her business, Rasha turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase two heifers for fattening in the field, and subsequently reselling. This will allow Rasha to improve her family's well-being. Rasha plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and plans to build a livestock barn.

loans.use: to buy two heifers for fattening in the field and subsequently reselling, in order to increase her income

loans.name: Vallelian

texts.en:
Vallelian is aged 24 years, married to Ronald and she supports 2 children.  She has been a salonist for the last 7 years and the business earns her KES 8,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase manufactured hair pieces, hair neutralizer, a shampoo detergent and blow drier for offering her services to clients and meet both client and family needs. 

She plans to gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sell to clients and educate her children. 

Her hope is to expand her business sector, eradicate poverty in her family and improve sanitation.

loans.use: to purchase manufactured hair pieces, hair neutralizer, a shampoo detergent and blow drier for offering her services to clients

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
En el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.  Se reúne cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre.
Aquí vive la señora Sonia, tiene 36 años  de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. 
Doñas Sonia es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante y con sus recursos sacar adelante a sus pequeños, ella se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de plástico como, reposteros, canastas, jarras, vasos y muchos otros productos, ella sale casi todos los días a vender sus productos por la localidad, ya son más de 10 años que lleva con esta actividad, razón por lo cual cuenta con muy buena clientela que siempre le compran y le ayudan a salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, reposteros, canastas, jarras, vasos y muchos otros productos que venden. Lleva 3 ciclos en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The canton of Montecristi is know for its rich precolonial culture and its nationally and internationally recognized crafts, including its Panama hats. This is where the members of the loan group "24th of December" meet every two weeks. 
Sonia lives here. She is 36 years old and a single mother to two children who are 11 and 9 years old. Both are in school.
Sonia is a very hardworking woman who likes to get ahead and to use her resources to bring up her little ones well. She is in commerce, and sells all types of clothes and plastic wares such as cabinets, storage bins, jugs, vases, and many other products. She goes out in her neighborhood selling her products almost every day. She has been doing this for more than 10 years, so she has good customers who always buy from her and this helps her to be successful. 
This loan will be used to buy clothes, cabinets, storage bins, jugs, vases, and other goods that she sells. She has been with the group for 3 loan cycles and she likes it for the help that is given with the loans. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cabinets, storage bins, jugs, vases, etc.

loans.name: Yesu Anaweza Group

texts.en:
Joyce is married and a mother of three sons and three daughter who are at school. For more than one year now, she has had a business of tailoring, her self being a tailor, making and repairing customers clothes. She starts working from 7am to 6pm per working day and is able to make a small profit per month.

This is her tenth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among YESU ANAWEZA, two members group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She used the previous loans, paid back in full, to rise her business capital (bought clothes making materials as she demanded). 

She is really grow than before and so thankful with Tujijenge's loans. In the coming years, she would like to open a wholesale shop. 
Joyce will invest part of this credit to buy clothes making materials.

loans.use: to buy clothes making materials

loans.name: Rolita

texts.en:
"This life may be an unending battle but you have to endure it."

Rolita is 52 years old. Through the years, she has experienced a lot that has made her persistent and strong.

She graduated college, yet it was a challenge for her to find a stable job. That is why she involved herself in the business industry – to ensure that she has a source of income. 

Rolita operates a house-rental business. She rents rooms to lodgers at a fixed cost per month. With her experience in running a business, she is confident to take a loan for 42,000 PHP, which she will use to maintain and beautify her business. 

She hopes Kiva lenders will entrust her with this loan, because her business provides a stable source of income. She promises that she will be accountable for what she borrows. 

Aside from her house-rental business, she also sells dish-washing products and runs a pedicab business that provides additional income. 

Rolita dreams of one day having enough capital to re-start her business of selling bags for a living. She also wishes to help her three stepchildren graduate college.  

Rolita meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to maintain and beautify her house-rental business.

loans.name: Annabela

texts.en:
Thirteen years ago, Annabela started this coconut "buko" business. 

She's a 52-year-old resident of Araneta, Quezon City. She is married to Hernanie and they were blessed with seven kids. Growing such a number of children is a very difficult one, especially if you're not that fortunate in life. However, the couple is still able to manage their own household while operating the Buko business. 

Annabela buys coconut fruit that are native to the Philippines which are grown mostly in the South Region of Luzon. Coconut is a very versatile fruit. Its parts are very potential and useful, which makes it a good item for business. In fact, she can earn here a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of coconut to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her stall. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Annabela hopes that they will always have available stocks of coconut to sell and dreams that she, together with her family, will always find time for each other despite their busy schedules. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of coconut to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her stall.

loans.name: Hta Ni Pat Village 2 B

texts.en:
Tin, the featured borrower, is 35 years old and lives with his family of four. He has two children in school, and hopes to be able to support them till graduation. He raises ducks in addition to his ten acres of crop farm. He is looking forward to purchasing the necessary farming supplies. He hopes to expand his farm, boost his income, and buy his own farming machines. 

Pictured above are the members from Hta Ni Pat Village Group 2 B, named Tin, Kyaw, Myint, Myint S, Sein and Hte. A CBO leader oversees the group, and the fund will help each member purchase supplies for his farm such as fertilizers and rice. 

Hta Ni Pat Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar. Most families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies that he needs at his farm.

loans.name: Maiuni Wendano Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Francisca, 73 years old, married and has 5 children. She has benefited a lot from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training especially on enterprise development and record keeping.  She does green gram farming. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and pesticides which will improve her crop productivity and living standards hence pay schools fees for her children

She appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the financial support

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer and pesticides to improve on her productivity hence more income

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en:
Elnara is 34 years old. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar region. Elnare is not married. She has a strong character and is very diligent lady. Like all other women, she loves her family and tries her best to take care of their needs. 

Unfortunately Elnara can't work because she is ill. She requires funds for her illness to be cured and take medications. Elnara is very hopeful and believes that Kiva lenders will show their best support to her.

loans.use: to be cured and take medications

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1981. He is living in a village with his family and has two children. His wife is a housekeeper. He is a business man. He tries to work hard to ensure his family lives well. 

His child is sick. He has not saved up money. All his earnings are spent for living. He appealed to IMON asking financial support from Kiva lenders to pay for his child's treatment at a medical clinic. He hopes to be supported and awaits you compassion.

loans.use: to pay for his child's treatment at a medical clinic

loans.name: Agellah

texts.en:
Agellah is 37 years old,married and blessed with 3 children. She is a farmer and has been growing cash crops for sell as well as keeping sheep and goats. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan, educate her children and animal feeds. Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell.

loans.name: Janeth Amparo

texts.es:
En el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.  Se reúne cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Janeth, tiene 62 años de edad,  hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda, pero de esta relación tuvo tres hijos, todos sus hijos ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. 
Ella es una mujer que le ha tacado trabajar y así ganarse la vida y más después de la muerte de su querido esposo, ella tiene un negocio en su casa donde vende colas, aguas, golosinas, helados, hielo, helados, entre otras cosas, gracias a los créditos que ha recibido de parte de la Fundación ella ha podido ir mejorando su negocio por lo cual está muy agradecida con las personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir un crédito que le permite salir adelante, ya son más de 16 años que lleva con esta actividad la cual le da lo necesario para vivir.
Ella repite el crédito, sus ganancias son para sus gastos diarios de medicinas y alimentación. Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar aguas, sodas, golosinas helados, entre otras cosas que vende. Esta desde el inicio en el  Grupo de Crédito. Sus sueños seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The canton of Montecristi is know for its rich precolonial culture and its nationally and internationally recognized crafts, including its Panama hats. The loan group "24th of December" meets here every 2 weeks. 
Janeth lives here. She is 62 years old and her husband died some years ago and left her widowed. But, she has 3 children from her marriage and all her children are grown up, although one still lives at home with her. 
She is a woman who has had to work in order to earn a living and, after the death of her dear husband, she has had a store in her house where she sells sodas, water, candy, ice cream, ice, and other things. Thanks to the loans that she has received from the Fundación, she has been able to improve her business and so she is very grateful to the people who have made it possible for her to receive a loan so that she can get ahead. She has been running this business for more than 16 years so that she has enough to live on.
She is repeating a loan. Her profits go on her daily expenses for medicine and food. She will use this loan to buy water, sodas, candy, ice cream, and other things that she sells. She has been in this loan group since it began. Her dream is to be successful and healthy.

loans.use: to buy water, soda, candy, ice cream, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma. Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut-wine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit selling. Ma. Yolanda is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase supplies for her business.

Ma. Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through two previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her fruit-selling and coconut-wine business.

loans.name: Mildread

texts.en:
Mildread is 33 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

Mildread has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Virgilio es un hombre que lucha cada día para llevar lo necesario a su familia, vive en una comunidad de Sololá, de 36 años de edad.

Este señor se dedica al cultivo de una variedad de verduras, él tiene experiencia sobre este trabajo, pero el problema que tenía era que no contaba con capital de trabajo, gracias a un préstamo que se le dio en ADICLA pudo incrementar  su cultivo, con el poco capital que él contaba, cultivaba muy poco, pero con este apoyo su cultivo ha incrementado, con este avance que él ha tenido, Virgilio esta ahora buscando un  segundo préstamo para comprar semillas de cebolla y fertilizantes, y hacer que su cultivo incremente para obtener mejores ganancias.

Otro sueño que Virgilio tiene es poder comprar más terreno para la seguir incrementando su cultivo.
texts.en:
Virgilio is a man who strives every day to provide what his family needs, he lives in a community of Sololá and is 36 years old.

This man makes a living by farming a variety of vegetables, he has experience in this job but the problem that he had was that he did not have any working capital.  Thanks to a loan that ADICLA gave him he could expand his crops, with the little capital he had before, he could grow very few crops, but with this support his crop has increased.  With the progress he has seen, Virgilio is now requesting a second loan to buy onion seeds and fertilizers, and increase his crops again to make more profit.

Another dream that Virgilio has is to buy more land to continue expanding his crops.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: St. David Horticultural Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Ageline, 33 years old and a widow with three children. She does poultry farming as her main business and has benefited a lot from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa entrepreneurship training. 

She is taking a Kiva loan to buy poultry feed for her chicken and additional chicks for her business. This will improve her income hence enhance her ability to her pay school fees for her children and improve on her living standards.

Ageline is thankful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chicks for more income to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Ndemi Maendeleo Ya Wanaume Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is George, 65 years old, from Ndemi Maendeleo Ya Wanaume SHG Group. He is married and a father of five children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013, and has undergone the enterprise and financial management training.

His main economic activity is dairy farming. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy animal feed and this will increase milk production hence increased sales and increase in his income, thereafter raise school fees for his children.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds to improve milk production for sale and be able to pay schoolf fees

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia proviene de una familia humilde y trabajadora, sus padres son comprometidos con el trabajo, y buscan siempre seguir adelante, Virginia trabaja en una farmacia en atención a clientes, y a la vez que trabaja, también estudia, es una mujer muy sacrificada, que quiere salir adelante, quiere ser abogada, y poder ayudar a las demás personas con su profesión.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matrícula y su mensualidad, y así seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Virginia comes from a humble hard-working family. Her parents are committed to their work and are always trying to get ahead. Virginia works at a pharmacy taking care of customers. In addition to working she also goes to school. She is a woman who makes sacrifices who wants to come out on top. She wants to be a lawyer and be able to help those in need with her profession. She asks for this loan to be able to pay tuition and monthly installments so that she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: pay tuition and monthly installments

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is a 37 years old with a partner for 3 years with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages and beans to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Rosa has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds, wheel barrow, bush knives, weeds sprayer, etc.She has been a member of SBPD since June this year 2015. With her profits, Rosa hopes to spend it to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy rakes, wheel barrow, vegetable seeds, bush knives, weeds sprayer, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 25 años, vive con sus padres en el chaco, él está en proceso de preparación para su tesis, a la vez que estudia también trabaja como auxiliar.
Actualmente está estudiando una especialización de la carrera de Psicología, necesita el préstamo pues tiene gastos de preparación de tesis elevados que no puede cubrir. Piensa seguir estudiando y dedicarse a su Profesión.
texts.en:
Juan is 25 years old and lives with his parents in Chaco, he is in the process of preparing for his thesis, as well as studying he also works as an assistant.

He is currently studying with a major in psychology, he needs the loan because there are increased costs for preparing his thesis that he can’t cover.  He is thinking of continuing to study and making a living out of his profession.

loans.use: to pay costs for preparing his thesis.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo trabaja como auxiliar administrativo en una empresa y a la vez estudia, es una persona muy sacrificada que lucha por sus metas.
Sus metas futuras son la de terminar sus estudios para poder obtener mejores ingresos, y ayudar a su familia, seguir estudiando y mejorar como profesional.
Pide este préstamo para cubrir los gastos de preparación de tesis que tiene que cubrir.
texts.en:
Hugo works as an administrative assistant in a company and also studies. He is a very self-sacrificing person who fights to achieve his goals. 

His future goals are to finish his studies in order to be able to make more income, to help his family, to continue studying, and to improve as a professional. 

He is asking for this loan to cover the expenses he will incur to prepare for his thesis.

loans.use: to pay for his thesis preparation expenses.

loans.name: 9 De Octubre  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 9 De Octubre está integrado por 13 personas que tiempo atrás decidieron unirse para recibir estos créditos que les han ayudado mucho para mejorar su calidad de vida, ellos se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Zoila, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 1 hija de 7 años la misma que estudia en escuela. Su esposo es maestro en aluminio y vidrio.
Doña Zoila es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así con sus ganancias sacar adelante su hogar y a su pequeña, ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja dos o tres  días por semana en sus recorridos, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Ella también parte del crédito se lo da a su  esposo el cual lo utiliza para comprar materiales que emplea en su  taller de aluminio y vidrio. Trabajando los dos logran salir adelante y se les hace más fácil con la ayuda de los créditos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, aluminio y vidrio que su esposo necesita. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando su vida.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Credit Group "9 de Octubre" is formed by 13 people who, some time ago, decided to join together to receive loans that have significantly helped them to improve their quality of life. They meet every fifteen days in the Cantón Montecristi, known for it's rich pre-colonial culture and artisan crafts that are recognized at the national and international level. It is also the home of the famous straw hats.

One of the members of this group is Zoila, who is 32 years old, married, and from this relationship has a 7 year-old daughter, who is in school. Her husband works with aluminum and glass. Zoila is an independent woman, and with her earnings she supports her home and her daughter. She works in commerce, selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She works two or three days per week in her travels, leaving and collecting the loan every weekend. She also gives part of the loan to her husband, who uses it to purchase materials that are used in his aluminum and glass workshop. They are both working to get ahead, which is much easier with the help from the loans.

This loan is to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, aluminum and glass that her husband needs. She is a founding member of the Credit Group, and likes it because of the help given by the loans. Her dream is to continue improving her life. The small photo is of Zoila, who was unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, aluminio y vidrio.

loans.name: Yennifer Evelyn

texts.es:
En el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.  Se reúne cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Yennifer, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 4 y 3 años y un bebé de 2 meses. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente.
Doña Yennifer es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta, su marido le ayuda con sus ventas cuando él puede, ella también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda,  deja a crédito  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene más de 2 años esta actividad la cual le da para salir adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas entre otras prendas. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The canton of Montecristi is know for its rich precolonial culture and its nationally and internationally recognized crafts, including its Panama hats. The loan group "24th of December" meets here every 2 weeks. 
Yennifer lives here. She is 20 years old, married, and has 3 kids from this relationship who are 4 and 3 years old, plus a 2 month old baby. Her husband has occasional employment. 
Yennifer is a very hardworking woman who likes to fend for herself in order to get ahead. She has a business selling all types of clothes door to door. Her husband helps her with the sales when he can. She also sells from her house if customers come because they need an item of clothing. She offers credit and collects payments every week. She has been doing this for more than 2 years so that she can get ahead. 
She will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other clothes. She has been in the loan group for 2 loan cycles and she likes it because she can finance her business with the loans. Her dream is to give her little ones the best.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, and other clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay university costs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children. She runs a an Avon dealership in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more Avon products to sell to customers.

Nenita industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, including her general store. She dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Langat

texts.en:
Langat is a smallholder farmer from a rural home in South Rift Kenya. Dairy farming to Langat is not only a source of income but also a livelihood. He has been doing dairy farming for years and he is still committed to the growth of his farm.

Langat is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a dairy cow. He plans to spend a fraction of the loan amount on the cow’s insurance to protect his family from being over-indebted in case the cow is ill or dies.

The impact this loan will have on Langat and his family includes financial inclusion, business growth, wider asset base and increase in income.  His ultimate goal is to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to expand his family income

loans.name: Ezekiah

texts.en:
Ezekiah, 30, has a loving family that he really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed on hungry stomachs. Ezekiah hails from the Kericho area of Kenya. He never got the opportunity to advance his education and get a white collar job but this did not kill his dream of wanting to succeed in life. Ezekiah started farming and has been doing farming for the past 7 years. Through those years he has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. 

He practices mixed farming on his farm and through the profits he has managed to take care of his family's needs and also give his children a good education because he believes that education is the only “key to success.” 

Ezekiah is a man who is very enterprising and he is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on his farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in his village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Ezekiah wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. 

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring men like Ezekiah to take their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Ezekiah hopes that through the loan he will improve his living conditions. His dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year he will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this he will be able to assure his children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because he will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Ezekiah is not a selfish man and also wants to impact society that is why he will employ people to work for him on his horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start a horticulture business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 41-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

Evangeline has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Molo Blessed Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Beatrice, a 39 year old lady married with 2 dependants  and from Molo Blessed Group. She joined Hand in Hand in the year 2013 and undergone training on enterprise and financial management.

Her main economic activity is making ballast. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy tools thus increase production in her ballast enterprise and hence increase in sales and income. This will enable improve her living standard as she will afford to pay her house rent and feed her 2 dependents.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan in good time.

loans.use: To purchase more tools for her quarrying business hence more output and increased incomes to enable her pay house rent among others

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura está estudiándola carrera de gestión pública, también trabaja para terminar su carrera aspirando a ser una profesional competente, de esa manera obtener mejores beneficio para poder ayudar a su familia.                                                                                                                                                                                    Su aspiración es conseguir un trabajo en su profesión, seguir aprendiendo y ayudar a mi familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación y de esa forma poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Laura is studying for a career in public management and also works in order to finish her studies. She aspires to be a competent professional and thus obtain better benefits to be able to help her family. 

Her goals are to get a job in her profession, to keep learning, and to help her family. 

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to cover her degree related expenses and thus be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for degree related expenses.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Villarrica, esta estudiando didáctica universitaria, quiere poder enseñar en las universidades y compartir con las demás personas su conocimiento.
Maria es una mujer luchadora que se esfuerza por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su curso de didáctica universitaria. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de mejorar su vida.
texts.en: Maria is from the city of Villarica. She is studying University Pedagogy and wants to be able to teach in universites and share her knowledge with other people. She's a hard-working woman who pushes herself to improve her and her family's living conditions. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay the university expenses related to her field of study. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve her life.

loans.use: Pay her university costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Lourdes Marlene

texts.es:
En el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.  Se reúne cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Lourdes, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre. El marido es albañil. 
Doña Lourdes se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos por catalogo así como también bisuterías, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a recorrer tres o cuatro días a la semana y también vende en su casa, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva más de 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Ella repite el crédito, sus ganancias son para ir mejorando su hogar ya que para ella es lo más importante. Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y bisuterías. Lleva 3 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos mejora su vida. Sus sueños son tener un bebé.
texts.en:
The canton of Montecristi is know for its rich precolonial culture and its nationally and internationally recognized crafts, including its Panama hats. The loan group "24th of December" meets here every 2 weeks.
Lourdes lives here. She is 24 years old and has a common law partner. Her partner is a mason.
Lourdes has a business selling clothes and shoes from a catalog and also costume jewelry. She sells door to door and goes out selling 3 or 4 days a week and also sells from her house. She offers credit and collects every week. She has been doing this work for more than 2 years. 
She is repeating a loan. Her income goes towards improving her home as this is the most important thing to her. She will use this loan to buy clothes, shoes, and costume jewelry. She has been with the loan group for 3 years and likes it because, thanks to the loans, she can improve her life. Her dream is to have a baby.

loans.use: comprar ropa, zapatos y bisuterías.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly está estudiando licenciatura en enfermería, cursando el tercer año de la carrera, luchando por ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
Ella está luchando para poder cubrir sus gastos y salir adelante, sus aspiraciones son culminar la carrera con honores, ser una profesional destacada para servir a la sociedad y a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en: Nelly is studying for her degree in nursing. She is completing her third year in the field, struggling to become a useful professional in society. She is working hard to be able to cover her expenses and get ahea. Her goals are to graduate with honors and become a distinguished professional, serving her society and her family. She is asking for this loan so that she can cover her university expenses and be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: Pay tuition costs

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el caserío de Piquijaca, distrito de San Felipe que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Santos se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de lima, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro con más de 20 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de lima así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Santos espera ofrecer lima de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 57 years old. He lives with his partner and their children in his own house, which is made of rustic materials, in the village of Piauijaca. This is in the district of San Felipe, which can be found in the province of Jaén in the region of Cajamarca, in the mountains of the north of Peru. Life in this district is tranquil and the people mostly work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.
Santos works in agriculture, specifically cultivating limes. He has 20 years of experience in this role and has many good work and personal references in the area. The loan which he will be offered will be used to buy manure and fertilizer to care for his lime crops as well as to hire laborers for the harvest season. With this help, Santos hopes to offer higher quality limes to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level and, ultimately, will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to care for his lime crops.

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuong is 46 years old. She is married and has two children, so she works very hard to provide for them .Her family’s income is mainly from animal husbandry, cultivation and her husband is a worker, so she is able to repay the loan as scheduled.
