With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family living standard as well as environment protection.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Hta Ni Pat Village Group 1 B

texts.en:
The Featured Borrower, Maung (pictured right) is 66 years old and has five acres of crop farm in the Delta region of Myanmar. He has two children, one is studying at university while the other is working. Similar to many farmers in the area, his savings are running low before the harvest season.  Even though he has been working hard for the past few years, Maung can't save enough money to be able to do both farming and livestock.

Proximity's loan will help him purchase the necessary supplies for farming before the harvest. 

The eight group members are overseen by a CBO leader. Both the CBO leader and group members are pictured above, named Ko, Khin, Maung, Myaing, Myo and Tin. 

Hta Ni Pat Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar. Most families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary supplies for farming before the harvest.

borrowers.first_name: Hta Ni Pat Village Group 1 B

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 19 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and pensioner mother-in-law in Tsnori district. Marian and her husband want to start family business. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan for trading fruits and vegetables. 

Mariam will purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables and will resell them at higher prices. This will give her a chance to generate income and improve the living conditions of her family. She is very motivated and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trade in fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nilda works hard to support her family. She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase materials and maintenance for her coconut wine business.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials and maintenance for her coconut wine business

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 45 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three sons and one daughter. Her husband owns a butcher'sshop in the market. He has been running his butcher shop for the last eleven years. He buys calves, cows and goats and sells meat from his shop to the customers. His number of clients increases due to his good attitude towards his clients. Moreover, he is the sole earner of his family. 

So he wants to increase his income. In this way he would be able to meet his family requirements. He is a very honest shop keeper. He behaves politely to people. 

He now wants to offer chicken also to his customers. Therefore he wants to buy broilers to sell in his shop to improve his standard of living.  So Kalsoom contacted BRAC Pakistan who issued him a loan for her husband's butcher shop. 

Kalsoom is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to use this loan for her husband's butcher's shop.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 50 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries.

In the future Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Muong Phang 30 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong is 28-year-old Thai ethnic woman who is married, with three small children. They live happily in a small Thai ethnic traditional house at a remote village. Mrs. Phuong and her husband work very hard at agricultural production with plenty of activities such as cultivating rice, breeding pig, chicken, duck, fish and buffalo. 

She has always wanted to improve earnings to provide better for her children, thus, she has recently taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to have capital for investment to increase production. This is the second time she has received a loan from the Program and she will use the loan to buy baby fish to expand fish farming. She hopes that her investment will go well and help to improve significantly income for her family. 

Mrs. Phuong dreams that her children will enter good college and get a good job then have a more sufficient life. In the picture, she wears a blue shirt and stands at the first on the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish to expand fish farming

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Perla works hard to support her family. She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase materials and maintenance for her coconut wine vending.

Perla has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials and maintenance for her coconut wine vending

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Licenciatura en diseño textil, también estudia la carrera de contabilidad. 
Ella se esfuerza para poder independizarse y abrir su propio negocio y ser una diseñadora profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder abrirse camino y salir adelante.
texts.en: Zulma is currently studying for degrees in Textile Design and Accounting. She is working hard to become independent, open her own business, and be a professional designer. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her university expenses. That way, she can make a way forward for herself and get ahead.

loans.use: Pagar cuotas de universidad

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a 37 years old married woman with 8 children. She has a small plantation and grows beans and tomatoes to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Naomi has requested a loan to buy a wheel barrow, fertilizer, vegetable seeds, bush knives, rakes, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Naomi hopes to extend her business and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy rakes, wheel barrow, vegetable seeds, bush knives, weeds sprayer, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy ingredients for making various food and drink to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials so as to serve more customers by making more clothes and make more income.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 44 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Pilar works very hard to provide for them.

Pilar runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Pilar has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned foods, snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, noodles, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Pilar would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Shulamite

texts.en:
Shulamite is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Shulamite is 37 years old and has one child who is in school.

Shulamite has a food processing business in the Philippines. Shulamite requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Shulamite has been in this business for 1 year. Shulamite would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Saripa

texts.en:
Saripa is 29 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Saripa has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buy and sell dried coconut meat.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Rocel

texts.en:
Rocel is 37 years old and married with three children.

She is in an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rocel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Rocel has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Chania Shg Group

texts.en:
The person with a red stripped shirt in the photo is Paul.  He is 23 years old, and joined the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa,(HiH EA) Kiva partner in 2013 under a group by the name Chania SHG Group.  He has successfully been trained on enterprise development and record keeping by HiH EA. 

Paul started dairy farming as his main economic activity and currently has three dairy cows that produce enough milk for his family and to sell, earning him some extra income.  He has applied for a Kiva loan to buy another dairy cow to boost his enterprise.

Paul is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for making his dairy farming dream come true and promises to repay his loan with no default.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk production.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 57 years old, widowed, and has six children.

Victoria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Victoria has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Mumbu Wikurie Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Gertrude, a sixty seven years old lady, married and blessed with six children. She has undergone various training on enterprise and financial management offered by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa.

Her main economic activity is coffee farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and seedlings. This will improve productivity hence  increased income and therefore her standards of living will improve since she will afford better housing.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay on time

loans.use: To purchase more farm inputs i.e. fertilizer for more output thus be able to afford better housing

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a married man; he has a son and he lives at his own house.

Fernando is a farmer. He sells milk and makes cheese to sell at many fairs.

Fernando sells his milk to a milk plant and he needs a loan to buy a milking cow. They told him at the milk plant that they will pay him more money if he sells more milk, so that is an opportunity for Fernando.

He knows how to take care of the animals; he learned about cows when he was a kid and he hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be trustworthy.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a competitive location and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and expand business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 69 years old, married, has 4 children of adult age and lives at Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has a rice field which she cultivates for 12 years together with her husband. This business gives her profit enough to supplement the needs of her family. 

She is grateful to the financial assistance extended by Paglaum MPC. She nurtures her membership with the cooperative evident to her good record of repayments with no defaults. Currently, she avails a loan of PHP 8,000.00 to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Maa Saktimayi Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Pratibha, age 28, is a widow who lost her husband fifteen days after her marriage due to a snake bite. The lady standing in the middle in the photo is Pratibha. She is the featured borrower of Saktimayi SHG-D. She lives in the village of Garasa in Mayurbhanj district with her parents. She does not have any children.

Pratibha grows mushrooms. She has four years of experience in this field, and mushrooms are now her main source of income. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of 4,000 INR. Her opinion is that, from this small income, it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible.

So, she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of her business. Since mushrooms can be grown on nearly any type of agricultural and forest residue, they are an ideal crop for rural areas with large amounts of cultivated hectares and residue from field crops. By taking into consideration drought problems in certain regions, mushroom production could help soil and water conservation, too.

She, along with her other group members, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase straw and other inputs like fertilizers and manure, and to hire a labourer who will help her in this mushroom cultivation business so that she will get higher productivity. This will help Pratibha be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family, providing the opportunity to get ahead.

In addition, Pratibha would like a future where her business grows every day. She will be thankful to Kiva for what it does to foster business and personal growth.

loans.use: to purchase straw and other inputs like fertilizers and manure, and to hire a labourer.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 72 years old, married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lolita has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional cup and coffee for her cafeteria business.

Lolita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cups and coffee for her cafeteria business.

loans.name: Kamuti Uwezo Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Hiram, 49 years old, married and a father of three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2015 to be trained and be enlightened on prudent financial management as well as proper record keeping. He practices dairy and cereal farming as his main enterprises.

The main purpose for applying for this Kiva loan is to buy fertilizer for his cereal farming to increase his production. This will improve his living standards by enabling him buy better clothing for his family.

Hiram is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to increase his cereal production and thus be able to pay for his basic needs, such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a married man and he has a little son. Felix earns money by making cheese and he is also a mason when he has free time.

Felix wants to expand his business, so he needs a loan to buy a milking cow. Felix would like to have a car in the future to take his cheese to more towns and in that way he will make more money, but right now he hopes you can help him with the purchase of the milking cow.

Felix works hard. He has experience making cheese and he has big plans for the future.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Eliana

texts.en:
Eliana is a single woman and she lives with her parents. The house of the family is made of adobe.

Eliana makes and sells cheese. She goes with her products to many local fairs. Eliana learned how to make cheese with her parents when she was a child. 

Now she needs a loan to buy a milking cow that will be her property. Eliana would like to be an independent woman and she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama San Rafael  es un grupo nuevo, conformado por 16 integrantes, todas con la plena convicción de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia a partir del acompañamiento que se les brindará la fundación paraguaya.
La Sra. Florentina integrante de este comité, a tempranas horas de la mañana ella sale a recorrer por zonas aledañas a vender menudencias, tiene muchos clientes debido a su buen trato y amabilidad. Es una señora muy guapa, admirable su labor y sacrificio por mejorar su condición de vida y la de sus hijos.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de menudencias en cantidad, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con su pequeño emprendimiento, luchando por poder salir adelante y crecer.
texts.en:
San Rafael is a new group made up of 16 members, each strongly dedicated to improving the quality of life for themselves and their families, made possible by the assistance from Fundación Paraguaya.

Señora Florentina, a member of this group, leaves early in the morning to travel through nearby areas to sell offal. She has many customers thanks to her hard work and courtesy. She is a beautiful, remarkable woman who works hard and makes sacrifices in order to improve living conditions for herself and for her children. 

She is requesting this loan to buy offal in large quantities so that she can continue with this project and fight to move forward and grow.

loans.use: to buy offal in large quantities to sell

loans.name: Lanuola

texts.en:
Lanuola is 40 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling chicken buns, ice-cakes, cooking noodles, etc; in her community and has been doing this for 2 years.

Lanuola has requested a loan to buy boxes of noodles, bags of sugar, bags of flour, etc. She joined SPBD in July this year 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lanuola will use it to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, boxes of noodles, bags of flour, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Sreypov's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province, Sreypov is 39 years old. She has four dependent children and only one of them is in school. The sources of her family’s income rice farming and her husband's construction work. She has been involved in her job for twenty-one years. She can earn an income of about 31,000 KHR per day and she is able to save around 19,000 KHR each day after her family’s expenses. The rice price is decreasing in market, it is causing her to earn less return from her business. This is the fourth loan cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With the past loans, it helped her to have better house to stay. Due to lack of funding, Sreypov is leading a group of three members and she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide to support her farming. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income to improve her family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide to support her farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en: Mrs. Tuyen, 50 years old, is married and has four children, two of whom have a job. For more than 25 years, she has worked with grazing cattle. She chose this line of work of her own initiative and to obtain extra income. She also works in agriculture. Before, she only worked as a domestic employee. This job allowed her to raise her children and provide them with an education. The place where she keeps her cattle is six blocks away from her home. She needs the loan to buy grazing cattle and in order to take care of them, fatten them, and later sell them at a better price. She also has income from her husband's pension so she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle, in order to take care of them, fatten them, and later sell them at a better price.

loans.name: Maa Saktimayi Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Jemamani is a very active lady of 31 years. She is the one standing to the right in the photo. She lives with her son in a village named Garasa in Mayurbhanj district of Odisha. She had the opportunity to study until tenth grade in her young age. She has one son, who is studying in grade six.

Jemamani lost her husband in a road accident, two and a half years back. Now she is engaged in cultivating betel leaves. She sells the harvested products from her agribusiness to the local markets. This agribusiness supplies her with the necessary finances to provide her with clothing, food, medicine, etc.

Jemamani, along with her other group members, has applied for a loan amount of 24,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase good-quality seeds, fertilizers and agricultural inputs that will help her to have smooth cultivation of the crop.

She has a dream of providing her only son better educational facilities by investing her savings so that someday she can see her son become a doctor.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality seeds, fertilizers, and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia works as a minibus driver. She is married and is the mother of 3 kids.

Celia learned to drive when she was very young and she used to help her father. Now she has her own house and she drives to support her family. Celia's husband is also a driver.

She needs a loan to pay for the maintenance of the vehicle because it is the only one that the family has so it is very important for her to pay the maintenance. Celia's husband works at a radio taxi company but his salary is not good, so that is why Celia needs your help.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 39-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. 
Her husband is a very hard working and honest person; he owns a small restaurant in which he offers many types of delicious foods. He offers breakfast and lunch to his customers. He has been running this restaurant for many years and earning insufficient profits due to the ugly condition of his restaurant. He cooks delicious food for the restaurant and the people like to eat there. 
The condition of his restaurant is not good; it has scratched walls, low sitting arrangements, a dark room and no electricity supplies available. The customers have to face problems and feel hesitant to come inside the restaurant. He does not want to disappoint his dear customers because, due to these customers, he earns his income. 
Parveen's husband wants to establish his restaurant by redecorating it. He wants to paint the walls, provide an electricity supply, and buy new plastic furniture and new crockery.
Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can redecorate his restaurant in a good manner so that it can look attractive. 
Parveen gives thanks to Kiva and appreciates the warm support to her.

loans.use: to redecorate her husband's restaurant so it can look attractive.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a fourth born in a family of four. He cleared his secondary school in 2010 at Pumwani Boys Secondary School. He was the Finance Manager of their Junior Achievement Company Program which won the creativity award in 2010. He is currently pursuing his Law degree at Kenyatta University. Through his experience in the Junior Achievement Company Program, he managed to gain entrepreneurship skills which have encouraged him to pursue various projects to support his education. Having had an interest in music since he was young, Michael, together with 11 other members, has registered a Community Based Organization involved in nurturing musical talents in Githurai called Tel-A-Viv-Music Empire. During his spare time, Michael also engages in providing online research services. He makes, on average, KES 30,000.00 from providing online research services. In 2013, he managed to record his first album with 10 songs and one video. He is looking forward to promoting his music by producing more music videos. 
A loan of KES 100,000.00 will enable Michael to produce a second music video which will focus on promoting his brand name. Production of the video costs KES 60,000.00 and 100 promotional t-shirts cost KES 40,000.00. The promotional t-shirts will generate a profit of KES 50,000.00. By promoting his brand name, he is looking forward to performing more live shows.

loans.use: to produce his second music video and buy promotional t-shirts.

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.en:
Hikmat is 36 years old, married and the father of 3 kids. He is a refugee and lives with his parents in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement. His wife doesn’t work. He is an honest, successful, responsible person.

Hikmat is a dairy farmer. He started keeping dairy cows 12 years ago. Ever since, Hikmat has developed and grown his business steadily to a point where he is able to get more then 12 litres of milk every day that he sells to his customers. He started this business with an amount of capital.

Hikmat had taken a loan two times from Agroinvest in the past and always made on time repayments. Now he needs money and wants to buy food for his cows. He thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy food for his cows

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fátima es jefa de hogar, madre nicaragüense de 3 hijos menores de edad, uno de ellos con una discapacidad, el cual tiene que estar al cuidado de ella, por eso la iniciativa de contar con un negocio en su casa. El negocio que tiene es una tienda con más de 10 años de existir, cuenta con un local ubicado en su casa de habitación, brinda el servicio de tienda y bazar, este se llama FlamCaleb, en honor a los nombres de sus hijos. En el local se dedica a la  venta de  ropa de dama y caballero, niños, línea que desea fortalecer. Otros productos como perfumes y  otros artículos de bazar;  además brindar el servicio de fotocopia, ya que existe una escuela cercana, y en la comunidad donde reside el centro de población más cercano está a varios kilómetros, por lo que el servicio brindado cuenta con una clientela grande, dentro de la comunidad llamada  Barrio Chino.  Cuenta con  un vehículo con el que sale a colocar mercadería y cobrar, acompañada de su hijo discapacitado.  Obtiene sus artículos en varias distribuidoras en Ciudad Quesada, y en ocasiones se desplaza a San José, también la visitan en su local. Cuenta con permiso de funcionamiento, patente y está inscrita como contribuyente. Cuenta con capacitación en Plan de Negocios por parte de la Universidad Técnica Nacional.

 En lo que respecta al ingreso familiar tiene el apoyo de una pensión por la discapacidad de su hijo y beca para la pequeña que estudia. Por las características de la actividad mantiene ingresos semanales, por el cobro y la venta de mercadería, tiene el apoyo de su hija que está en secundaria, para la atención del negocio cuando ella sale de gira.
texts.en:
Fátima is the head of her household, a Nicaraguan mother of three children who are all minors, one of whom has a disability and has to remain under her care. For this reason, she started running a business out of her home which has lasted for more than ten years. It serves as a store and bazaar. She calls the store FlamCaleb, in honor of her children’s names. Here, she sells men’s, women’s, and children’s clothing, a venture she would like to strengthen. There are other products like perfumes and other housewares. Plus, she provides photocopying services, being that there is a school nearby. In the community where she lives, the closest population center is a number of kilometers away, which means the services she provides go to a large clientele within the Barrio Chino community. 

She has a vehicle with which she goes out to arrange merchandise and investments, accompanied by the child of hers who has a disability. She obtains her items from various distributors in Ciudad Quesada, and on occasion she goes to San José. They also visit her at her location. 

Fátima has an operating permit and business registration certificate, and she’s registered for tax purposes. She has also received training in business planning through Universidad Técnica Nacional. Regarding family income, she gets support from a pension for the son with a disability, as well as a grant for her youngest child, who goes to school. Her work helps her to earn weekly income, and for the arrangement of her merchandise and investments she also has the support of her daughter, who is in secondary school. She tends to the store when Fátima is away on business.

loans.use: to purchase of merchandise: men's, women's, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Guadalupe Uno Group

texts.en:
Quetzaltenango or Xela, as the locals call it, is the second largest city in Guatemala and home to over 300 groups of Friendship Bridge. Among the 300, is the recently established trust bank “Guadalupe Uno”, the group comprising of 10 women. 

Laughing alongside her fellow members sat Carmelina, the group’s lovely secretary. The beautiful mother of 4 has been with Friendship Bridge for a triumphant 10 years. Within those 10 years, Carmelina has been able to expand her business and send her children to receive the education they deserve.  Married to an “incredible man”, as she says, Carmelina runs a small shop in which she sells goods used everyday and in demand. Little by little, Carmelina hopes to continue the growth of her business to the point where she will be able to purchase a larger store in a better area. In addition to reinvesting into her store business, she wishes to purchase a new “Molino” or corn grinder, to attract other clients. 

Carmelina’s shy attitude may be deceptive at first but her well-spoken ability and robust disposition quickly dismiss any prejudice held towards her success. In inclusion to the loan she received, Carmelina, like the other 22,000 Friendship Bridge Clients, receives a monthly Non-Formal Education session that touch on many topics of personal development. This month’s session was in respect to financial literacy and the importance of preparing for any unexpected hiccups that could cripple ones finances. 

Friendship Bridge truly appreciates the confidence of Kiva investors around the world to help support the long term goal of alleviating poverty in Guatemala. Thank you Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy inventory for the most needed items in her store and so to increase her sales

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 47 años de edad, ella vive junto a su linda familia en una comunidad de Sololá.
Maria es una madre de que trabaja duro para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos económicos, ella lo hacen con el propósito de que sus hijos viva mejor, Maria es una mujer que aprovecha su tiempo, ella se levanta muy temprano para realizar sus oficios domésticos, y elaborar sus productos de bisutería (collares, pulseras entre otros), ella con el segundo crédito que tuvo en ADICLA le fue posible remodelar el techo de su casa, por lo que ahora  se encuentra en muy buenas condiciones, Maria su amor por el arte le motiva a solicitar un nuevo crédito para la compra de piedras de diferentes colores y estilos, para ofrecerle a sus clientes productos de bisutería de la mejor calidad y de buenos estilos.
Maria manifiesta que con esfuerzo y dedicación se logra alcanzar los sueños, pues ella más adelante quiere comprar más terreno para el bien de su familia.
texts.en:
María is a 47-year-old woman who lives with her beautiful family in a community of Sololá. María is a mother who works very hard to help her husband with the family income with the purpose of giving her children a better life.

María is a woman who makes good use of her time; she wakes up very early to do her household tasks and make her costume jewellery products (necklaces and bracelets among others).

Thanks to the second loan she received from ADICLA she was able to remodel the roof of her house, which is now in very good conditions. 

María's love for art motivates her to request a new loan to buy beads of different colors and styles to be able to offer her customers costume jewellery products of the highest quality and with good styles.

María says that one can achieve dreams with effort and dedication. In fact she wants to buy more land in the future for the good of her family.

loans.use: to buy costume jewellery materials.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a married woman and she has 3 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. 

Georgina operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds.

She will use the 120,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and a previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 25 years old single and supporting two of his siblings.He is first time borrower doing transport business.He has been into this business for the last three years earning a monthly income of KES.15,000.

He has applied for a loan of KES.10,000 from VFK Kapsabet to service his motorbike and plans to use the anticipated profits to help his siblings pay school fees. Joseph has future dreams of owning a vehicle in his lifetime.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Ebisiba

texts.en:
Ebisiba is aged 54 years, married to Joseph and she supports six children.She has been a dairy farmer for the last 35 years and the business earns her KES 12,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the litres of milk supplied to clients daily. 

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate her children to higher levels of education.Her hope is to eradicate poverty in her home and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the litres of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Wabepa Farmers Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Ruth, 47 years of age and a mother of five children. Ruth joined Hand in Hand in 2013 under a group by the name Wabepa Farmers and was inducted through business management skills and record keeping by Hand in Hand East Africa, (HiH EA).

Her main economic activity is goat keeping. She applied for her first loan with HiH EA which she used to buy more goats. She now has fifteen goats and has applied for a second loan from Kiva which she intends to use to expand the goat pens. 

Ruth is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support and  pomises to repay her loan with no default.

loans.use: To expand goat pens to accomodate more goats for increased income

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 50 years old and she makes money by making and selling pastries.  Jesusa needs a loan because her business is growing and she needs money to buy an industrial oven to increase the production of pastries she makes.  Jesusa is a good cook, as she learned from her mother and she has been cooking since she was a child.

She hopes you can trust her because she has a lot of customers.  Jesusa is seen in her kitchen, as you can see the place is poor, but it is clean and Jesusa will be making improvements to it.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven to expand her cooking output.

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.fr:
Suzanne est une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et il travaille en tant que chauffeur. Ils ont ensemble deux enfants, l'ainé qui a 21 ans aide sa maman dans son activité et le second est étudiant à l'université en ce moment.
Suzanne exerce une activité de vente sous-vêtements fripes, des ceintures et d'autres articles d'habillement comme nous pouvons les voir sur sa photo.
Le prêt va lui permettre de continuer à développer son commerce afin de pouvoir augmenter le revenu et construire beaucoup d'épargne.
texts.en:
Suzanne is a hard-working and resourceful 47-year old woman. She is married to a driver. She and her husband have two children: the eldest, 21 years old, helps Suzanne in her business, while the youngest is a university student at present.

Suzanne sells second-hand underwear, belts and other clothing items, as can be seen in the photo. This loan will allow her to continue developing her business in order to increase her revenues and bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Borniface

texts.en:
Borniface is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself to be reliable. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are of all kinds. 

He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a public service vehicle within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. 

This is his fourth loan  with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with 8 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes and other vegetables.  Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stocks of vegetables. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of vegetables for sale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is aged 41 years, married to Joseph and she supports two children.She has been selling tomatoes in the market for the last 10 years and the business earns her KES 10,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more stocks of tomatoes for sale to her clients and meet both client and family needs. 

She plans to gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and educate her children.Her hope is to eradicate poverty in her home and expand her business sector.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of tomatoes for sale to her clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Agua Tibia Group

texts.en:
In the rural community of San Juan Ostuncarlo, approximately 228 km from Guatemala City, where its land offers varieties in fruits and vegetables, we find the trust bank called “Agua Tibia” or, “Warm Water”. The group is comprised of 11 women who are working towards a better future for both themselves and their families. 

The women of this group are thrilled to start their first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and begin reinvesting into their businesses. Ciriaca, one of the group’s members, is a single mother of two who dedicates her time and effort to raising pigs and selling chicken meat. In order to continue her business, Ciriaca needs a loan to purchase 4 pigs and 200 lbs. of chicken to sell for wholesale and retail in her local market. With the money she makes from her business she hopes to invest into her children’s future by providing for them a proper education.

Ciriaca, and the rest of the members, appreciate the support and confidence from the many people who invest in Kiva. These women are inspiring individuals who are creating development through their small businesses.

loans.use: to purchase 4 pigs and 200 lbs. of chicken to sell for wholesale and retail

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
This is Rosanna. She is busy operating her direct-selling business. She sells different kinds of products- mostly, personal product sales like soaps, lotion, perfumes and the like. She entered in this kind of trade 6 years ago and now she gains well from this. She was introduced to CCT 8 years ago and her membership here guided her in propagating her direct-selling business. Today, the profit she gets from the business becomes a great help for their family basically in terms of their daily expenses. 

To further improve the business, she wants to ask again from you a new loan amounting to 50 000 PHP loan which she will use for buying more products to sell. With this, she can surely gain more income in which part of it will be saved for future investments. 

You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness. 

Rosana meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: for buying more products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
This is Nena, 55, from Caloocan City and she currently runs a sari-sari store business.

Sari-sari store is often seen everywhere in the Philippines, most especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is most likely a convenience store, but quite a sort of smaller than the usual and offers only limited products which are commonly needed such as toiletries, food, instants, beverages and other commodities. Unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at low-cost and in a retail basis, which is really an advantage for the customers.

To improve her sales, Nena likes to ask help from you. She likes to borrow a loan worth PHP 16,000 that she would use to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store. With this, she expects to grow her sales and provide a better remedy for their family’s daily living condition. And, today, you can be a big part of her life. 

Rest assured that what you will entrust to her will create a better cause because like once quoted, "a woman who walks in purpose doesn't have to chase people or opportunities. Her light causes people and opportunities to pursue her." 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store.

loans.name: Miswalehe

texts.en:
Miswalehe, a divorced mother of one, describes herself as reliable. For five years now she has been operating a retail business,  located in a residential area, that sells cashew nuts. 

Her previous two loans from SMEP Microfinance Bank repaid, Miswalehe will use this Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of cashew nuts. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy more cashew nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Someone has rightly said “Luck is something when preparation and opportunity meet.” This statement is rightly justified when we meet Bhagabati, who lives in Mahudipa village in Keonjhar district of Odisha. Bhagabati, age 26, is a single mother. She lives with her two children. Her husband left her two years ago. Bhagabati is standing in the middle in the photograph.

She is a very industrious woman who prepares toys for children and sells them in the nearby market. Life was really difficult during those days when they hardly managed to make both ends meet, remembers Bhagabati. But, when her final preparation met the opportunity provided by Kiva's partner Peoples Forum, her days changed. She availed herself of the opportunity by forming Maa Saraswati SHG-C Group. She, along with her other group members, have requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will invest her portion of the loan amount judiciously to expand her small business and succeed in it.

She and her group members want to be a vibrant example of those who have the power to change their own luck; their own fate.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Roini

texts.en:
Roini is 40 years old. He lives in Kareli with his wife, 2 daughters and pensioner parents. Roini gets orders and renovates old furniture. 

He has requested credit to finance the costs of constructing a dam, which he will build in his garden. Roini will purchase local species of fish and raise them in a pond. Beginning in the spring season, the fish will start to spawn, then they can be intensively sold. 

He expects that development of the fish farm will raise the income of the family. Part of the increase in income will be reinvested in the same business and the other part will be used for improving the living conditions of the family. Roini awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a fish farm

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.en:
In Chichicastenango, Guatemala, 8 women come together requesting their first loan from Kiva. The group holds the mutual objective to fortify and amplify their business to places they otherwise would not be able to reach without such a loan. The group of women call themselves “Nueva Luz” or, New Light which for them, it signifies hope to grow and personally develop to give support to their loving families.

In average, the women only have a total of 3 years of formal education, they dedicate themselves to: selling firewood, textile processing, sale of food, and the sale of flowers. Francisca, a member of the group, she is 29 years old, and she is married with 4 children. It has been 2 years since she started her business of selling flowers and the production of hats, because her business is potentially profitable, 

Francisca needs more capital to increase sales. She hopes to acquire a new loan so that she may better expand her business to a wider variety of flowers to sell and a deeper selection of materials to make her hats with so that she may broaden out and reach all types of clients. Francisca is ecstatic to be a part of “Nueva Luz” and receive a loan from Kiva partners around the world. 

Francisca, and the rest of her group, are eternally grateful for the confidence and support of Kiva investors. Thank you for your confidence in the development of Guatemalan women!

loans.use: to buy flowers for sale

loans.name: Shree Jagatnath Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Nandita, standing on the right in the photo, is the featured borrower of Shree Jagatnath SHG-B Group. She is a single mother of a fifteen-year-old daughter who is currently pursuing her studies in a secondary school.

Raising her daughter alone was never easy for Nandita. She had to face a lot of hurdles and hardships after her husband left her and her daughter alone three years back. But, Nandita never gave up. Her strong willpower and determination made her strong enough to start her own food stall. She has experience of two years in this business.

Nandita, along with her group member Sanjulata, is requesting a loan amount of 24,000 INR. Nandita will use her portion of the loan amount in order to renovate the rooftop of her food stall, which is damaged due to heavy rain and hailstorms.

Nandita aspires to start a multi-cuisine restaurant in the near future and serve her customers with tasty dishes.

loans.use: to renovate the rooftop of her food stall.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.en:
Santusa is mother of four who is healthy and has the chance to make more money for her family. As a traveling saleswoman, Santusa has the chance to know what kind of products she can sell. She wants to sell bleach and she needs your support to buy it.

Santusa is also having troubles at her home as she and her husband decided to divorce so now she is practically alone. That is why she hopes you can help her again with another loan.

loans.use: to buy bleach to sell.

loans.name: Abateganya Group

texts.en:
Joy is a group leader of ABATEGANYA aged 41. She is married with three children aged between 5 and 19 years all of them go to school. The group name means savings in English and they sell different items all of them have same idea to improve their business for the better living. 

She owns a shop and has been running in a business for the four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, salt,soap and biscuits for sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and make savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt,soap and biscuits for selling.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is a happily married man with three children, and he works as an employee at a hotel. Jorge made a lot of effort to buy land and do the paperwork to be a legal owner.

He needs a loan to build up rooms at his land because he wants to rent the rooms to make more money. He hopes you can help him because he is doing everything he can to give his family a better life.

In the photo, Jorge is at his house. As you can see the place is small so he is making a sacrifice to build up the rooms.

loans.use: to build up rooms at his land

loans.name: Lugazi Homeland College

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Stephen. He is the Principal Director of Lugazi Homeland School, a mixed school of with 900 students in the urban area of Lugazi.

Lugazi Homeland School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Lugazi Homeland School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Stephen ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Furniture Group

texts.en:
This is forty-eight year old Fatmata; she is married and has three children. Fatmata belongs to a solidarity group of four women who have come together to complement each other achieve their individual dreams. “Furniture” is the name of Fatmata’s solidarity group. The group needs a total loan of 4,000,000SLL of which Fatmata will receive 1, 000,000SLL in order to buy 5 cartons of fish and 150 loaves of bread for her food business.

Fatmata established her business in 2000 to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs. Fatmata uses profit from this business to provide livelihood for her family and support her children’s education. Fatmata is a hardworking women. She opens her business Monday through Saturday from 7 am to 6 pm every week.

See Fatmata in the left of the picture of the group picture. In the future, Fatmata plans to support her children to acquire a university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fish and loaves of bread for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, Irish potatoes, and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santo Domingo está en su ciclo número 4º del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo muy trabajador y emprendedor, que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo unido. 
La Sra. Liliana se dedica a la venta de comestibles, bebidas,  helados, golosinas en una cantina, ella está muy contenta porque con el préstamo que pide, podrá comprar verduras, carne, condimentos, bebidas varias, y otros productos para poder seguir con sus ventas. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que con sacrificio y esmero ha ido mejorando y progresando. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día y ofrecer lo mejor a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group named Santo Domingo is in its 4th loan cycle with the women's committee program. It is a hardworking and enterprising group that strives to get ahead and help their families by working together. 

Liliana sells groceries, drinks, ice cream and candy at a snack bar. She is very happy because with the loan she is requesting she will be able to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, various drinks and other products to continue her sales. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who, with sacrifice and care, has been improving and progressing. She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to improve every day and be able to offer the best to her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, various beverages and other products.

loans.name: Matotoka Group

texts.en:
Umu is a 33-year-old business woman. She is a member of “Matotoka” solidarity group. “Matotoka” solidarity group has three members of two women and one man.

Umu has been in palm oil business selling to the general public for the past eight years. She opens her business six days in a week from 8am to 6pm. She established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material and provide food from the profit she gets from her business.

Umu and her group members needs a loan totaling 5,000,000 SLL of which she is entitled to 2,000,000 SLL to buy 20 more gallons of palm oil for her business. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Umu is married and has three children who are both school going children.

In the feature, Umu plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Umu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Kyrey  está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo que se unió para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias. Todas  se han propuesto  a realizar actividades   para llegar poder salir adelante.
La Sra. Lidia se dedica a la venta de comestibles y chipa, ella está muy contenta por formar parte del grupo, ya que por medio de las capacitaciones podrá ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar y crecer cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comestibles, como verduras, carne, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas, almidón, queso y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This is the Kuña Kyrey group's first cycle in the women's committee program. The group came together in order to grow and improve living conditions for themselves and their families. They have all taken a decision to do jobs that will help them get ahead. 

Lidia sells groceries and traditional cheese buns, and she is very happy to be part of the group because she has been able to improve her living conditions and the well-being of her loved ones thanks to the training. Lidia is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to develop and grow every day. She is requesting this loan to buy to buy supplies such as vegetables, meat, condiments, baked goods, starch, cheese and more to make food and meals.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, baked goods, starch, cheese and other supplies to make meals.

loans.name: Nurillahon

texts.ru: Нуриллахон, 39 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Дети активно помогают матери. В хозяйстве Нуриллахон на сегодняшний день есть 4 коровы, лошадь, а также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 0,78 ГА, она выращивает арбузы. Ежемесячный доход Нуриллахон составляет 13,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец, часть средств направит на покупку удобрений. Доходы от бизнеса помогут развить бизнес и построить сараи для скота.
texts.en:
Nurillahon is 39 years old, married and the mother of six children. She has vocational education and has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation for many years. Her children actively help her with this. 

Nurillahon currently has four cows and a horse on her farm. She also has 0.78 hectares of own land where she grows watermelon. Nurillahon's monthly income is 13,800 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase five sheep. Part of the money will also be directed to purchasing fertilizers. The income from the business helps developing it and building a livestock barn.

loans.use: to purchase five sheep and fertilizers for land cultivation, in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Twuzuzanye Cb Group

texts.en:
Antoinette is a group leader; aged 39 years. She is married with three children aged between ten and 16 years. The group is called TWUZUZANYE means “WORK TOGETHER” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

Antoinette owns a bar and has been running in a business for 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rice and palm oil.

loans.name: Tunuk

texts.ru: Тунук, 54 года, мать 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 37 лет назад. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец, на 0,77 Га земли она выращивает пшеницу и клевер для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и дальнейшего разведения с целью увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Тунук планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и свадьбы сыновей.
texts.en:
Tunuk is 54 years old and has five children. She has received secondary education. As a source of income for her family Tunuk raises livestock and grows farm crops, having launched this business 37 years ago. On her farm Tunuk has two cows and 10 sheep.  She grows wheat and clover for sale  On a field of 0.77 ha [2 acres]

In order to develop her business further, Tunuk has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 50,000 soms (KGS) to buy cattle to raise and breed so as to increase her livestock headcount. Tunuk plans to invest her resulting revenues in a further growth of her farm as well as to pay for her sons' weddings.

loans.use: to buy some cattle in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Ashimbek

texts.ru: Ашимбек, 53 года, женат, 2 детей. В качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 8 лет назад с суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, Ашимбека, на сегодняшний день он имеет 2 коровы, 14 овец. Также 0,96 ГА собственной земельной доли, на которой выращивает картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ашимбек обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетелей в целях увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Ашимбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Ashimbek is 53 years old, married and has two children. As an income for his family, he works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started eight years ago with an amount of 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistent work, Ashimbek currently has two cows and 14 sheep. He also has 0.96 hectares of own land, on which he grows poptatoes.

With an aim to further develop his business, Ashimbek turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase two heifers to increase his herd. Ashimbek plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing his business.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers in order to increase his herd

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sell.

loans.name: The Investors Group

texts.en:
Maligie is a member of The Investor Solidarity Group. He is single with no children. (Maligie is in the middle of the group picture).

Eight years ago Maligie established his electronics business to support himself. He sells six days per week from 9am to 6pm. Magilie plans to use the loan to buy additional electronics for resale.

He will use the proceeds from the business to open savings account which will be used in developing himself. Maligie plans to build a house and live a happy life.

Maligie and his group members need a loan totaling 3,000,000 SLL of which he is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL.

Maligie and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional electronics for resale.

loans.name: White Coke Group

texts.en:
Fatmata, who is 35 years old, was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people. She is married and has two children who both attend school. Fatmata belongs to a solidarity group of five women who have come together to help each other achieve their individual dreams. White Coke is the name of Fatmata’s solidarity group. White Coke group needs a total loan of 5,000,000 SLL, of which Fatmata will receive 1,000,000 SLL in order to purchase different types of rubber bowls and dozens of dish sets for her business.

Fatmata trades in plastic/rubber bowls and dish sets in a rented shop right in the city centre of Freetown. Her business, which has been in existence for over five years, is the main source of her livelihood. She uses her income to provide for the needs of her family and her children's education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week, from 7 am to 6 pm. Fatmata is a hardworking woman.

In the future, Fatmata plans to support her children to acquire a University education. She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman. She will be very appreciative to anyone that can help. She thanks you for supporting her group. Fatama is in the middle of the group picture.

loans.use: to purchase different types of rubber bowls and dozens of dish sets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more juice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, corn, chickens, spices, etc. to improve sales in her business.

loans.name: Kuarahy Rese Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Kuarahy Rese  es un grupo antiguo actualmente  con 17 integrantes, todas con ganas de poder salir adelante e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Casiana, es una de las integrantes de este comité, se dedica a la venta de deliciosas chipas, un alimento típico paraguayo, que ella hace desde su propia casa y también por las tardes sale a ofrecer por la zona, cuenta con muchos clientes. Nos cuenta que en esta época de invierno tiene muchas ventas, ya que la gente encara este frío con un cocido o café bien caliente acompañando con unas sabrosas chipas.
Pide este préstamo para poder seguir con la producción de su chipa y poder comprar insumos varios para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo y poder cumplir con sus clientes.
En la foto hay 17 personas ya que el grupo tiene 17 miembro, pero solo 14 de ellas piden este préstamo, y las otras 3 firman como integrantes solidarias.
texts.en:
The committee called "Kuarahy Rese" is a long-standing group that currently has 17 members, all with a desire to be able to support themselves and improve their living conditions.

Señora Casiana is one of the members of this committee. She earns her living selling delicious "chipas" [small cheesy rolls], a traditional Paraguayan food that she makes in her own house; she also goes out selling them throughout the area in the afternoons. She has many customers. She tells us that during the winter season, she has a lot of sales because the people face the cold with a nice hot infusion or coffee accompanied by some tasty chipas.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to continue with the production of her chipas and to be able to buy various supplies so that she can continue selling, as she has been doing, and meeting her customers' expectations.

In the photo, there are 17 people, as the group has 17 members, but only 14 of them are requesting this loan. The other three cosign as supporting members.

loans.use: to buy various supplies for making "chipas" [cheesy rolls]

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweet cheese poundcakes, pudding, coconut and chocolate doughnuts, rice cookies, balloons, disposable plates and cups and other products for his business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, at 52, is a hardworking and opportunistic woman whose goal is to attain a decent standard of living. Rose is married and has seven children. She is also a grandmother and has three grandchildren whom she takes care of. Both Rose and her husband are entrepreneurs. They are small scale commercial broiler farmers. The couple is also involved in winter cropping whereby they grow vegetables and sweet corn. Returns combined from both enterprises amount to 300 USD.

However, seasonal changes are affecting the growth of the business. Due to erratic rains which affect the water table, the output level in terms of winter cropping turns out to be very low. On the other hand in terms of broiler production, when there are no events taking place, especially celebration functions, demand becomes low and cash flow tend to be slow which results in less profit.

As a hard worker, Rose says it is time to have multiple sources of generating income and her eyes are set on a pig enterprise. Therefore, she is looking for capital to venture into a pig enterprise. This loan to her is a bridge to attaining her dream of becoming a pig farmer. Initially Rose and her husband wanted to invest in a piggery, but due to lack of capital, they decided to venture into broiler production whose initial investment on a small scale is low.

The loan will enable Rose to buy pigs, receive training on how best she can sustainably raise the pigs and acquire marketing skills. The pigs to be received will serve as breeding stock and the offspring will be sold to generate income for her household. Her vision after completing repayment of the loan is to expand her business and become a reliable supplier of pork to hotels.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid pigs, cement for kraal construction and receive training in pig production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy small appliances amongst other items.

loans.name: Shree Jagatnath Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Manorama, age 48 years, is a widow. She is standing on the extreme right in the photograph. She is a resident of Erendai village of Keonjhar district. Her only daughter got married one year back. She lives with her old mother-in-law, who often remains ill due to her age factor.

Manorama has been engaged in selling milk for the last six years. The monthly income that she generates after selling milk is not enough to meet the household expenses as well as the medical expenses of her sick mother-in-law.

So Manorama, along with her other two group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Manorama will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase one more cow, which will result in higher milk sales and ultimately will add to her income.

Manorama wants to provide the best treatment to her ill mother-in-law so that she will be able to live the rest of her life in a healthy way.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Box Office Group

texts.en:
Dora is a thirty-six year old business woman and a member of the Box Office solidarity group; there are four other members all of whom are women. Dora sells drinks. She has been in this business for the past five years and has her business open six days a week from 8am to 6pm. 
Dora established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material and provides food from her profits. Dora is in the middle of the group picture.
Dora and her group members needs a loan totaling 5,000,000 SLL of which she is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL to buy 7 cartons of soft drinks, 5 cartons of maltina etc for her business.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Dora is married and has 4 children ages 16, 12, 6 and 2 all of whom are in school.
In the future, Dora plan to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.
Dora is very appreciative of anyone who can help her.

loans.use: to buy 7 cartons of soft drinks, 5 cartons of maltina etc

loans.name: Full Payment Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is a forty-seven year old business woman. She is a member of the Full Payment solidarity group. The Full Payment solidarity group has five members, all of which are women. Fatmata sells dry fish.
Fatmata has been in the dry fish business for the past 10 years. Her business is open six days a week from 9am to 6pm. Fatmata is shown in the middle of the group picture.
Fatmata established her business to help support her children in school.  She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food from her profits.
Fatmata and her group members needs a loan totaling 5,000,000 SLL of which Fatmata is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL which she will use to buy additional cartons of dry fish for her business.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Fatmata is married and has 5 children aged 32, 22, 18, 14 and 11 who are all in school.
In the future, Fatmata plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education and to expand her business. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.
Fatmata and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional cartons of dry fish for her business

loans.name: Sobhana Priyadarshini Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Pankajini, age 32, standing in the middle in the photo, is the featured borrower of Sobhana Priyadarshini SHG-C Group. She lives with her husband and three daughters in Chuhapali village of Koraput district. She is characterized by her sense of responsibility, her hardworking attitude, and her dreams of self-improvement.

Her husband is a farmer who cultivates green vegetables. Pankajini also helps her husband in the field to cultivate the crops. The income that is generated after selling the cultivated vegetables is used to meet the overall household expenses.

Pankajini, along with her other two group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to install a hand pump in order to overcome the problems that are caused due to irregular water supply in her locality.

Pankajini plans to start mushroom cultivation in order to add to her income and repay all her debts in the very near future.

loans.use: to install a hand pump.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lobster claws (type of clasp), spring rings (type of clasp), barrels (type of clasp), "s" hooks, magnets, leather, chamois cloth, thread/cord, waxed thread, tape or ribbon, chains, buying cattle hair, wood, etc.

loans.name: Los Triunfadores De Quellouno Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS TRIUNFADORES DE QUELLOUNO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quellouno, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladis ella es conviviente y tiene 42 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Los Triunaddores de Quellouno” communal bank. This communal bank is located in the district of Quellouno, in the province of La Convención, in the department of Cusco.

Gladis lives with her partner. She is 42 years old and has 2 children. She works in her restaurant business. She makes different meals, such as baked chicken, soup, and beef with vegetables. She works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She has been in this business for 8 years and it’s going very well for her. Her dream is to own a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy products for her kitchen, such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The other members have businesses selling animals, selling clothing, small grocery stores, and selling food. 

Gladis is grateful to those who are a part of this dream through this institution and she pledges to make her repayments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy products for her kitchen, such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Rina Esteli

texts.es: Rina de 52 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo, su hija de 32 años y una nieta de 2 años de edad, ella tiene un comedor frente a una iglesia cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace quince años, es un lugar bien transitado por muchas personas  por lo que tiene mucha clientela por vender sus platos de comida a un buen precio además de ser muy exquisitos, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar y  ayudar a su esposo a mantener la economía del mismo. Rina está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de ingredientes para elaborar sus alimentos como: arroz, pollo, carnes, verdura, fruta, especias, maíz, frijoles, etc. Para poder aumentar la producción de su negocio  y tener mejores ingresos que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia
texts.en:
Rina is 52 years old and lives in her own home with her spouse, 32-year-old daughter and 2-year-old granddaughter.  She has had a dining area in front of a church near their place of residence for the last fifteen years.  It is a place well traveled by many people, so she has many customers to sell her dishes at a good price, in addition to being very delicious.  With the income that she earns at her work, she has managed to cover some of the costs of home and help her spouse with the home finances.   

Rina is requesting a loan from FUSAI for the purchase of ingredients to make her dishes, such as rice, chicken, meat, vegetables, fruit, spices, corn, beans, etc. This loan will help her increase production at her business, and to have better income to allow her to have a better quality of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, meat, vegetables, fruit, spices, corn, beans, etc. to increase production at her business.

loans.name: Fanta Group

texts.en:
Nancy is 30-years-old and is married with three children. All of her children go to school. Nancy belongs to a solidarity group of five women who have come together to help each other achieve their individual dreams. Fanta is the name of Nancy’s solidarity group. The Fanta group needs a total loan of 5,000,000SLL. Nancy will receive 1,000,000SLL which will help her to buy five gallons of cooking oil, half a bag of onions, 1 carton of chicken and more for her business.
Nancy established her food business in 2009; she established the business to ensure her family has enough money for their basic needs.  Nancy uses the profits from this business to provide a livelihood for her family and to support her children’s education.  Her business is open Monday through Saturday from 7am to 6pm of every week. Nancy is shown in the middle of the group picture.
In the future, Nancy plans to support her children in order to get a university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman. She thanks you for supporting her group.
